column1: 5603e2c1-a512-4185-a206-01feaa7ef695,175021835,TD Bank Group,Data Engineer Intern/Co-op,on_site,"Toronto, ON",2022-12-08T17:24:02.501Z,"<div class=""jobdetail-desc"" id=""gtm-jobdetail-desc"">
All companies are not the same. What makes TD special as a business is also, what makes us special as an employer.
TD’s Colleague Promise: A better you. A better us.
A more confident you means a stronger us. We empower you to grow your skills, gain new perspectives, and create impact at work and in your community. That’s our unique and inclusive culture.

Co-op and Internship opportunities allow you to gain valuable work experience across several businesses at TD. You
will work with experienced colleagues, receive world class training, and be part of a community of students across
TD, where you will have an impact, grow as individual and experience our culture of care.

Our Co-op/Intern Programming is offered with select Co-op and Internship roles and is designed to help you better
understand the TD business, build on critical career capabilities, and broaden your professional network. This
program is designed to complement your on-the job experience and features:
• Leadership talks with key Leaders from across the organization
• Lunch and Learns on topics such as Innovation
• Diversity and Inclusion and Personal Branding and so much more

You will have the opportunity to work with one of our various teams within the Technology group, specifically working
on TD’s big data platform (Data-as-a-service or DaaS). Job responsibilities for a Data Engineer Intern/Co-op may
vary by area. They may include, but are not limited to the following:
• Apply Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Project Management Methodology (PMLC) to complete specific development tasks for projects
• Ensure defect-free programming by testing and debugging using available/appropriate tools and participate in reviewing peer coding
• Document system deployment plans for system implementation and code deployment
• Participate in Proof-of-Concept (POC) on new technologies and document findings
• Perform root-cause analysis and resolution of application defects
• Adhere to standard security coding practices to ensure application is free of coding vulnerabilities

• Continuously enhance knowledge/expertise and keep current with leading-edge technologies trends/developments and develop expertise in TD services, applications, infrastructure, analytical tools and techniques that can contribute to effective solution development/delivery
• Currently enrolled in a relevant technology programs, such as Computer Science, Engineering, Information
• Technology Management, Financial Analysis and Risk Management, Computing, etc.
• Familiarity with at least one of the following technologies: Java, Scala, Python, Pyspark, or SQL

• Practical experience/knowledge of data generation, data masking, data subsetting, data archiving, data virtualization, project management, management reporting, data modelling, and/or database development
• Test Data Tools Knowledge (CA TDM or Delphix)
• Familiarity with source code management such as GIT
• A thirst for constantly exploring emerging technology
<li>Skills that would be an asset, but not required<ul>
• Familiarity with Data Warehousing, ETL, ELT concepts
• Familiarity with Pandas, Numpy Scikit-learn, Matplotlb, Ruby, Linux
• Interest or aptitude in Financial Systems and the Financial Industry

Please note that this is a general posting. If you are selected for an interview, more information regarding
which business group and the specific job duties will be provided.
• This position is a 4-month work term and will commence May 1 – August 25th, 2023.
<li>Applications must include a resume (maximum of 2 pages). We welcome all applications

column2: >At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

column1: The Expert Data Engineering is responsible for building, managing, and optimizing data pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers, shaping the enterprise Data as a Service (DaaS) model and delivering on IT business models. The Expert Data Engineering develops best practices and optimizes data pipelines to deliver products and services aligned with business expectations. The incumbent plays a pivotal role in operationalizing data and analytics initiatives, defining and building CN’s data integration and DaaS platform roadmap.

column3: > Ensure optimal data delivery architecture and processes are consistent throughout ongoing projects
> Optimize CN’s data architecture to support the next generation of products and data initiatives
> Build, manage, and optimize data pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers such as business or data analysts and data scientists
> Build data and domain event models, implement business rules, and engineer scalable data pipelines
> Ensure compliance with data governance and security requirements while creating, improving and operationalizing integrated and reusable data pipelines
> Enable faster data access, integrate data reuse, and improve time-to-solution for data and analytics initiatives
> Integrate analytics and data science results with business processes
> Collaborate with stakeholders and architects to model data landscape and define secure data exchange approaches
> Meet with stakeholders to identify fit-for-purpose within CN’s existing data ecosystem and deliver options and agile solutions
> Design and develop processing pipelines that ingest data into Data Hubs
> Expose the data into meaningful formats, like GraphQL
> Provide day-to-day support and technical expertise to both technical and non-technical teams
> Participate in building data engineering expertise and framework
> Acquire, ingest and process data from multiple sources and systems
> Design and develop Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) pipelines using multiple sources of data in various formats
> Conduct metadata management, data cleansing and preparation
> Use Agile methodologies to streamline project delivery aligned with goals, timelines, and budget
> Build monitoring and debugging tools to analyze data pipelines
> Help unify software development and operations seamlessly, efficiently, and cost effectively
> Improve software quality, automate processes, and accelerate software releases
> Use Agile development practices for code reviews and testing to develop and deliver data pipelines
> Develop and implement test plans and scripts for various data quality processes

column2: >CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

We are looking for a Technical Lead - ML Engineering to join our growing R&D team! Reporting to the Engineering Manager, you will run our end-to-end machine learning platform, from research to production ML models. You are well-versed in the nuances of the machine learning lifecycle and have a clear approach to measuring the improvement of our ML systems and their peers' workflows. The technical lead role is a unique expansion of the scope of a Senior ML engineer that takes on multiple facets of technical leadership, team building, and building our technical roadmap. You can expect to collaborate with your ML teammates and folks from MLOps, Data, and Science teams.
BenchSci is a remote-first organization. At this moment, we are welcoming applicants from Canada, the US and the UK for this position.
• Design, build, evaluate and deploy robust, scalable, and production-ready ML models that enhance the speed and quality of life-saving research
• Partner with the Engineering Manager and other Tech Leads to recruit and build the team
• Lead or consult the authoring of engineering design proposals following the unified Platform Stream roadmap at BenchSci
• Drive core components of our technical roadmap
• Facilitate and make technical decisions in forums
• Help define best practices based on personal industry experience and research across the Machine Learning team
• Lead sprint planning, estimations, and code + design reviews
• Oversee the solutions and long-term technology investments to inspire technical creativity at BenchSci
• 4+ years of experience working as a professional developer applying machine learning techniques to solve business problems
• Experience with NLP (ideally including NER) and PyTorch
• Experience with designing, building, and evaluating scalable production-ready ML models
• Experience with complex problem solving and an eye for details such as scalability and performance of a potential solution
• Experience with data manipulation and processing, such as SQL or pandas
• Experience with building functional, production-level models in the cloud
• A desire to see teammates succeed together

column1: e6b728a8-9052-4bd3-9499-fa2dd10cd093,176655741,Scotiabank,"Senior Manager, Data Ethics Design & Delivery",on_site,Canada : Ontario : Toronto,2022-12-12T17:22:04.125Z,"<div class=""joblayouttoken displayDTM""> <div class=""inner fontcolorb6a533a1"" style=""font-family:Arial , Helvetica , sans-serif

column3:
>Requisition ID: 169222

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

column1:
The CIDA team at Scotiabank is at the forefront of the journey to transform the Bank into a data centric organization through a cloud-first strategy, well governed data and innovative analytics to deliver impactful customer insights. The award-winning Data Ethics & Use team, an integral part of CIDA, is helping to drive this transformation by helping the organization embed data ethics into the cultural fabric. The key focus areas are the way data is used, shared, and accessed at an enterprise level.
The Data Ethics & Use team is industry leading in the field of operationalizing the ethical use of data, including responsible AI. The aim is to provide transparent, robust, and ethical data practices across the enterprise to enhance the protection of our customers’ data, and the way we deliver business value. We are looking to build our delivery team with innovators, forward thinker, technically savvy agile leaders who will continue driving the advancement of data ethics.
The role of the Senior Manager, Design and Delivery, Data Ethics & Use will:

• Be the product owner for our Data Ethics & Use tools and technologies
• Be viewed as a leader for data ethics technology by key partners, including our Business, Analytics, Enablement, Architecture, Technology, Information Security, Privacy, Data and AI Risk, Legal, teams, etc to name a few
• Own the data ethics technical strategy and roadmap on an annual basis
• Lead definition, development, planning, execution, and implementation of industry leading data ethics tools and processes
• Enable the Bank’s adoption of the data ethics tools on a global scale (including International Banking)
• Lead a high-performance team, with focus on coaching and development

• Identify industry best practices to contribute to the design of the data ethics function to maintain the industry leading position Scotiabank holds as it pertains to data ethics
• Work closely with Governance and Operations Pillar and Education and Partnerships Pillar to create a comprehensive, holistic, sustainable and customer centric data ethics strategy, and the associated tools and processes that enable the delivery of that strategy
• Design (or contribute to the design) of data ethics tools and processes and related automation, including other enterprise tools and processes supporting the data ethics mandate
column2:
designs must be cloud compatible/scalable
• Liaise with Data Office, Enablement and Enterprise Technology teams to design, develop, and implement data ethics tools, including managing the delivery risk
• Work with various stakeholders in a matrix organization
• Manage the SCRUM process and Kanban board for the projects
• Create project plans, maintain JIRA board and Confluence, as needed
• Create acceptance criteria for features being released and perform UAT testing to ensure acceptance criteria are met
• Ensure timely delivery and successful adoption of data ethics tools and processes
• Work with the Education and Partnership team to design and deploy user interfaces to support successful delivery of automation and education-based tooling
• Design and deploy an analytics suite to support throughput optimization of data ethics processes by identifying and tracking slippage and anomalies in an automated fashion, working with the Governance and Operations team to incorporate requirements
• Review, address and incorporate user feedback into our tools and processes, as required
• Work with the Governance and Operations team to design solutions to mitigate pain points in operational throughput
• Create and update procedural artifacts to support the rollout and operationalization of data ethics tools and processes (Governance and Operations has accountability over the process)
• Provides advice, counsel, and process enhancements for Data & Analytics with respect to tools and procedures that incorporate the Data Ethics tools, for example, within Universal Catalogue
• Ensure consistency and alignment on best practices across the organization.
• Manage the enterprise data sensitivity dictionary and partner with internal stakeholders to ensure proper usage and timely updates
• Work closely with representatives across the bank to ensure all activities are conducted in compliance with internal policies & procedures and emerging governing regulations
• Develop strong working relationships with partners across the organization, to ensure consistency and alignment on best practices
• Review business stakeholders’ implementation of data ethics framework for quality assurance and compliance
• Track and report on process performance and adherence, identifying areas of improvement and recommending practical and innovative solutions
• Participate in planning and retrospective sessions, attend stand-ups, etc. - we work in an agile environment
• Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
• Lead a high-performance team-this is a people manager role where development and coaching is a focus
• Champion a high-performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment, communicating vison/values/business strategy and managing succession and development planning for the team

column1: • 5+ years of experience in business/financial services
column2:
or a post-secondary education in computer sciences, programming, or a similar vocation
• Strong technical acumen
• Project management skills in order to handle diverse projects, often simultaneously, and meet aggressive deadlines
• Worked in (or at the very least has a very strong understanding of) agile and/or scrum
• A high level of interpersonal and presentation skills at all levels including the Executive Management Level
• Able to work in a matrixed organization that has multiple stakeholders
• Ability to present ideas and facilitate discussions to build consensus at all levels
• Strong communication skills, both written and spoken, and an ability to convey technical concepts into “layman terms”
• Results orientation and pragmatic approach to decision-making
• Ability to work independently and solve complex problems through a collaborative style
• Self-motivated, solution driven individual and adaptable to a fast-paced environment

Location: Ottawa, Canada

Thales people architect identity management and data protection solutions at the heart of digital security. Business and governments rely on us to bring trust to the billons of digital interactions they have with people. Our technologies and services help banks exchange funds, people cross borders, energy become smarter and much more. More than 30,000 organizations already rely on us to verify the identities of people and things, grant access to digital services, analyze vast quantities of information and encrypt data to make the connected world more secure.

We are currently recruiting for a talented Cloud Database Administrator to provide support of this complex state-of-art solution. This role will provide you with the opportunity to learn the latest IT solutions and security concepts, within a like-minded supportive talented team.

Thales offers global cloud-based authentication services for high-profile customers with the most versatile and highest security practices implemented. We provide identity and access management services to thousands of customers worldwide
• Analyze product requirements and identify the best database solution, technology, and tool.
• Ensure database consistency of the projects by resolving any constraints.
• Develop database installation and upgrade script, which is part of CI/CD.
• Provide workload estimation of customization, features, and component level.
• Forecast, inform risk/concern on task, team, or project level, and propose mitigation plans.

• Provide technical solutions, support, and perform several activities for a new or customized database of products/components used in the project which includes but is not limited to database design, installation, upgrade, migration, backup, recovery, failover, HA, hardening, monitoring, etc.
• Orchestrate and optimize the database activities of several databases, schemas, and components in one project or solution.
• Strategize and plan for data migration, and develop data migration script if required by the project.

column3: >solutions/workarounds for production issues related to the database.

column1: • Provide documentation as appropriate including design documentation, comments in code, and end-user documentation
• Consult with other technical team members and management on industry best practices.
• Provide input to improve the scalability and reliability of infrastructure to our Automation Architects
• Deploy and assist with the maintenance of automation technologies
• Participate in the on-call schedule & Provide L2/L3 Support to our Services desk and R&D teams
• Document all build and run procedures when implementing new automation technologies.
• 5+ years experience in Cloud Native database technologies including RDS,MSSQL, CloudSQL, Cloud Spanner, etc.
• 5+ years experience in deploying and supporting different flavors of Cloud and OnPrem databases including MSSQL, MySQL, Postgres, MongoDB, etc.
• 5+ years must have experience with orchestration and Automations tools (Helmcharts, Ansible, Terraforms, Yaml, Python, Json)
• 5+ years experience in SQL programming, bash scripting etc.
• Experience in configuring and maintaining different database replication methodologies.
• Strong interest in performance and security. Involvement in application server deployment including System setup, monitoring and Network configuration
• Understanding of operational concepts like change management, on-call rotations, escalations, uptime, etc
• Experience in managing production systems on a very large scale
• Deep understanding of one of the major OS families (Linux or Windows)
• Adhere to security best practices from design to implementation and operations
• Experience with building pipelines for Infrastructure as a code using Terraform
• Ability to work in an extremely geographically distributed company

Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

The TELUS Data & Trust Office provides world-class, innovative privacy solutions to TELUS. We partner with teams across the organization to advance our corporate priorities, support innovation and ultimately deliver on our promise to safeguard our customers\' privacy and to earn and maintain their trust. As the Data Ethicist, reporting to the Director of Data Ethics & Governance, you will provide thought-leadership and work with a cross-functional group focused on enabling a framework for responsible use of data, including health data. You will guide the design and development of data research, data-driven products and services in accordance with ethical principles.

You will be a champion for data ethics across the organization and you will advocate for TELUS’ Trust Model as the fundamental driver for all of our decisions around data, recognizing how critical customer and team member trust is to TELUS’ mission. Your commitment to data ethics will support our business needs as well as our position on social capitalism as we seek opportunities to innovate with data, including health data, for social good and specifically to address some of society’s most pressing problems.

• Provide ethical analysis and questioning for the implications of data use and technology evolution that is fair and transparent, considering the experience of a broad range of stakeholders to identify potential unintended consequences and impacts

• Establish the data ethics framework to ensure there is understanding, consideration and foresight into the issues raised by previously unimaginable uses of data and the development of emerging technologies like AI
• Enhance understanding of data ethics and its importance across TELUS, providing education and influencing the data user community and network of Data Stewards on responsible innovation

• Work with TELUS engineers, researchers, designers and business stakeholders to embed ethical decision-making and risk mitigation and monitoring processes into emerging technology, ensuring that design and production is fit for purpose and beneficial
• Maintain expert knowledge of data ethics toolkits, best practices and contribute to industry working groups on standards for data ethics and responsible innovation.

• Define and oversee stakeholder engagement methods to incorporate participatory human-centered design and the consultation of diverse voices across the innovation lifecycle to enhance public understanding and improve the social impacts of technology
• Learn continuously, innovate every day and seek opportunities to develop and demonstrate thought leadership with external stakeholders
• University degree or equivalent experience in applied ethics, philosophy, ethical machine learning, human-computer interaction, social and human sciences, or relevant fields
• Valued for your knowledge and expertise in data ethics and ethical risk assessments of emerging technology
• Experienced in establishing ethical decision-making and monitoring processes
• Demonstrated knowledge and experience in conducting analysis around societal expectations, including identifying stakeholder values and defining techniques for engagement and input
• Highly adaptable and comfortable working in a nascent field in a demanding and fast-paced environment
• Able to identify and proactively consider opportunities outside of conventional thinking, providing multiple solutions to resolve problems and address gaps
• Effective in written communication and verbally communicating progress on initiatives in leadership forums
• Trusted as a collaborative partner with excellent interpersonal skills who will act with integrity and exemplify ethical practices to fulfill TELUS’ commitments to its customers
• Bilingualism in English & French, verbal and/or written
• Experience working in a large, matrixed organization
• Experienced in implementing multidisciplinary data ethics practices and collaborating in a cross-functional environment working with technology, policy, engineering, product and research teams

>Requisition ID: 169306

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

column1: The Adjudication Management function is responsible for working with the Retail and Small Business risk adjudication teams (Loan Adjudication Centres & Loan Underwriting Centres) across the Caribbean region. This function is responsible to peform Data Analytics for the adjudication process considering Operations and Credit Risk.

The Manager, Adjudication Data Analytics C & CA will work closely with the Director Adjudication to ensure that all adjudication teams are aligned in terms of the risk policies and Bank’s Risk Appetite. Key accountabilities include:
• Develop reports using Data Analytics techniques for the adjudication centres to monitor operational KPIs, loan performance and exception management reporting
• Apply critical thinking to validate improvements with the adjudication units using data and analytics

• Manage analytical inquiries related to executive decisions and conducts root cause analysis of key operational issues, providing guidance and advice towards optimal resolution and mitigation while ensuring a timely and high-quality response.

• Responsible for monitoring the activity of the adjudication teams to provide risk oversight, including providing monthly analysis on early warning indicators, process updates, impact on adjudication from new initiatives or risk policies.
• Participating in key risk initiatives and projects which focus on the key priorities of the Adjudication teams from the data analytics perspective.

• Conducting assessments of the operational activity across the adjudication workflow. It is required that the Manager will provide recommendations for efficiency gains and be responsible for implementing these recommendations leveraging data and analytics.
• Assisting in the preparation of training material and tools for adjudicaiton teams, including communication of changes and updates.

• Working closely with the heads of the adjudication teams and Quality Assurance to identify areas where processes and procedures may need to be developed to improve the overall consistency of credit risk decisions.
• Adherence to lean practices and methodology
• Assist the Director with planning, forecasting, ad hoc requests, research, and strategic projects as they arise
• Responsible for quarterly Cost Allocation Transfer Pricing Expenses for the Adjudication department

• Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook, and the Guidelines for Business Conduct

• Champions a high-performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops, and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment, communicating vison/values/business strategy, and managing succession and development planning for the team

• Minimum bachelor's degree in business, economics, or finance or at least 3 year's working experience in retail banking or risk management
• Strong skills with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, SAS
• Experience on data analytics with a solid grasp of reporting practices and performance measurement tools
• Strong communication skills
• Strategic influencing abilities
• Assertive, and driven to be a change agent
• Fluent written and spoken English is mandatory
• Experience in Retail & Small Business banking, finance, credit risk are assets
• Spanish is an asset

What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and this includes our vast data.

The Business Intelligence group delves into our data, past and present, to develop crucial metrics and reporting functionality that better informs and optimizes key businesses decisions across the organization.
This is the team building the tools, reports, dashboards, cubes and scorecards that deliver and process vital data to business partners across the enterprise.
Joining us in Business Intelligence & Reporting is an opportunity to advance and deepen your career and to help TD serve its customers in a way we never have before.

column7: >The Data & Analytics function within Marketing is a central source of internal and external consumer insights and data analytics which supports both corporate and business unit strategies for TD Bank Financial Group Canada and TD Bank, America’s Most Convenient Bank.

>The D&A team mission is to be influential change agents and consumer advocates to help deliver the better bank and to drive shareholder return through optimizing the impact of marketing. We do this by delivering hindsight (what happened), insight (why), and foresight (future actions) on how to best reach consumers, who to target, what to say, and build intelligence on the market and competitive landscape. The group seeks to deliver excellence in analytics and insights to support short-term business success as well as long-term strategy of the bank.

>The D&A team brings together a diverse range of technical and business expertise including market research, business analytics, data science and modelling, business intelligence, data strategy and governance, data management, campaign targeting and delivery, and visualization.

You will assist in developing business requirements and conduct QA testing of Treasury systems and assist in applying advanced statistical models and financial engineering techniques to quantify and ensure minimal consumer behaviour risk. You will also assist in implementing and applying advanced analytics for optimization, reporting, P/L decomp and back-testing, and risk factor simulation to interpret and explain any resulting output.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

The Business Reporting Analyst is accountable to develop and deliver reporting, analytics, and financial modeling pertaining to the Automotive Finance Line of Business (LOB). This includes preparing and delivery of key management reports, and consults on analytical solutions to understand, analyze, and synthesize requirements, goals and objectives relative to data and business intelligence needs and to enable high-quality, fact-based business decisions to drive better business outcomes.

The successful candidate will combine both business and technology acumen to generate and maintain reporting in various forms (models, cubes, ad-hoc reports). Such reporting is used by leaders for performance evaluation, to facilitate coaching, and for business decision-making purposes. The incumbent will be self-motivated and take ownership of solving problems and proactively raising issues to management that may require further investigation.
• Breaks down strategic problems and analyzes data and information to provide subject-matter insights and recommendations.
• Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions.
• Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.

• Builds reports and visualizations to effectively communicate data driven insights to users for a variety of audiences (i.e. visualization solutions of data into reports, graphics, dashboards to illustrate facts, trends, and insights).
• Develops solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.
• Supports development and execution of strategic analytics & reporting initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
• Develops tools and delivers training programs for use of reporting tools and self-serve analytics by non-analytical end users
column2: may include delivery of training to audiences.

• Knowledge and experience in data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to Spotfire, Power BI, SQL, SAS, VBA, R, Python, MATLAB, SPSS - In-depth.
• Experience in working with and linking big data sets across multiple sources.
• Strong business communication and stakeholder management skills.
• Some financial background dealing with Balance Sheet and/or P&L is an asset.

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

You’ll be joining CIBC’s CIBC Asset Management (CAM) Technology Group within Wealth Management Technology. You’ll be at the heart of CIBC’s digital transformation, successfully delivering complex, enterprise-scale Azure projects involving multiple back-end systems. As an Senior Application Development Consultant, you will design, build, implement and maintain easy, flexible, agile solutions that enhance the client experience across multiple technologies including cloud. You’ll be part of the planning and strategy for the technical design, development and integration of these applications. The successful candidate for this role will be required to provide support after hours/weekends.
Design and development - Perform and coordinate complicated application programming activities. Lead the design and development of cost-effective and innovative solutions

Strategic planning - Develop multi-year technology roadmaps that align with the bank’s vision, strategy, and business goals. Lead multiple complicated projects involving backend systems, new technology, and the enhancement of existing applications.

Leadership skills - Act as the development team lead and run code-review sessions with the wider team to ensure the project is on track to meet goals. Support and mentor intermediate and senior developers by sharing knowledge, collaborating and problem solving.
You embrace and advocate change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
Your influence makes a difference. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by sharing your expertise.
You’re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
You\'re motivated by collective success. You know that teamwork can transform a good idea into a great one. You know that an inclusive team that enjoys working together can bring a vision to life.

• Familiarity with DevOps tools like Azure DevOps and Business Intelligence tools such as Power BI, Tableau .
• Communicate efficiently and with deep technical knowledge regarding concepts and best practices of the end-to-end data platform and architecture.
• 8+ years of relevant professional technology experience.5+ years of experience in a data transformation language like SQL.
• 5+ years of working experience with SQL Server, data warehousing and data analytics projects and 3+ years developing, deploying, and testing data platforms in Azure or other cloud provider.
• 2+ years of experience with version control and DevOps. 1+ years infrastructure as code development on Azure (ARM, Bicep, Blueprints).

Within Sun Life, the Analytics & Insights teams are comprised of savvy and intellectually curious professionals who are on a mission to transform how we apply data and analytics to support Sun Life becoming client-centric. An integral part of the Analytics & Insights organization, the Data Science team supports Canadian business units in their journey to leverage data and analytics as a foundational pillar in delivering business value

The Data Scientist you will focus on supporting Canadian business units in accelerating the growth and application of analytics in driving value. The data scientist will leverage practical experience in applying varied data science techniques & offering advice/inputs to help with the design, development and implementation of analytics use cases.
Sun Life views success in this role in demonstration of these key attributes:

Fierce curiosity. You are drawn to discovering and leveraging new data and taking on challenging business puzzles. An inquisitive mind. Driven to ask questions to help lead projects to commercial value and not being afraid that the innovation attempts can and will lead to failing. A passion for solving problems. The most successful data scientists’ solution for what the right data to use, they solve using the most suitable (not most advanced) algorithms for the problem at hand and figure out how to execute and deliver with highest efficiency. Technical skills in both data and computer science. There are 3 core technical skills we look for: in-depth coding knowledge of an analytical tool(s) (i.e., Python)
column3: working with structured data (SQL) Thirst for learning. You are a data scientist who is constantly updating their knowledge of data science state-of-the-art.

column1: • Apply best in breed data science including descriptive, predictive and machine learning techniques from the design to implementation that impacts the business.
• Focus on Feature Engineering, Model Training and Model Evaluation in addition to data munging / wrangling
• Identify the right algorithms and statistical techniques for a specific project as well as the best features for a model. Advise junior members on the same.
• Make business recommendations with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders
• An active contributing member to the analytics community to help foster and grow the data science community at Sun Life
• BSc/M.S. in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field (i.e., computer science) or equivalent experience
• 1+ year experience in developing and implementing data science techniques (predictive, prescriptive, ML etc.)
• Comfortable writing complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sources
• Proficient in using one or more statistical programming languages (i.e., Python) for data science
• Experience with AWS services including SageMaker is required for some roles
• Experience with machine learning including supervised and unsupervised models
• Demonstrated experience in data transformation & data manipulation
• Experience working with Structured vs. Unstructured data
• Experience with Big Data Technologies: Hadoop, HDFS, Hive, HBase, Spark is strongly desirable
• Effective and concise oral and written storytelling and insights communication skills
• Ability to work on multiple projects in parallel while managing constantly changing deadlines and priorities
• Ability to document work and effectively prioritize documentation
• Bilingualism (French, English) required for Quebec only - interactions with English-speaking customers or partners
• Past experience in life insurance/wealth management, or other financial services industry (e.g., retail banking, credit card, property and casualty insurance)

The candidate selected for this role is required to have special clearance from the Royal Canadian Mounted Police. To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the information on Federal Government site (

• Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

About the role

The Communications Data team owns data initiatives related to ​​the Comms mission: sharing the what - the primary messages we want the world to understand, and the how - the ways in which we share our story with the world. Comms positions Shopify as a technology leader that is pulling the future forward, and they storytell using data-informed statistics and insights. As a company we are doing incredible things for our merchants and data helps us tell this story to the world [see how this Shopify merchant created 14,000 jobs in India.].

Reporting to Data Science, Shopify is hiring a data analyst with a storytelling archetype. This team member will craft the data behind our stories to make them impactful and trustworthy to audiences worldwide. The work includes contributing vetted data to stories that will be shared publicly with media, government, and the world through Shopify’s website. The team collaborates with data teams across Shopify to empower Communications with knowledge from data domain experts. Our mandate is challenging, varied and constantly evolving.

The analyst will leverage their expertise in data querying and manipulation to create analyses and data products that answer complex business questions and enable decision-making. This data will shape how Comms and Public Relations view and position Shopify’s impact on the global economy and community. This individual will be aligned with Data Science and have Comms and Public Affairs as its primary stakeholder.
• Identify opportunities to increase the impact of Shopify storytelling with data
• Generate high-impact insights that tell Shopify’s story to the world
• Work within Data Science and Comms teams to enable improved discovery of vetted data points
• Become an expert at navigating Shopify data to answer business questions
• Expertise in telling a story with data in order to guide conversations, persuade your audience, and influence decision makers
Extensive knowledge of SQL for data extraction and manipulation and proficiency with Python (Git helpful)
• Experience with BI, visualization or data analysis tools such as Mode, Tableau, Looker
• Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills - you are able to work effectively with a diverse group of technical and non-technical stakeholders at all levels of the organization
• High attention to detail, but an equally important ability to see the big picture and evaluate analyses with strategic business context
• Good time management and organizational skills - ability to manage multiple priorities and timelines and address challenges in a collaborative team environment
• Endless curiosity and an ability to think outside of the box

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

column1: At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

This is a unique opportunity that involves leadership and development of the Treasury Analytics functions and expansion of mandates. As the Director, Treasury Analytics will drive insights, identify inherent risk drivers of consumer products, and relate relate modeling risk specifications back to the business. You will dive into the underlying mechanics of the specific problems and translate complex concepts into program enhancements and specifications to Technology for
column3: >development. Communicate complex problems and solutions to senior management and LOB.

column1: Additionally, you will support the Senior Director, Treasury Analytics to conduct analysis to maintain analytics infrastructure developed in Treasury Analytics used to conduct analysis of how consumer behavior affects retail product cash-flows and the use of embedded options. You will assist in developing business requirements and conduct QA testing of Treasury systems and assist in applying advanced statistical models and financial engineering techniques to quantify and ensure minimal consumer behaviour risk. You will also assist in implementing and applying advanced analytics for optimization, reporting, P/L decomp and back-testing, and risk factor simulation to interpret and explain any resulting output.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

• Systems and Support (Infrastructure) - Lead development and implementation of various strategic business initiatives. This includes liaise with various groups within CIBC to explain methodologies, and procedures developed within Treasury Analytics to assess analytic/data requirements for future business activities, and resolve any issues which
column3: >arise. Lead the maintenance of pricing, risk and mathematical analytics library supporting integration across all Treasury systems that are used for
column5: >Bank-wide benchmarking to validate pricing or risk. This will ensure consistency of risk measures across different risk platforms/measures and mitigate model

column1: • Support the management and enhancement of Cash-Flow Modeling Books - Liaise with Treasury CFO group to interpret and explain cash-flow modeling P/L
column3: >variability. Enhance PnL decomposition and signing off on daily cash-flow modeling P/L.

column1: • Financial/Derivative Analytics - Ensure pricing and risk analytics capture all hedgeable risks as is practical. This will include work to prototype pricing and hedge of fixed income
column5: >analytics/methodologies for transfer pricing new retail products, assess new and existing retail product profitability, and cash-flow modeling book.

column1: • Consumer Behavior Analytics - Apply customer behaviour calibration techniques for Treasury Analytics parameter review. Incorporate consumer behavior models into the funds transfer pricing and hedging processes. Collaborate in the development, continuous improvement and ongoing expansion of an analytics library with appropriate tools, models and techniques for modeling of customer behaviour and interest rate risks.

• Quantitative Analysis - Lead the implementation of sophisticated mathematical modeling, processes or algorithms to conduct analysis. Ensure operational effectiveness to deliver analytics capabilities, ensuring that outputs are correct and reproducible, and proper documentation to explain methods.
• You’re goal oriented. You’re motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make a difference.

• You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You communicate detailed information in a meaningful way. You have the ability to express modeling insights with an aptitude for explaining PnL and risk drivers. Creative problem solver and strong analytical skills.

7ddc13dc-a839-483d-b42b-80dbba9089b0,197102904,University of Toronto,Research and Business Development Officer,on_site,"Toronto, ON, Canada",2023-02-16T17:21:56.276Z,"

About us: The Faculty of Arts & Science is the heart of Canada’s leading university and one of the most comprehensive and diverse academic divisions in the world. The strength of Arts & Science derives from our combined teaching and research excellence in the humanities, sciences and social sciences across 29 departments, seven colleges and46 interdisciplinary centres, institutes and programs. We can only realize our mission with the dedication and excellence of engaged staff and faculty. The diversity of opportunities and perspectives within the Faculty reflect the local and global landscape and the need for curiosity, innovative thinking and collaboration. At Arts & Science, we take pride in our legacy of innovation and discovery that has changed the way we think about the world.

Established in 1964, the Department of Computer Science is ranked among the top computer science departments in the world. Our faculty have been presented with a wide variety of honours and awards over the years, including two Turing Awards, and many other national and international honours. We provide diverse programs and research opportunities while consistently producing high-impact research that is among the most highly cited in computer science.

Your opportunity: Reporting to the Associate Director, MScAC Partnerships, the incumbent will focus on strategic business development and cultivate lasting industrial relationships. The Research and Business Development Officer will coordinate with internal units, including the University's Innovations & Partnerships Office, and will help drive commercialization initiatives and develop collaborative research projects through research internship opportunities. This is a critical outward and inward facing role at the senior staff level.
• Developing and implementing plans to support areas of research relevant to industry needs that are consistent with the University’s academic mission
• Developing and implementing strategies to maximize the economic and social impact of commercialization partnerships
• Writing grant and investment proposals to acquire proof of concept and product development funding
• Using formal negotiation skills to settle the financial and business terms of all commercialization agreements
• Identifying, developing and executing strategies for research and development collaborations
• Serving as a resource on specific issues to a group of specialists
• Developing project schedules including milestones, critical path, timelines, deliverables and reporting
• Forecasting, planning and monitoring multiple complex budgets

• Six to seven years of recent and related experience in industrial and academic research setting related to computer science, statistics and mathematics, undertaking both hands-on research & business development (R&D) and formulation of industry-based research projects, with experience managing and promoting professional graduate programs
• Experience working with and supporting graduate students, preferably through internship cycles
• Experience writing documents (such as complex business contracts, grant and investment proposals) and compiling statistical reports
• Experience in assessing, formulating, and articulating a business case for partnering on high-quality academic-industry research and development problems
• Excellent problem solving, decision making and facilitation skills
• Excellent interpersonal skills to build consensus, employ multiple approaches and manage the conflicting expectations of multiple stakeholders
• Ability to build relationships with a pleasant and professional demeanor
• Ability to work independently and in a team setting
• Experience with industry- academic governmental funding programs such as through Mitacs, NSERC, and OCI
Visit the following link to view the full posting and submit your application for consideration: https://jobs.utoronto.ca/job/Research-and-Business-Development-Officer/567853817/

Closing Date: 03/09/2023, 11:59PM ET
Employee Group: USW
Appointment Type: Budget - Continuing
Schedule: Full-Time
Pay Scale Group & Hiring Zone: USW Pay Band 19 – $109,343 with an annual step progression to a maximum of $139,826. Pay scale and job class assignment is subject to determination pursuant to the Job Evaluation/Pay Equity Maintenance Protocol.
Job Category: Research Administration & Teaching

Candidates who are members of Indigenous, Black, racialized and 2SLGBTQ+ communities, persons with disabilities, and other equity deserving groups are encouraged to apply, and their lived experience shall be taken into consideration as applicable to the posted position.

90fd8a0e-e84a-42d2-8af9-43c3adcef396,198987548,TD Bank Group,Manager Data Steward,on_site,"Toronto, ON",2023-02-23T17:24:04.885Z,"<div class=""jobdetail-desc"" id=""gtm-jobdetail-desc"">

Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com

Data governance and management at TD is part of an enterprise-wide data and analytics ecosystem. Adaptability is key. You may be part of the data and analytics professional community managing data assets aligned to TD’s overarching policies or strategies, or you may find yourself directly immersed in various lines of business. Data stewardship at TD spans the enterprise and welcomes experts like you to help drive our business forward while protecting the interests of our organization, customers and shareholders.

Can you lead and inspire a team of data professionals varying in size and complexity? This people manager role is responsible for the direction of day-to-day data governance and data management activities, for a key function or line of business.

Are you ready to take a team of high-performers even higher? As the leader and manager of your team, you enjoy growing group dynamics and expertise to align with business and enterprise demands and direction. You set the bar high and set yourself apart as a leader by continually looking for ways to provide, and enhance, the value of your team and their satisfaction on the job, including assessing and developing both individual and team skills and capabilities. You’ll succeed and inspire your team to do the same with your deep knowledge and understanding of businesses, technology and organizational practices and disciplines.
As a Manager, Data Steward, you will:
• Provide people management leadership by hiring the best talent, setting goals, developing employees, managing performance and stimulating teamwork
• Lead and manage a team of data experts and overall operation of a diverse group in an area of moderate risk, complexity and scope
• Lead the team in the development and integrated implementation of policies, processes, procedures, projects and changes across multiple functions
• Help build and deploy the strategic direction of the data governance/management function within your line of business

• Act as a strategic partner by leading relationships with key enterprise partners and with leadership team to clarify scope, align, influence and effectively manage assigned data governance / management area
• In particular, partner closely with Technology and other SMEs to drive the successful implementation of the LOBs Data Strategy for data initiatives up to medium complexity
• Manage the overall data governance and / or data management team or function for a key business which may include Data Governance and / or Data Management roles

• Grow talent, by developing skills and capabilities in line with evolving trends in the data governance space, to help achieve team member career goals, support project success and achieve business results
• Complete key courses for the EDS capabilities within the EDU, including annual Mastery Testing
What can you bring to TD? Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:
• Seven (7) or more years relevant experience
• Ability to stay on top of emerging issues, trends and risks, including evolving regulatory requirements
• Skill in using software tools, applications, data analysis methods

• Ability to work multi-functionally, communicate positively and professionally in both spoken and written form, provide assistance or guidance to other team members and build positive relationships across teams and functions

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

column3: >At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.
>If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
>Bell’s Field Services team is proud to be the face of the Bell brand, performing the best installation and repair services and maintaining Bell’s network for our residential and business customers.

column2:
>Position Description:
Bell Field Services Operational Support team is a dynamic team where our main goal is to ensure we are delivering customer support to Canadians. The team works in a highly complex space involving many system interactions with dozens of internal teams to manage those interactions. Day-to-day, you’ll collect data & develop opportunities that will drive the future direction of the operations team and help to streamline the complex business problems they face. You will use your analytical skills to improve the understanding of KPIs while working to improve their limitations. And your attention to detail will help you push projects and process changes forward even when there is incomplete data or resources. A successful candidate will gain exposure with many people across various levels at Bell.

Job Duties/Accountabilities:
• Code: create code to join various systems to translate raw data into meaningful stories
• Analyze: perform extensive analysis to identify & size trends in performance
• Create: think outside the box to deliver creative opportunities to the business
• Collaborate: work with experts in different teams to understand end-to-end processes
• Sell: build compelling business cases to convince our partners to invest in our proposals

>Essential Skills & Abilities:
• University or College degree in engineering, economy, computer sciences, physic, mathematics or relevant experience in equivalent domain
• 1-3 years experience in business intelligence related functions (analysis, coding, etc.)
• Proficient with MS Excel (pivot tables, functions, charting)
• Knowledge of SQL and relational databases
• Well-versed in applied statistics
• Excellent communication skills and ability to quickly build straight-to-the-point presentation and deliver them with passion

Preferred Qualifications/Competencies:
• Experience in Microsoft Office applications, Excel, Powerpoint, Visio
• Experience with SAS & Python
• Experience with data visualization software such as PowerBI
• Knowledge of process modelling & mining techniques

column1: ef0d1d5f-5a50-4f99-bf4f-d4d08d4fbe20,165148922,Google,"Student Researcher, MS, 2023",on_site,"Toronto, ON, Canada",2022-11-10T17:20:01.826Z,"<div style=""""> <div class=""gc-card gc-card--expanded gc-job-detail gc-job-detail--loaded"">
Student Researcher, MS, 2023
Apply
Participation in this program requires that you are located in Canada for the duration of the engagement.

This opportunity is intended for students who are pursuing a MS degree with an anticipated graduation date after December 2024, depending on their program and unique circumstances. If you are graduating before December 2024, we encourage you to apply to the Internship openings.

To start the application process, you will need an updated CV or resume and a current unofficial or official transcript in English (PDFs preferred). Please ensure your anticipated graduation dates (in MM/YY) and any proficiency in coding languages are listed on resume.


Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Waterloo, ON, Canada
• Currently enrolled in a Master\'s degree in Computer Science, Linguistics, Statistics, Biostatistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics, or Natural Sciences.

• Experience in one area of computer science (e.g., Natural Language Understanding, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Quantum Information Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, etc.).
• Currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to the program after completion of the internship.
• Currently attending a degree program in Canada.
• Experience as a researcher, including internships, full-time, or at a lab.
• Experience contributing to research communities or efforts, including publishing papers in conferences or journals.
• Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages (e.g., C/C++, Java, MATLAB, Go, Python, etc.).
• Ability to speak and write in English fluently.
About the job

The Student Researcher Program’s primary objective is to foster academic collaborations with students through research at Google. Join us for a paid Student Researcher position that offers the opportunity to work directly with Google research scientists and engineers on cutting-edge research projects.

The Student Researcher Program offers more opportunities for research students to work on critical research projects at Google in a less structured way. The program allows for opportunities beyond the limitations of our traditional internship program on aspects such as duration, time commitment, and working location (with options for on-site or remote). The topics student researchers work on tend to be open-ended and exploratory, and don\'t always have a clear deliverable like a traditional internship would.

Google Research is building the next generation of intelligent systems for all Google products. To achieve this, we’re working on projects that utilize the latest computer science techniques developed by skilled software engineers and research scientists. Google Research teams collaborate closely with other teams across Google, maintaining the flexibility and versatility required to adapt new projects and foci that meet the demands of the world\'s fast-paced business needs.

Responsibilities

  • Participate in research to develop solutions for real-world, large-scale problems.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

To learn more about COVID vaccination requirements for US Google workplaces, read our Vaccination Entry Policy.

At Google, we’re committed to building a workforce that is more representative of the users we serve and creating a culture where everyone feels like they belong. To learn more about our diversity, equity, inclusion commitments and how we’re building belonging, please visit our Belonging page for more information.

We welcome and encourage people who are expecting and/or parents-to-be to apply to this or any other role at Google.

Google is a global company and, in order to facilitate efficient collaboration and communication globally, English proficiency is a requirement for all roles.

77098104-2c23-4465-b3e5-7700f1b21641,165049253,Nexxt Intelligence,NLP Application Developer,full,"Toronto, ON, Canada",2022-11-10T14:26:06.232Z,"

NLP Application Engineer

We are looking for a NLP Application Engineer to join our growing team to help grow inca, a conversational AI platform for consumer research. Interactive, data-centric, NLP-powered web applications form a key component of our product offering, and you will be working across our stack (Tailwind, React.js, Node.js, Python, AWS) to integrate exciting innovations in AI into delightful web applications, built using best practices and with robust data pipelines. This opportunity will allow you to work in an established startup, and to learn from an experienced team of software developers, market researchers, data analysts, and machine learning researchers.
These are some (but not all) of the ways that you will contribute to our team and product:
• Building engaging user interfaces designed for market researchers to accelerate and improve their workflows by leveraging state-of-the-art advances in AI.
• Extending cloud-native data pipelines to achieve high-performance, highly-available, and robust processing of semi-structured data at scale..
• Improving developer operations and infrastructure including CI/CD, automated testing, system monitoring, security and data protection compliance, etc.
• Contributing to product ideation, user experience, NLP experimentation, and application architecture as a core technical member of our team.
We look at candidates holistically, and will not rule out any applicant based on a lack of one specific skill set. These are some of the assets that a great candidate would bring:
• 3+ years of professional full-stack experience in any stack
• Expertise in some combination of Python, Node.js, or Typescript
• Familiarity with Git, Docker and other development tools
• Proficiency in frontend development with intuitive sense of design (React.js preferred)
• Keen interest in integrating AI capabilities into web applications
• Real world experience building data-centric applications and/or pipelines

This position is permanent full-time, and flexibly hybrid (primarily remote, with headquarters in Toronto). If you are interested, please send your CV and a brief email, explaining your interest and describing one or more projects that you’ve worked on, to jobs@nexxt.in.

We particularly encourage applications from groups underrepresented in the technology industry. Check out https://nexxt.in/about to learn more about our team and company culture!

column3:
>Requisition ID: 167822

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

column1: The GBM Analytics team has been focused on building out a library of sophisticated models and the requisite infrastructure to enhance data-driven decision making across the bank, with a focus on businesses in Capital Markets and Group Treasury. Our team consists of highly accomplished business professionals who blend expertise in Mathematics, Computer science, Statistics, Capital markets and Treasury, to architect and deliver innovative technical solutions driving business value. Our work spans a broad technology stack involving the development of data pipelines, predictive models and data visualizations. We are seeking an enthusiastic professional with experience in applied Machine Learning, AI and requisite domain knowledge to continue to build out and lead our modeling efforts in some of projects within the GBM Analytics portfolio.

• Define, build and manage the entire lifecycle of a Machine Learning/Analytics project from Scoping to Deployment with a delivery oriented approach, collaborating with cross-functional teams.
• Design, build and implement models to solve business problems using advanced statistical & machine learning techniques.
• Distill and transform data-driven insights into a tangible Product.
• Lead and guide a change mandate across the team on innovative use of Alternative Data sources.
• Motivation to learn about new advancements in Machine Learning as well as new domains in Capital Markets.

• A technical undergraduate degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics or similar. Postgraduate degree specialized in Data Science/Machine Learning preferred.
• 1-2 years of hands-on experience as a Data Scientist.
• Proficiency in Python, SQL and Git workflow.
• Hands-on experience in working with and reconciling big data sets using technologies such as Hive/PySpark.
• Familiarity with advanced machine learning tools and libraries.
• Expertise in end-to-end advanced Machine Learning processes in various platforms including Cloud(GCP preferred).
• Familiarity with Time-Series modeling.
• Good understanding of Machine Learning model explainability and interpretation.
• Experience with visualization tools such as PowerBI, Plotly.
• Strong presentation skills and experience with building a compelling narrative based on complex data and analytics.

• Experience with building and maintaining data pipelines.

column3: >relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

column1: At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Quantitative Risk is part of CIBC’s Capital Market Risk Management (CMRM), which is led by the Executive Vice President and Chief Risk Officer. CMRM is accountable for the identification, management, and control of the risks taken by CIBC Capital Markets. Quantitative Risk is responsible for providing continuous enhancements, controls, and the monitoring of all models used for risk measurements of Capital Market products, including compliance with current and new regulatory regimes.

As the Senior Quantitative Analyst, Risk Model Performance & Analytics, you will be responsible for CIBC’s Initial Margin Model and monitoring of the adequacy of the model as well as the accurate risk capture of Initial Margin under ISDA SIMM v2.5. You will have frequent interaction with CIBC and client’s collateral teams through this process. You will be responsible for ongoing enhancement of the model as new versions are released.

Additionally, you will be responsible for creating and streamlining analysis and reporting processes through automation and creation of tools for more effective and proactive risk management. You will work closely with our colleagues within Risk and our Technology partners.
You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

• Problem Solving and Communication – Ensure effective identification of issues impacting Capital Market Risk Management models performance, timely communication and escalation of identified issues to relevant stakeholder groups and senior management, and adequate prioritization for resolving identified issues.

• Automation and Creative Solutioning – Using development best practices, you will be expected to identify opportunities to automate workflow and processes. Utilize your understanding of financial modelling to automate and further develop creative solutions. Create and enhance documentation pertaining to model governance and controls.

• Domain Knowledge – Demonstrate in-depth understanding of valuation & risk models. Demonstrate and continue to grow knowledge of trading and hedging strategies, Capital Markets products, and regulatory changes pertaining to market risk capital and Initial Margin requirements. Remain abreast of market environment, news and events, and be proactive in assessing their potential impact on model performance. Develop expertise in CMRM and Capital Markets systems, processes and underlying models.

• Relationship Building – Develop and maintain excellent relationships with various groups across Capital Markets Risk Management, Capital Markets, Technology and Finance as most of the issues identified through model performance monitoring require collaborative effort among multiple teams to resolve. Establish and maintain clear and concise lines of communication and foster a collaborative culture while keeping in mind that this role is part of Capital Markets Risk Management and is thus a 2nd line of defense with the accountability of providing effective challenge, monitoring, and oversight.
• You demonstrate knowledge of Financial Risk Management. You have strong knowledge of financial markets and products as well as the foundations of risk measurement and risk management.

• You’re a certified professional. You have a graduate degree in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Quantitative Finance, Computer Science, and/or related program. You have strong quantitative skills and experience.

• You\'re digitally savvy. You have solid technical skills ( e.g. Python, R, C++, etc.) and you seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools, systems and trends.
• You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
• You\'re passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships, and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners.
• You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results, both within our department and across the broader CMRM team.
• You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
• Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

• We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
• Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
• We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day
column2: a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.
