column1: 8b9f2d00-936a-4c1a-aa31-345a43bbf7e6,261881655,Cohere AI,"Member of Technical Staff, Data Acquisition",on_site,"Toronto, ON, Canada",2023-08-20T16:04:02.025Z,"<div class=""section page-centered"">

We’re a small, diverse team working at the cutting edge of machine learning. At Cohere, our mission is to build machines that understand the world and to make them safely accessible to all. Language is at the crux of this, but it can be difficult and expensive to parse the syntax, semantics, and context that all work together to give words meaning. The Cohere platform provides access to Large Language Models through its APIs that read billions of web pages and learns to understand the meaning, sentiment, and intent of the words we use in a richness never seen before.

We've recently raised our Series C, and we are focused on bringing our technology to market. We will partner with customers so they can build natural language understanding and generation into their products with just a few lines of code.

We’re ambitious — we believe our technology will fundamentally transform how industries interact with natural language. And we have the technical chops to back it up - Cohere’s CEO, Aidan Gomez, is a co-author of the groundbreaking paper “Attention is all you need”, and was previously part of Google Brain. Our entire technical team is world-class.
We are focused on creating a diverse and inclusive work environment so that all of our team members can thrive. We welcome kind and brilliant people to our team, from wherever they come.

At Cohere, we strive to continually improve our large language models. Academic research and real-world experience has demonstrated that high quality, diverse datasets can contribute as much to the performance and capabilities of LLMs as the underlying model architecture and training regimen. We at Cohere believe data will play a central role in accelerating the advancement of our already world-class language models.

Data is therefore critical to our success. Our ability to acquire data that is accurate, relevant, and timely is key to our ability to improve the quality of our models. We strive to continuously improve our data acquisition processes and systems to ensure that we have the data we need to stay competitive and meet the needs of our customers. We run frequent experiments to learn more about the role of data for model quality, from data mixtures, to cleaning techniques, to quality control.

This role will be part of the Data Acquisition team, which broadly provides data for training models and is responsible for building and maintaining the infrastructure that acquires, cleans, and formats data for model training. We are looking for a technically skilled, resourceful problem-solver who is able to work in areas of ambiguity and find efficient and sometimes creative solutions. The main responsibility of this role is to improve our internal data acquisition infrastructure, which includes data crawlers, formatters, and integrations with data providers. This role would also work closely with different teams at Cohere to support their data acquisition needs, as well as engage in more experimental work to develop highly informative data signals.
Please Note: We have offices in Toronto, Palo Alto, and London but embrace being remote-first! There are no restrictions on where you can be located for this role.
As a Member of Technical Staff, Data Acquisition, you will:
• Develop data pipelines to acquire, prepare, and integrate high-quality datasets into model training and evaluation
• Collaborate with research and product teams to identify, prioritize, and secure new data sources
• Enhance and develop infrastructure for data management, pipeline orchestration, and MLOps, while avoiding premature optimization
• Run experiments using new data inputs, preprocessing techniques, and data mixtures
You may be a good fit if:
• You have more than 2 years of experience working on a software or machine learning engineering team
• You have proficiency in Python and have used distributed processing technologies like Spark, Dask, etc.
• You have experience building data pipelines and ETL processes for large-scale datasets
• You have experience working with unstructured and/or human-annotated data (e.g., collecting or assessing sample quality).
• You have experience with ML frameworks such as Tensorflow, TF-Serving, JAX, and XLA/MLIR
• You have strong communication and problem-solving skills, preferring the right tool for the job even if it’s outside your wheelhouse
• You feel comfortable actively reading academic literature and researching state-of-the-art NLP best practices.
• You have a demonstrated passion for applied NLP models and products

If some of the above doesn’t line up perfectly with your experience, we still encourage you to apply! If you consider yourself a thoughtful worker, a lifelong learner, and a kind and playful team member, Cohere is the place for you.

We value and celebrate diversity and strive to create an inclusive work environment for all. We welcome applicants of all kinds and are committed to providing an equal opportunity process. Cohere provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
🤝 An open and inclusive culture and work environment
🧑‍💻 Work closely with a team on the cutting edge of AI research
🦷 Full health and dental benefits, including a separate budget to take care of your mental health
🐣 100% Parental Leave top-up for 6 months for employees based in Canada, the US, and the UK
🎨 Personal enrichment benefits towards arts and culture, fitness and well-being, quality time, and workspace improvement
🏙 Remote-flexible, offices in Toronto, Palo Alto, San-Francisco and London and co-working stipend

column2: >Note: This post is co-authored by both Cohere humans and Cohere technology.

fd12e841-21f0-4bff-84f4-6b1c0cb0e430,262234738,EllisDon,Data Governance & Backup Specialist,on_site,"Mississauga, ON L4Y1M4, CAN Mississauga, ON L4Y1M4, CAN",2023-08-21T16:22:11.559Z,"

Job Details

Description
Connect with us LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter

Do you want to build the software that builds cities? EllisDon’s construction technology team is made up of Full-Stack Developers, Data Analysts, UX Designers, Product Owners, IT Operations and we’re growing fast! Our team also includes some of the best digital modelers and BIM specialists in the industry, experts who are working with the latest tech on projects in the billions of dollars.

We are a software development studio of 140+ people, backed by one of Canada’s top construction firms, with over 70 years in the industry and completing over $5 billion of work each year. We build software that is solving real-world problems on some of Canada’s largest construction projects.

Above all, we at EllisDon work hard to deliver great careers to one another. We choose to celebrate the strength in our differences, every day. EllisDon’s commitment to Inclusive Diversity is to work together to create an environment where every employee feels safe to be their true and authentic self. Ultimately, EllisDon’s purpose is to provide people with similar values the opportunity to achieve their full potential
column2: to deliver that opportunity for great careers to one another
column3: and to contribute meaningfully to the community we share with others.

column1: In case you’re curious, here’s what the industry thinks of us and some of the impacts we've made to the communities we work in.
You as a Storage and Backup Specialist:
• Corporate Data Governance Strategy for Azure Cloud environment
• MTTR planning including updates to Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity plans
• Extensive experience in Storage Consolidation, Backup administration, testing, and verification of backups

• Administer, maintain, troubleshoot, and support large complex multi-platform Storage environment that includes fiber channel SAN with multiple directors, servers, storage frames technologies, as well as enterprise backup technologies.
• Architect, design and implement infrastructure solutions for server hosting, virtualization, storage area network, centralized back-up, security, monitoring.
• Manage monitoring, alerting, capacity planning, provisioning, and reporting for all storage subsystems.
• Identify, analyze, and resolve problems specifically on storage, backup and in general, cross platform environments.
• Identify, define, and develop improvements to processes that support the infrastructure at all Core locations and Satellite office.

• Prepare Implementation plan, rollback plan and test plan, risk, and impact analysis for critical or complex changes. Review the change plan and documentation prepared by level 2 engineers for peer review
This is the right role for you, if you have:
• A University degree in Computer Science or equivalent
• Experience with M365 Cloud Storage Solutions & Azure Cloud Files Services
• Experience with Data Migrations and Systems Integrations
• Experience with CommVault/Metallic experience is an asset
• Excellent communication skills, including an ability to work collaboratively across multi-disciplinary teams, interpersonal skills are essential.

EllisDon is proud to provide this unique career opportunity that provides continuous learning, opportunity for growth, and a competitive compensation package within an environment that is committed to inclusion and respects diversity.
Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it!

We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of any age, culture, subculture, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nationality, ethnicity, race, size, mental or physical status, veteran status, religion, language, political opinion, working-style preference, family status, education, and socio-economic status. The EllisDon core values of Integrity and Mutual Respect welcomes everyone, at work and in the community, and our value of Mutual Accountability, means that we all have a role to play. As an EllisDon employee, this will ultimately be your commitment to Inclusive Diversity.
​Accommodation for Applicants with disabilities will be made during the recruitment process when requested.

We are committed to providing a positive candidate experience and ensuring timely updates are provided to all candidates. If you haven’t already, be sure to create a profile on our Careers page here to remain up to date on the status of your application and learn about new career opportunities as they arise.

0c24dc20-495a-416c-9fd5-2cbebf0b90bc,267934845,BenchSci,Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Computer Vision (Remote),full,"Toronto, Ontario Remote",2023-09-07T16:27:12.805Z,"
We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer - Computer Vision to join our growing ML team. You will work on challenging computer vision problems to have an impact on the 31,000+ life scientists across the world who rely on BenchSci for their research. Reporting to the Engineering Manager, ML, you'll apply your domain expertise to select, train and deploy the best-suited machine learning algorithms, collaborate and experiment with scientists, and apply techniques to build solutions to shape the future of scientific discovery. You will have plenty of room for technical innovation and greenfield to explore and propose computer vision solutions to a complex area.
• Improve the performance and scalability of ML models and pipelines that are at the core of BenchSci's products
• Work on different stages of the problem from prototyping to production
• Contribute to key components across the machine learning ecosystem defining BenchSci's ML Technical Roadmap
• Investigate what technologies that will best enable BenchSci to identify experimental insights through proof-of-concepts
• Work with diverse teams to correctly capture the nuances of biology, translating them into ML objectives
• Advocate for code and engineering process improvements across your team, and help define best practices
• Participate in sprint planning, estimations, and reviews
• Work with teammates to ensure high-quality deliverables
• 3+ years of experience working as a professional developer, with at least 2 years of this focused on machine learning and computer vision
• A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or other related disciplines
• Comprehensive knowledge in the end-to-end machine learning lifecycle, including the nuances of the infrastructure and operationsExperience with ML and/or Computer Vision fundamentals
• Experience productionizing ML models Experience with PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, and image processing libraries such as OpenCV and Scikit-image
• Experience with distributed and cloud-based data processing frameworks such as Apache Spark or Apache Beam
• A team player who strives to see teammates succeed together
A great compensation package that includes BenchSci equity options
<div>15 days vacation plus an additional day every year
column2: plus company closures for 15 more days throughout the year

Generous parental leave benefits with a top-up plan or paid time off options

column2: >*Benefits are tied to Canadian dollar amounts and would be converted to local currency for those in other countries. Moving to local currency allotments in the future.

column1: BenchSci's mission is to exponentially increase the speed and quality of life-saving research and development. We empower scientists to run more successful experiments with the world's most advanced, biomedical artificial intelligence software platform.

Backed by Generation Investment Management, TCV, Inovia, F-Prime, Golden Ventures, and Google's AI fund, Gradient Ventures, we provide an indispensable tool for scientists that accelerates research at 16 top 20 pharmaceutical companies and over 4,300 leading academic centers. We're a certified Great Place to Work®, and top-ranked company on Glassdoor.

BenchSci relentlessly builds on its strong foundation of culture. We put team members first, knowing that they're the organization's beating heart. We invest as much in our people as our products. Our culture fosters transparency, collaboration, and continuous learning.

We value each other's differences and always look for opportunities to embed equity into the fabric of our work. We foster diversity, autonomy, and personal growth, and provide resources to support motivated self-leaders in continuous improvement.

You will work with high-impact, highly skilled, and intelligent experts motivated to drive impact and fulfill a meaningful mission. We empower you to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and thrive. Here you will be challenged to stretch yourself to achieve the seemingly impossible. Learn more about our culture.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: We're committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. We believe that improving diversity, equity and inclusion is our collective responsibility, and this belief guides our DEI journey. Learn more about our DEI initiatives.
Accessibility Accommodations: Should you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs. Please reach out to talent@benchsci.com.

column3: >

>Requisition ID: 184728

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

>Purpose
Contributes to the overall success of the Fraud Management Group Globally ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.

>Accountabilities
• Collaborate with stakeholders including Operations, Analytics and Data Science partners, as well as Scotia Digital and IT&S partners to identify opportunities and drive business value in reducing fraud risks by leveraging Data Science
• Leverage distributed computing tools (e.g. Beam, BigQuery, Hive, Spark) for analysis, data mining and modeling
• Collaborate with technology / engineering, analytics, and operational teams to deploy fraud detection and prevention models and algorithms in production across different products and channels
• Create and apply model validation strategies to measure model effectiveness, conduct A/B testing, and make ongoing enhancements
• Prepare detailed documentation to outline data sources, models and algorithms used and developed
• Present results to business line stakeholders and help implement real data-driven changes
• Champion a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems, and knowledge
• Leverage Scrum framework for iterative and incremental agile development of machine learning product features, participate in sprint review, planning, and daily scrum ceremonies
• Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions

>Education / Experience / Other Information
• Post-secondary degree in relevant STEM discipline (Computer Science, Electrical/Computer/Software Engineering, and Statistics/Mathematics) and/or 2+ year similar hands-on experience preferred
• Experience with machine learning, statistical techniques, as well as model testing and validation
• Experience cleaning, transforming and visualizing large data sets working with various data formats (e.g. unstructured logs, XML, JSON, flat files, audio, image)
• Solid SQL skills for querying relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, DB2, MySQL)
• Programming skills in Python, Java or Scala
• Hands-on experience with Big Data ecosystem tools (e.g., Beam, BigQuery, Hive, Spark) preferred
• Experience with UNIX tools and shell scripting preferred
• Expertise with Docker or Kubernetes is an asset
• Experience with various services on Google Cloud Platform is an asset
• Experience deploying models into productions as streaming application, Rest APIs, batch jobs or dashboards is an asset
• Experience with Deep Learning architectures like RNNs and CNNs is an asset
• Experience using and implementing visualization tools is an asset
• Knowledge of industry trends regarding fraud and experience in fraud detection and prevention is an asset
• Experience working with cross-functional team in an Agile environment is an asset
• Strong verbal, written, presentation & communication skills
• Proactive, organized, excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

column1:
ChainML is a startup founded by a team of experienced tech executives and machine learning experts, including 3 Vector Institute alumni. We’re building Council - an open-source Agent-based framework that simplifies the integration and amplifies the utility of state-of-the-art generative AI models like GPT-4 and Llama-2 into business applications.
https://github.com/chain-ml/council

About the Role

ChainML is looking for a marketing specialist with good knowledge of the emerging AI technology landscape and experience in growing brand and community for projects at the intersection of open-source and enterprise.

We are looking for full-time employees. We will hire marketing specialists with varying degrees of experience and compensate appropriately.
• Strategic Planning: Develop and execute comprehensive marketing strategies tailored to highlight the capabilities of our products.
• Content Creation: Create engaging, informative, and persuasive content such as blog posts, whitepapers, case studies, videos, and webinars that showcase the value of our offerings.
• Campaign Development: Ideate and execute targeted marketing campaigns to generate leads, drive engagement, and foster brand awareness within the AI and open-source communities.
• Audience Engagement: Build and nurture relationships with AI enthusiasts, developers, decision-makers, and other stakeholders through social media, forums, industry events, and partnerships.
• Thought Leadership: Establish ChainML as a thought leader in the AI and open-source space by contributing to industry conversations, sharing insights, and participating in relevant events.
• Collaboration: Work closely with the product, sales, and engineering teams as well as external marketing partners to gather insights, align messaging, and coordinate product launches and updates.
• Analytics and Optimization: Monitor the performance of marketing initiatives related to AI and open-source, analyze key metrics, and adjust strategies to achieve optimal results.
• Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Computer Science, or a related field. Master's degree is a plus.
• Proven track record of marketing experience for a tech company, with a focus on AI, open-source technologies, or related domains.
• Strong understanding of AI concepts, open-source principles, and their applications in business contexts.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to distill complex technical information into clear and compelling content.
• Experience in developing and executing successful marketing campaigns, preferably within the technology sector.
• Familiarity with AI developer communities, forums, and industry events is highly advantageous.
• Analytical mindset with the ability to derive insights from data and adjust strategies accordingly.
• Creative thinker with the ability to generate innovative marketing ideas and approaches.
• Proficiency in using marketing tools and platforms, including social media, content management systems, and analytics tools.

At ChainML, we value both in-person and remote engagements, recognizing the importance of global connections. Team members may have opportunities to attend conferences and events and to occasionally meet in person with clients in Europe, the USA, Asia, and other global destinations. Our teams work together to strategize and ensure manageable travel schedules.
Influence and Impact in AI: Play a pivotal role in an emerging startup in the Generative AI domain.
Career Growth: Expansive career development opportunities in a rapidly expanding company.
Competitive Compensation: We offer a competitive salary and benefits package.
Comprehensive Health Benefits: Receive an extended health plan, covering vision, dental, and prescriptions.
• Annual company holiday between Christmas and New Year (inclusive of Christmas Day, Boxing Day, and New Year's Day)
• Observance of all Ontario statutory holidays (7 days in total)
Remote Work Support: We cover necessary costs for a seamless remote work experience, including equipment and internet connectivity.

At ChainML, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. If you’re excited about shaping the future of AI and engaging diverse audiences on this important and evolving topic, we'd love to hear from you. Submit your resume through this portal.

​You can find ChainML on Twitter, Discord, Github, LinkedIn, and our website. #JobCouncil #CouncilAI

Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

The TELUS Data & Trust Office provides world-class, innovative privacy solutions to TELUS. We partner with teams across the organization to advance our corporate priorities, support innovation and ultimately deliver on our promise to safeguard our customers\' privacy and to earn and maintain their trust. As the Technology Architect, Responsible AI, reporting to the Director of Data Ethics, you will work with a cross-functional group focused on enabling a framework for responsible use of artificial intelligence (Ai) and guide the development of AI, data-driven products and services in accordance with ethical principles.

You will be a champion for responsible AI across the organization and you will advocate for TELUS’ Trust Model as the fundamental driver for all of our decisions around data, recognizing how critical customer and team member trust is to TELUS’ mission. Your commitment to responsible AI will support our business needs as well as our position on social capitalism as we seek opportunities to innovate with data. This will help our business to implement AI solutions that not only perform well, but also operate ethically and responsibly, benefiting society as a whole.
• Collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop and implement AI solutions in accordance with the TELUS’ Trust Model and data ethics framework
• Advising on how responsible AI can serve as an enabler for business program operations and assist with the deployment of responsible AI across the organization
• Developing and implementing testing and validation protocols to ensure AI systems are working as intended
• Conducting research and staying up-to-date with the latest developments in AI ethics and responsible AI practices
• Supporting the development of a TELUS’ framework for responsible AI in line with emerging leading practices
• Integrating responsible AI into processes to support agile development methodology
• Educating and advising business units on existing or new techniques, and providing innovative strategies and creative solutions to implement responsible AI
• Participating in industry-wide efforts to advance responsible AI practices and standards

• Demonstrated track record of providing subject matter expertise embedding responsible AI into product and services while delivering on measurable outcomes in a highly complex stakeholder environment
• Demonstrated working knowledge or understanding of responsible AI fundamentals (e.g. differential privacy, federated learning, adversarial testing, etc.) and machine learning pipelines
• Familiarity with statistics, algorithms, and machine learning tools to analyze and evaluate fair and ethical AI, including generative AI
• Passionate about responsible AI and the imperative to use data to solve big and small problems
• Keen to explore new and creative solutions to change the trajectory of persistent challenges and motivated to bring those solutions to life
• Appreciated for your excellent interpersonal and problem solving skills, and your ability to distill complex and/or ambiguous problems into clear, actionable requirements
• Known for your ability to influence and negotiate effectively, to be a persuasive advocate, and known for your conflict resolution skills with a focus on win-win solutions
• Sought out for excellent communication skills, verbal & written, with the ability to present information at all levels of the organization and leadership forums
• Post-secondary degree in computer science, computer engineering, information systems, ethics, or related field of study
• Experience with the development, design, and architecture of IT technology, data management, and data integration processes
• Experience with design for software applications running on multiple platforms
• Experience with web architecture and the privacy and security model of the web
• Bilingual in French & English, verbal and/or written
• Certification in Privacy (e.g., CDPSE, CIPT, CIPM, CIPP certification)

column1: As the Director, AML Analytics you are responsible for developing and maintaining sophisticated anti-money laundering (AML) models to detect and prevent financial crimes within our organization. This is transformational role that arises from two emerging trends in anti-financial crime programs: the propagation of data / analytics capabilities used to detect financial crime and the need to identify increasingly complex-organized money laundering operations. The Director, AML Analytics will work with AML Insight and Analytics, the AML Transformation Office and the AML Financial Intelligence Unit to build and deliver leading edge analytic detection and investigative capabilities.
• Develop and maintain anti-money laundering (AML) models to detect financial crimes.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
• Apply sophisticated modelling techniques, including graph and machine learning analytics, to develop and implement components of the AML Investigator of the Future platform.

• Establish a development roadmap for network risk scoring (batch and dynamic) by defining the prevalent features that will be integrated into the monitoring program and used in the course of an investigation.
• Conduct data exploration and cleansing to ensure high-quality data for model development and validation.
• Identify opportunities to streamline or automate processes to promote efficient and effective use of resources.
• Implement and optimize scoring algorithms, decision trees, rule-based systems, and anomaly detection techniques.
• Monitor model performance, identify issues, and propose solutions for continuous improvement and accuracy.
• Conduct thorough testing and documentation of developed models, adhering to regulatory compliance standards.
• Stay up to date with industry best practices, emerging trends, and regulatory changes in AML and predicate offense detection.
• Collaborate with Compliance and Risk teams to address AML-related issues and provide technical expertise.
• Participate in model validation exercises, including stakeholder engagement, analysis, and reporting.
• Experience with AML or fraud modeling and investigation environments that utilize detection / predictive models
• Programming experience ideally using an object oriented programing language such as Java, Scala (ideally), R or Python.
• Minimum of 5 years of experience leading a data science or analytics team
• Statistical approaches and methods and their application on projects
• Graduate degree (MBA or relevant subject matter area)
• Data mapping, meaning of relational data and object orientation.
• Understands projects needs and can translate into detection models and capabilities.

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
• A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation

• Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
• Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

0a49c277-6f79-4216-b979-53828313475f,263354232,TD Bank Group,Data Scientist I,on_site,"Toronto, ON",2023-08-24T16:23:02.751Z,"<div class=""jobdetail-desc"" id=""gtm-jobdetail-desc"">

We’re committed to providing fair and equitable compensation to all our colleagues. As a candidate, we encourage you to have an open dialogue with your recruiter and ask compensation related questions, including pay details for this role.

What does TD stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and for almost every department, that begins with data.
As part of our Data and Analytics team, you’ll be a fundamental part of crafting business processes enterprise-wide by analyzing vast amounts of past and present data.

TD’s vision for the future? Tailored, customized banking products, services and experiences for every single customer. If you’ve been in business as long as we have, you know there’s no such thing as one size fits all, and a diverse, inclusive Data Analytics team is a massive part of that future achievement.

You are eager to provide your burgeoning technical expertise as part of a team that takes on consistently complex projects across a wide range of business units. You are familiar with data functions including data modelling, visualization, data profiling, data origin and lineage, report design and more. You will employ these disciplines to help create data related solutions to drive business results. You thrive on positive feedback and use your specialized knowledge to implement feedback systems that evaluate your team’s progress and create innovative new ways improve your overall performance.
We are looking for someone to work as part of a trailblazing team of data scientists who create groundbreaking analytical solutions that improve our core work enterprise wide.
As a Data Scientist I, you will be supporting Financial Reporting Control(FRC) Data & Analytics function to deliver:

column10: >Quality checks, data integration and refresh of various reports used for policy governance.

>Create reports for FRC’s oversight and monitoring mandate including business rules & data lineage for various reports, reports for submission to Internal Audit for remediation testing, progress updates for Project Lotus, etc.
>Add and operationalize incremental metrics related to new policy requirements, monitoring and oversight.

column9: >Operationalization of Chart of Accounts Policy (CCOA Policy)

column1:
Our Values
At TD we’re guided by our purpose is to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues, and share a set of values that shape our culture and guide our behavior. In exchange for how our colleagues show up to help TD succeed, we are committed to delivering a colleague experience grounded in Impact, Growth and a Culture of Care. No matter where you work across TD, we empower you to make an impact at work and in your community, explore and grow your career and be part of our caring and inclusive culture.

Making Your Well-being a Priority
A caring and supportive culture that promotes colleague well-being is core to who we are. At TD, we focus on total well-being with extensive programs to help colleagues assess, manage, and improve their well-being across four core pillars — physical, financial, social and mental/emotional. In addition, we champion a safe, inclusive and supportive work environment to help colleagues feel a sense of belonging, and supported in their personal and professional growth. Through our focus on total well-being, we know that we can help our colleagues thrive, contribute to our culture of care, and support better business outcomes … because when colleagues feel their best, they’re more likely to do their best.

Our Total Rewards Package
Our Total Rewards package reflects the investment we make in our colleagues to help them, and their families achieve their well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes a base salary, variable compensation, and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits including medical, dental, vision & mental health coverage, savings and retirement programs, paid time off, banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition programs.

How We Work
At TD, we believe in-person connections fuel collaboration and collective creativity. Our workplace experience empowers colleagues to do great work side-by-side at TD locations, while offering flexibility to work remotely where it makes sense for the work and team. Our teams work in one of three workplace models: hybrid, onsite and primarily remote. Wherever our colleagues are working, they’ll always have access to the TD community and experience our culture of care.

Who We Are
TD is one of the world’s leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues. TD is a customer obsessed organization, and we are deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you’ve got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we’re here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing – and so will you.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
At TD, we’re committed to fostering an environment where all colleagues are encouraged to bring their authentic selves to work, experience equitable opportunities, and feel respected and supported. We’re dedicated to building an inclusive workforce that reflects the diversity of the customers and the communities in which we live and serve.

How We’re Helping Make an Impact in Communities
TD has a long-standing commitment to help drive progress towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. That’s why we launched the TD Ready Commitment in 2018, now a multi-year North American initiative. Under the TD Ready Commitment, we are targeting a total of $1 billion by 2030 in community giving four key, interconnected drivers of change: Financial Security, Vibrant Planet, Connected Communities, and Better Health. It’s our goal to help support change, nurture progress, and contribute to making the world a better, more inclusive place for our customers, colleagues, and communities.

Accommodation
Your accessibility is important to us. Please let us know if you’d like accommodations (including accessible meeting rooms, captioning for virtual interviews, etc.) to help us remove barriers so that you can participate throughout the interview process.
We look forward to hearing from you!

column4: >to join our platform architecture team. This role is an opportunity to apply state-of-the-art ML that will shape the future of scientific discovery. You will be a key player in accomplishing BenchSci's mission to exponentially increase the speed and quality of like-saving research and development. Your work will have an impact on thousands of scientists across the world who rely on BenchSci for their research.

column2: >Reporting to the Head of the Platform Architecture Group, you will work on complex and challenging ML architectures (model level and data pipeline level). You will be responsible for the high-level design of technical solutions end to end. You will work closely with our ML teams, provide guidance and mentorship, and set the technical direction throughout the ML Development Lifecycle.
>BenchSci is a remote first organization. At this moment, we are welcoming applicants from Canada.

column1: • Join the Platform Architecture Group, collaborate with Staff Engineers and architects and provide high-level end-to-end solution design for the company’s mission critical initiatives.
• Design ML Architecture across multiple ML and Data Teams in order to build robust, scalable and production-ready solutions that enhance the speed and quality of life-saving research.
• Write, review and approve ML and Data technical documentation to ensure quality and accuracy of performance and results.
• Contribute to the ML and Data roadmap by ensuring project proposals are both highly impactful and technically feasible.
• Continuously improve our workflows by keeping up to date with the latest optimizations in libraries such as PyTorch, and expand our usage of modern tools such as DVC.
• Own ML solutions and long-term technical investments that will drive innovation at BenchSci.
• Lead technical design discussions, apply best practices, diagnose problems and lead the resolution while fostering an inclusive environment.
• Participate and contribute to Agile grooming, planning and estimation.
• Promote the definition of coding guidelines and raise the bar for code quality using tools such as SonarCloud.
• Provide guidance to senior engineers and help to foster a culture of continuous growth.
• Work cross functionally with different stakeholders including BenchSci's R&D scientists to learn, model, and capture the nuances of biology.
• At least 8 years of professional experience applying ML techniques to solve business problems, with at least 2 years at a Staff Engineer level.
• Strong experience with Python and programming fundamentals.
• Track record of successfully delivering robust, scalable and production-ready ML models.

• Experience with the full ML development lifecycle from architecture and technical design, through data collection and preparation, model selection, training and evaluation, to deployment and maintenance.
• Experience with data manipulation and processing, such as SQL or pandas. Experience with Cloud solutions and Cloud architecture, in particular with MLOps, DataOps and data warehouses.
• Experience leading technical design discussions, writing and reviewing technical design documents and providing technical guidance and directions.
• Ability to reason about trade-offs and make technical decisions under a certain level of uncertainty. Strong cross-team communication and collaboration skills.
• A growth mindset and a constant desire to learn.
A great compensation package that includes BenchSci equity options

column2: plus company closures for 15 more days throughout the year

column1: BenchSci's mission is to exponentially increase the speed and quality of life-saving research and development. We empower scientists to run more successful experiments with the world's most advanced, biomedical artificial intelligence software platform.

Backed by Generation Investment Management, TCV, Inovia, F-Prime, Golden Ventures, and Google's AI fund, Gradient Ventures, we provide an indispensable tool for scientists that accelerates research at 16 top 20 pharmaceutical companies and over 4,300 leading academic centers. We're a certified Great Place to Work®, and top-ranked company on Glassdoor.

BenchSci relentlessly builds on its strong foundation of culture. We put team members first, knowing that they're the organization's beating heart. We invest as much in our people as our products. Our culture fosters transparency, collaboration, and continuous learning.

We value each other's differences and always look for opportunities to embed equity into the fabric of our work. We foster diversity, autonomy, and personal growth, and provide resources to support motivated self-leaders in continuous improvement.

You will work with high-impact, highly skilled, and intelligent experts motivated to drive impact and fulfill a meaningful mission. We empower you to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and thrive. Here you will be challenged to stretch yourself to achieve the seemingly impossible. Learn more about our culture.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: We're committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. We believe that improving diversity, equity and inclusion is our collective responsibility, and this belief guides our DEI journey. Learn more about our DEI initiatives.
Accessibility Accommodations: Should you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs. Please reach out to talent@benchsci.com.

column2: >Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

>We are looking for an enthusiastic Lead Data Engineer who can help us bring focus, flow, and joy to all developers at TELUS as part of our Platform Engineering team.

We believe that a strong data science competency is required at TELUS for our business to be successful, and that happy humans build fantastic software. And so our calling is to improve developer focus, flow, and joy at TELUS. This means implementing changes to our systems and processes to make developer platform insights into reality.

>Lead a team of data engineers, data analysts and developers on our journey to strengthen the developer experience through all data ingested, secured, managed, processed and analyzed on our metrics platform
>Lead initiatives that will improve focus, flow, and joy for software developers across the organization
>Work with equally smart, grounded and collaborative individuals, as well as down-to-earth leaders who get stuff done and deliver measurable results
>Lead challenging and interesting problems, and strive to do the right thing, the right way and continuously improve via KPIs
>Innovate every day and have the freedom to contribute your ideas
>Drive the development of data analytics strategy by developing and enhancing data democratization principles
>Present our users with relevant, actionable and timely data to improve on software development KPIs such as stability, velocity and availability
>The platform engineering team is delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data,

>We are entrepreneurial and passionate, we believe that anything is possible and can be achieved by innovative and meaningful outcomes for our customers, team members and that through meaningful and impactful endeavors we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives.
>We intend to shape the future of how machine learning, data processing and analysis can drive TELUS through insights that solve releasing software to production on-demand.
>Help architect the future of our enterprise data solutions and leverage the best of Google Cloud’s data management, analysis and machine learning capabilities and drive forward our data strategy.
>Overseeing the team that builds and iterates data pipelines to process data either where it lives, or across boundaries into a single system.
>Analyze datasets, build data relationships and models to generate reports, meaningful insights and machine learning automation to support the business
>Build a cohesive data platform that extends between the cloud and our data centers which can ingest, transform and process data.
>Support operational efficiencies across our people, software engineering processes, management and our technical programs by leveraging data retrieved from our systems and tools.
>Lead the team supporting the data pipelines feeding into our machine learning algorithms and models. Explore the latest tools and API’s that can help optimize our Machine Learning operations.
>Lead the team to assist the extracting, loading, transforming, cleaning, and validating of data from both inside and outside of Telus.
>You are recognized for your 5+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical capacity
>You are sought out for your 5+ years experience of Data Lake and platforms implementation with experience implementing and performance tuning
>Realize the vision of Data Democratization for software delivery metrics. Educate our customers on how to work with data to improve and reap the rewards
>Google Cloud Dataflow and Google BigQuery experience
>Experience working with Google Cloud data products (CloudSQL, Spanner, Cloud Storage, Pub/Sub, Dataflow, Dataproc, Bigtable, BigQuery, DataLooker, Dataprep, Composer, etc)
>You are respected for your experience in designing and deploying distributed, multi-technology, data processing systems
>You bring systems design experience with the ability to architect and explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces and APIs
>You bring a deep understanding of and experience with software development and programming languages and Python, Perl and Shell scripting
>Communication skills to ensure effective management of relationships, prepare presentations for leadership consumption.

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

column1: The Senior Manager, Retail Deposit Analytics is responsible for leading a team of analytics professionals in conducting analyses and making fact-based recommendations across the Retail Deposits and Day to Day Banking portfolios. The incumbent will deliver strategic and tactical knowledge to facilitate the execution of strategies that will enable profitable growth of Deposit customer base, increase customer engagement and optimize revenue margins for the business. He/She will work with multiple stakeholders and partners within and outside Scotiabank to develop optimal strategies based on excellent analytical, database marketing, people management, communication and relationship management skills.
Accountability 1 - Analysis & development support for acquisition and campaign strategies

• Collaborate with Retail Deposit and Day to Day banking team to profitably grow customer base. Proactively provide strategic analysis that will assist the business to optimize new & existing accounts and product mix from various channels. Grow day to day banking customer base within multiple segments of Scotiabank customers and enhance opportunity to acquire non-Scotiabank customers.
• Work closely with marketing team to develop analytical and segmentation strategies that enhance Deposit customer engagement initiatives while optimizing budgets as well as margins. Collaborate with Retail Marketing and Customer Decisioning teams to implement and fulfill campaigns while ensuring seamless customer experience.
• Lead the data science initiatives to optimize pricing and targeting strategies to drive acquisition & retention of chequing balances. This role works closely with Retail Deposit team, finance, treasury, channel partners to recommend pricing and targeting strategies to grow deposit portfolio.
• Evaluate new campaign ideas based on business opportunities and revenue growth
column2:
provide initial sizing and develop business case. Provide go/no go recommendation by examining overall P&L impact to the bank.
• Collaborate with Campaign Design, Products and Retail Marketing teams to support optimal acquisition and customer migration initiatives driven through centralized campaign execution engine.
• Work closely with segmentation/modeling experts within or outside Scotiabank to create new and effective ways of targeting customers in order to maximize efficiency of acquisition campaign strategies.
• Continuously acquire and enhance knowledge of business/product strategies, competitive practices, market insights and other policies, technical processes and advanced analytical tools/methodologies in order to best provide business solutions to all key constituents
• Effectively manage and prioritize multiple business initiatives, projects and ad-hoc analysis with business stakeholders and/or external partners/consultants.

column1:
• Lead the creation of ongoing measurement of acquisition/engagement campaign strategies relative to the pro-forma/plan. Provide actionable insights and recommendations to business stakeholders on an ongoing basis in order to maximize business results and enable the creation of an ongoing learning loop.
• Develop pro-forma for acquisition/engagement campaign initiatives working closely with multiple stakeholders at Scotiabank.
• Identification of portfolio trends and key statistics using advanced analytics
column2: Effective and timely communication of strategic and operational results to the business teams
column3:
• Providing analytical support and profit insights on a regular and ad-hoc bases within Retail Canadian Banking with an eye towards driving business growth and profits
• Provide business support to all areas of Retail Deposits and Day to Day Banking including Business development, Product, Acquisition and Analytics. Work with Finance for business case development and to report results to Senior Management as well as provide outlook/projection

column1:
• Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
• Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
• Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.

• In-depth analytics experience and solid business acumen are required. Extensive marketing & campaign analytics and decision support experience is strongly preferred along with a comprehensive understanding of portfolio optimization and financial P&L levers.
• Proficiency utilizing a variety of analytical tools including Python, R, SAS, SQL and Excel and a solid knowledge and understanding of advanced analytical concepts and methodologies.
• A proven ability to rapidly, effectively and accurately extract and interpret data and transform it into meaningful and actionable business insights.
• Exceptional oral and written communication skills, with a demonstrated ability to present and translate highly technical concepts to a wide audience.
• A strong sense of urgency and a proven ability to understand, and effectively assess multiple, ongoing requests.
• Strong prioritizing, planning, analytical, presentation, project management, people management and relationship building skills
• Proven track record of success in maintaining, leading and motivating a productive team of analytics professionals.
• Displays a high level of analytical maturity and sophistication, financial acumen and a solid understanding of profit drivers, KPIs and other factors that will contribute to successful growth initiatives.
Educational Requirements
• Minimum Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, Engineering or Statistics
• MBA (Finance or Marketing)/CFA/FRM or Master in Analytics - preferred

column1: At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

The Advanced Analytics & AI team is a hub of data science expertise within CIBC, and is leading the way in applying the best practices in predictive science, machine learning, leveraging massive datasets and the latest in big data technology platforms. As a Senior Data Scientist in Advanced Analytics, you will work with business and technology partners to deliver solutions that meet their analytical needs and help serve our clients.

You will work with real world structured and unstructured datasets to produce end-to-end solutions, taking models from experiment to deployment. We collaborate with industry partners in the space of AI and machine learning, and engage with leading academic researchers to promote the exchange of ideas and enrich our talent.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role you’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com

The Global Compliance Department mission is to foster a culture of integrity, ethics and compliance and deliver independent risk management and oversight of regulatory compliance risk and conduct risk throughout TD. This is performed in accordance with the Global Compliance Department Mandate, in execution of the Global Compliance Operating Framework (GCOF). The department achieves this by independently assessing the adequacy of, adherence to and effectiveness of regulatory compliance management programs and controls in the business
column2: delivering objective guidance and independent challenge
column4: and providing trusted and reliable reporting, advice and opinion to senior leadership and the Board on the state of regulatory compliance risks, controls and outcomes.

column1:
Do you want to dive into the intersection of fairness and machine learning? Do you want to tackle how we can leverage explainability approaches to open machine learning and AI black boxes for customers? Are you passionate about technology and ethics? If so, then this is a job for you.
As the backbone of our financial system, banks have rich large-scale datasets and are rapidly adopting machine learning solutions to improve customer experience and drive business performance. While machine learning is increasingly pervasive across society, there are many outstanding questions and challenges to ensure that ML/AI solutions are fair and transparent. In this position, you will play a key role in ensuring the ethical application of machine learning.

This position reports to the Senior Manager, Compliance Oversight of Models Office. Detailed accountabilities include:
• Conduct research on how to identify, assess, and address ML modeling risks and associated concerns, especially fairness and explainability
• Evaluate ML model development procedures and processes for model compliance risks (e.g., unfairness)
• Support the development of technical standards and guidelines covering model risk matters, and draft key Compliance documents in appropriate coordination with stakeholders
• Maintain up-to-date knowledge of techniques and developments in the field of machine learning and share knowledge with business partners and senior management
• Lead compliance review of machine learning use cases across TD, and build a close working relationship with business units across the Enterprise. Objectives include:
o Supporting compliance risk management associated with models used by TD
column2: o Supporting the business in identifying models whose outcomes impact customers or communities
column3: o Assessing models for regulatory compliance and conduct risk, including fair banking risk
column4:
and
o Supporting the business in monitoring regulatory compliance and removing or mitigating conduct risk throughout the model lifecycles.
• Partner with Legal, Privacy, Model Validation and other Compliance Units (e.g., TDI Compliance, and TDS Compliance)
• Represent Compliance in projects that have a regulatory compliance component and/or carry regulatory risk exposure related to the use of a model or tool

column1: The position involves working effectively with different internal partners such as TD Wealth, TD Insurance, ED&A, PBDA, and Layer 6 among others.

The successful candidate will join the Compliance Oversight of Models Office (COMO), an interdisciplinary team that sits at the intersection of data science, regulatory understanding, and ethics. COMO is responsible for the global compliance oversight of models from a regulatory compliance and conduct risk perspective. COMO’s oversight spans the model lifecycle and engagement with disparate model stakeholders. The COMO mandate includes but is not limited to:
• Assessing models for regulatory compliance and conduct risk
column2: • Providing oversight and independent challenge to approaches used to identify, assess, and address model compliance risks and concerns (e.g., fairness/bias and explainability)
column3:
and
• Supporting the business in monitoring regulatory compliance and removing or mitigating conduct risk throughout the model lifecycle.

column1: COMO embraces a multidisciplinary approach, celebrating the alternative, multi-faceted perspectives needed to ensure that AI is developed and deployed ethically. COMO is committed to helping team members develop professionally and expand their horizons because the best way to address the ML challenges of tomorrow is to have a team that can see those challenges today.

• Hands-on data science expertise including, but not limited to, machine learning, statistics, and data visualization
• Experience with/knowledge of methods, techniques and tools to support explainable AI (XAI) and address ML bias/fairness
• The ability to stay abreast of developments in artificial intelligence and machine learning and provide thought leadership on same
• The ability to effectively collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders (e.g., business partners and control partners) across the model development lifecycle and as part of enterprise initiatives
• Ability to influence people and deal with conflicting points of view and to effect creative and responsive solutions
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• Comfort representing Compliance in executive-level initiatives and meetings, and working with all levels of staff within the Enterprise
• Work effectively as a team to peer review other team member model reviews and share knowledge
• Establish strong relationships with Business Units, Control Partners, Compliance Units, acting as a primary Compliance contact for model and tool compliance risks
• Assist with response to regulatory inquiries, examinations and investigations as applicable.
• Represent Compliance in projects that have a regulatory compliance component and/or carry regulatory risk exposure.
• Quick learner who constantly works on improving skills and expertise.
• Good time management and multitasking skills with minimal supervision.

EXPERIENCE & EDUCATION:
• Postgraduate degree (preferably in computer science, math, statistics, engineering, or related quantitative field)
• Relevant experience with the machine learning model development lifecycle (model validation expertise would be especially advantageous)
• Demonstrated engagement with the issues of explainability and/or fairness in the context of advanced analytics and machine learning

column5: >Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

column1: The Manager, Financial Reporting, will assist in the analysis, monitoring and reporting of Retail Credit Risk, Small Business & Wealth Management portfolios including monthly, quarterly and annual reporting for Scotiabank's senior management, investors and regulators.

• Assist in the preparation of Global Retail Credit Risk monthly, quarterly and annual portfolio reporting for Bank Executives and external stakeholders:
  • Development, analysis and maintenance of key senior management reports including data management, presentation, documentation, quality assurance and operational production effectiveness
  • Provide prompt and sound analysis of performance of the Retail, Small Business and Wealth Management portfolios to support management decisions
  • Participate in the identification, assessment and monitoring of credit risk trends and communicate adherence to authorized risk tolerance parameters
  • Extract, review, and analyze data from Enterprise General Ledger, Enterprise Date Lake & other various sources to address Global Retail Credit Risk ad-hoc reporting needs and projects
  • Prepare quarterly regulatory reporting and financial note disclosure:
  • Interact with the Canadian & International Retail Risk groups, Finance, Audit and other Bank departments to ensure information provided is accurate and reliable
  • Prepare reconciliations and analysis of Retail Risk and financial information to ensure that the data discrepancies are properly known and identified.
  • Assist in developing enhancements for reporting and data aggregation by:
  • Following and keeping up-to-date with regulatory requirements, End User Computing guidelines, RDARR principles and other data-related requirements
  • Improving the reporting methodology, modifying requirements per regulator guidance, identifying streamlining opportunities and redesigning as appropriate
  • Provide key support and technical expertise in data management and validations, report automation and trend analysis
column2: Work with technology teams to identify issues and implement solutions.

column1:
• University degree in business (finance or accounting) or a quantitative field (mathematics or statistics).
  • A minimum of 5 years progressive experience and functional competencies in development, analytics and delivery of senior management reporting including monthly, quarterly reporting
column2:
experience in Retail Banking, Retail Credit Risk and financial / quantitative methodologies.
  • To be successful in the position, the incumbent must have the following competencies:
    • Must have knowledge and experience in SAS, SQL and VBA.
    • Knowledge of current industry trends, regulatory requirements and industry best practices
    • Familiar with the Bank's General Ledger and / or has experience with preparing financial note disclosures
    • High level of proficiency in using MS Office suite of applications (MS Word, MS Excel, MS Access, MS PowerPoint)
    • Ability to analyze raw data
column3:
strong ability to understand and write business requirements.
  • Sound project and time management skills
column5: strong communication skills, both verbal and written
column6:
a highly proactive attitude, and use of initiative and independent judgment
  • Experience with Power BI or Tableau and open source programming like SQL, R or Python are considered an asset.

column5: >There's no better way to kickstart your career than to do a co-op or internship with Scotiabank! During your work term, you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a winning team, build your network, and discover what you love – all while getting paid to do it! There’s a place for every type of student at Scotiabank and all that we ask for is that you have passion and strong AOO (Attitude, Ownership and Opportunity).

After successfully completing a co-op or internship with top performance, we will work with you to establish your future placements. As a result, you will get to learn, grow, and experiment within different areas of both Scotiabank and Tangerine!

0dfa24d6-0eb1-4820-a3dc-82d5b2267224,37638629,Darwin AI,Full-Stack Developer ☑️,on_site,"Toronto, ON, Canada",2020-08-05T13:29:33.650Z,"

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

Our technical team, which contains an impressive blend of academic and enterprise talent, is in need of talented developers to help design and release our platform. You will be a key resource in helping us implement the User Interface and Visualization elements of our optiimization and explainability platforms, and have expertise with some or all of the following technologies: JavaScript, CSS/HTML, Angular, JSON, ReactJS, Redux and Node.js. Skillsets aside, you are an exceptional and conscientious Full-Stack developer with a talent for creating compelling and seamless User Interfaces that befit our cutting-edge technology. Note that experience with Artificial Intelligence and Deep Learning is not required. In fact, this is your chance to familiarize yourself with these technologies by working at the cutting edge with research team that’s won numerous awards in the field (including best workshop paper at the prestigious NIPS conference in 2016 and 2017). It’s an opportunity to work not only with AI, but with ‘AI that builds AI’ – a radical, inventive concept that will usher in the next wave of deep learning tools.
• Min 2 years of exp with Angular, NodeJS and Typescript.
• Data Visualization frameworks like D3, C3 etc

09687f2d-8297-4510-bc0b-ab214747262e,178993304,TD Bank Group,Data Scientist I,on_site,"Toronto, ON",2022-12-19T17:24:02.800Z,"<div class=""jobdetail-desc"" id=""gtm-jobdetail-desc"">

Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com

We are looking for world-class engineers to tackle cutting-edge problems of applying Machine Learning (ML) in the real world. Working across TD, you will be part of a leading financial services brand, have access to some of the largest datasets and innovate with leading machine learning scientists and engineers. Unleash the power of Machine Learning by helping us engineer models that scale and are rapidly deployable and, in the process, positively impact millions of customers. The goal of the team is to develop framework and automation solutions to help build and deploy robust and high-performing models through introducing software engineering best-practices.

As Machine Learning Engineer at TD, you will work with ML Scientists to learn their modelling workflow, so that you can design abstractions and build components that can be combined to build high quality models. You will work to develop and/or integrate tools that help with model monitoring, governance and explainability. You will work with ML Platform team to make sure these models can be trained and deployed on our computing infrastructure, taking advantage of cloud technologies like Azure Kubernetes and more.
• Experience working on high-performance engineering teams and being part of cross-functional delivery teams
• Experience with building and scaling data-intensive software in Python
• Knowledge of machine learning modelling workflow and manage machine learning lifecycle
• Experience building and manage a machine learning data pipeline
• You value good software design and sweat over details in code and API design
• You enjoy learning new technology and educating others
• You strive to communicate clearly and with empathy
• You take great personal pride in building robust and scalable software
• You are highly accountable and have a strong sense of ownership
• Ability to do detailed code reviews and give thoughtful feedback
• Experience building a library or a framework
• Knowledge of one of javascript framework, such as React, Vuejs or Angular
What can you bring to TD? Tell us about your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
Our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

The Marketing, Strategy and Data Insights team supports TELUS Future Friendly Home (FFH) by unlocking the power of data and producing deep analytics to deliver actionable insights and generate value for our business and our customers. We are looking for someone passionate about data and new technologies to join our data science group and be a key player in our Machine Learning and AI journey. Always wanted to work with a team of innovators and be part of a culture that embraces creativity and collaboration? If so, we’d love to talk with you!

You’ll collaborate with teams across the company, seeking out innovative data sources such as speech analytics to help identify new business opportunities while championing data driven decision making and the accelerated adoption of AI. You will work closely with our marketing primes on the end to end journey, from ideation session for identification of use cases, to insights activation and monitoring of outcome.

As a Data Scientist on the team, you will leverage your expert knowledge of data science to automate and facilitate machine learning model development, training and deployment. The team takes pride in the Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning models and solutions they develop and deploy, and take ownership of each step of the process. From hypothesis generation, initial exploration of datasets, development of novel AI techniques, to automation of pipelines and ML models
column2: be a leader in our cloud migration journey.

column1: • Lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models
• Collaborate on end-to-end automation efforts required to bring models to production
• Work with structured and unstructured raw data to design and develop innovative predictive models, metrics, and dashboards to uncover actionable insights
• Visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that provide insights to the organization
• Influence how we approach business challenges and opportunities by driving the adoption of a data-driven mindset
• Develop re-usable code aimed at delivering on future goals faster and more reliably
• Build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities

• You are recognized for addressing business needs via your application of data mining and analysis, predictive modeling, statistics and other advanced analytical techniques in which you have previous hands-on work experience

• You are sought out for your skills in Machine Learning and AI, including classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP, predictive models and bring 3 or more years of hands-on work and practical business experience in the above areas
• You are a master communicator capable of breaking down technical and complex concepts in a way that is understood by non-technical audiences

• You have solid development experience with Python and you are comfortable using various data science libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy as well as frameworks like TensorFlow, and have applied these skills towards solving actual business matters
• You possess advanced knowledge in SQL and Apache Spark
• You are familiar with at least one of the cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure
• You are agile and have a bias for action, removing roadblocks to get results fast
• Masters or PhD degree in a quantitative field such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or Data Science

9c79cb31-b526-4503-a38c-a20c8dbf70c9,170605616,TD Bank Group,Machine Learning Engineer  Framework (Layer 6),on_site,"Toronto, ON",2022-11-24T17:24:03.072Z,"<div class=""jobdetail-desc"" id=""gtm-jobdetail-desc"">

Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com

Layer 6 is a leading Canadian machine learning applied research company, a fully owned subsidiary of TD Bank Group. Layer 6 develops advanced machine learning and deep learning systems that have the power to uplift large populations while advancing the field of artificial intelligence. Our research is supported by access to massive datasets, close collaboration with world renowned academic faculty, and a uniquely scalable machine learning platform.

Our technical capabilities have been publicly recognized through a number of wins in various international machine learning competitions, including the prestigious ACM RecSys Challenge (the only repeat winner in 2017 and 2018 and runner-up in 2019), Google’s Landmark Retrieval Challenge (2nd place in 2018, 3rd place in 2019), the Stanford Question Answering Dataset (2nd place in 2019), 3rd YouTube-8M Video Understanding Challenge (winner in 2019) and Open Images 2019 – Visual Relationship (winner in 2019).

column2: >We are looking for world-class engineers to tackle cutting-edge problems of applying Machine Learning in the real world. column1: As part of the Machine Learning Frameworks team, you will design and build the cloud-based core engine powering enterprise use cases at the bank, enabling scientists to build high-quality machine learning models.
