column1: OMERS overall vision is to play a leadership role in the pension industry and be first of class, deliver superior services and to grow and attract investment partners. The core values are to be fair, have high integrity, respect for each other, provide superior service and work as a team.
The Corporate Objectives for OMERS is to provide secure pensions for all their constituents by:
• Investing to earn outstanding returns with due regard for risk
• Providing high quality service to our members and employers
• Building a culture of excellence and pride in OMERS
OMERS Operating Principles are: Financial Strength, Accountability, Member Focus, Talent and Reporting.

We’d be thrilled to have you join our team as we set up our Capital Markets Finance Data team for new and continued success! We’ll focus equally on expertise and excellence, paired with culture and community. We will serve OMERS teams primarily in Capital Markets, Total Portfolio Management, and the Corporate function through understanding their needs, delivering against their expectations, and contributing our proficiencies – to achieve collective wins. This role joins a team on a journey, with much future potential in a global, sophisticated, complex enterprise.

Scope: The Data Engineer is responsible for supporting the investment teams by enabling robust and reliable investment data, analytics, and reporting through investment technology and change management at one of Canada’s largest pension funds having assets exceeding $120 Billion.

• Design, develop, and help maintain data assets to extract, transform, and load data from various data files, APIs, and databases, and to make them accessible to various client-facing applications as well as investment data warehouse and internal tools

• Implement data strategies that prepare, transform, combine and manage structured and unstructured data (e.g. internal investment accounting systems as well as external third-party investment feeds) to integrate the data into an investment data warehouse and BI solutions
• Develop and operate highly scalable data pipelines and infrastructure that enable investment analytics, and investment reporting use cases
• Automate manual processes and optimize data delivery
• Utilize modern technologies for designing and building data solutions to meet business needs
• Partner with business analysts and reporting analysts to develop reports and PowerBI dashboards
• Support and troubleshoot existing investment data applications and BI reporting solutions as needed
• Work as part of a cross-functional agile team responsible for end-to-end delivery of business needs
• Collaborate and work effectively with business analysts and reporting analysts team members, and other investment professionals and leaders in solutioning and support

• Track of record working in a fast-paced environment and multi-faceted role that intersects with business and technical analysts to support existing solutions, solution delivery, and contributions as a project resource for investment system implementations and upgrades
• Strong experience with data management, investment systems, business intelligence, and other reporting technologies
• Experience with Microsoft based BI/ETL tools (e.g. SQL Server, SSRS, SSIS, data factory) or similar
• Experience with Cloud based data and analytics platforms (e.g. Snowflake, DataBricks, Azure Synapse)
• Deep proficiency in SQL, Python, and similar languages
• Demonstrated ability to handle multiple projects and tasks at the same time to support daily production issues
• Critical thinking skills with the ability to independently solve problems with data and/or reference documents
• Investment data modeling experience using the Kimball method is an asset
• Experience with BNY Eagle PACE, Calypso, and Charles River is an asset
• Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, or a related field
• A people-first focus with a desire to develop meaningful, positive relationships across all levels of the organization
• A teammate mentality coupled with servant leadership
• A sense of urgency, optimism, and a desire to deliver excellence
• A desire to drive debate, to speak candidly, and to listen empathetically
• Strong orientation towards strategy, change, and results

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $121 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2021. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.
Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data, and a data-product and data platform oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing. We are entrepreneurial and passionate, believers that so much more is possible and can be achieved by creating value and great outcomes for our customers, team members, communities, and environment and that through meaningful transformation we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives.

The Data Strategy and Enablement team has started its journey towards enabling further digital transformation in our data and advanced analytics space. Composed of Data Engineers, Business Systems Analysts and Data Architects our team focuses on building and enabling best-in-class data platforms with a focus on migrating our major on premise data warehouses to Google’s Cloud Platform. Join a dynamic team that is paving the way towards digital transformation and enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Make use of your analytical skills and ability to analyze and assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.
• Lead engagement with various Business Unit (BU) stakeholders across TELUS to understand their business and need for insights.
• Influence how BU stakeholders approach business challenges and opportunities by driving the adoption of a data driven mindset.
• Play the critical role of “translator” i.e. translating business problems into data problems and resolving these problems to generate value.

• Facilitate collaboration between BU stakeholders and our team and lead solutioning including use-case development, defining insight products and their roadmap and end-to-end automation efforts required to bring products to production. Track and prioritize the development of insight products on an ongoing basis and bring visibility to any roadblocks
• Support development of our team’s strategy, develop/present materials to TELUS executive leadership on an ongoing basis
• Support in measuring and tracking EBITDA-based value contribution by our team through collaboration with BU stakeholders and Finance
• You are recognized for addressing business needs via your innovative approach and application of AI and other advanced analytical techniques

• You are sought out for your skills in strategy development, problem-solving, structured thinking, advanced communication (both verbal and written), project management and bring 5 or more years of hands-on work and practical business experience in the above areas.
• You are a master communicator capable of breaking down technical and complex concepts in a way that is understood by non-technical audiences.
• You are familiar with cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure.
• You are agile and have a bias for action, removing roadblocks to get results fast
• You are experienced with Subscriber Analysis Application (SAA) from Scorecard Systems for RGU insights
• You are experienced with Informatica IICS and Powercenter ETL tools
• You are experienced in the data engineering field and comfortable in leading projects in it.
• You have GCP or other cloud certification.

Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com

What does TD stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and for almost every department, that begins with data.
As part of our Data and Analytics team, you’ll be a fundamental part of crafting business processes enterprise-wide by analyzing vast amounts of past and present data.

TD’s vision for the future? Tailored, customized banking products, services and experiences for every single customer. If you’ve been in business as long as we have, you know there’s no such thing as one size fits all, and a diverse, inclusive Data Analytics team is a massive part of that future achievement.

For this role, we’re counting on your intensive technical leadership to forge our path moving forward. As an emissary of the crucial nature of data science, you’ll work in close proximity others across the bank to identify and pursue new opportunities wherever they lie. You’ll play a crucial role on cross functional teams of data scientists, data and IT engineers and business process owners to build out and implement world-class analytic solutions enterprise wide. You can handle just how much data TD has, and cannot wait to help build statistical models that scale to them.
We are looking for someone to help parse our vast data and identify needs and analytical trends employing industry leading techniques and theories to improve TD’s business practices enterprise wide.
As a Data Scientist III, these are the essential qualifications of this role:

• Provide insight into leading analytic practices, designs and leads iterative learning and development cycles, and ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions that will become core deliverables
• Work closely with business owners to find opportunities and serve as an ambassador for data science
• Design and deliver enterprise analytic solutions for customers
• Develop powerful business insights from social, marketing and industrial data using advanced machine learning techniques
• Build complex statistical models that learn from and scale to petabytes of data.
• Analytical thought leadership and stay current on developments in data mining and the application of data science

• Work independently as a senior lead and may manage and direct activities related to analysis, design and support of technical data management solutions on various projects ranging in complexity and size
• Generally accountable for a significant business management area that typically has enterprise wide impact or accountability
• Enterprise or functional expert, requiring broad managerial and deep specialized knowledge at the enterprise, business, regulatory and industry levels
What can you bring to TD? Tell us about your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:
• Ten (10) or more years of relevant experience

column3: >Familiarity and experience with Optimization and Operations Research methodologies as applied in a commercial Marketing context
>Familiarity and experience with MarTech tools and process and the activation of machine learning and analytical outputs within these tools

Data governance and management at TD is part of an enterprise-wide data and analytics ecosystem. Adaptability is key. You may be part of the data and analytics professional community managing data assets aligned to TD’s overarching policies or strategies, or you may find yourself directly immersed in various lines of business. Data stewardship at TD spans the enterprise and welcomes experts like you to help drive our business forward while protecting the interests of our organization, customers and shareholders.

column7: >Are you an experienced data steward or data governance professional? Are you able to identify and manage data risk? If so, this role will enable you to support lines of business to identify and address various data risks, working in alignment with Bank-wide data standards and policy. This role will report into the Manager, Data Steward.

column2: >As a Data Steward, your ability to analyze, organize and prioritize will be foundational to your success in the role. Your strong ability to work with multiple stakeholders and form positive working relationships will be key. As a key member of the team, you will:

Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com

What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and this includes our vast data.

The Business Intelligence group delves into our data, past and present, to develop crucial metrics and reporting functionality that better informs and optimizes key businesses decisions across the organization.
This is the team building the tools, reports, dashboards, cubes and scorecards that deliver and process vital data to business partners across the enterprise.
Joining us in Business Intelligence & Reporting is an opportunity to advance and deepen your career and to help TD serve its customers in a way we never have before.

Senior Manager, Data Analytics & Reporting, Finance Risk Controls will be responsible for executing the detailed analytical work related to production of oversight and governance reporting, running monthly/quarterly completeness checks and managing dashboards within TD’s data environment and suite of tools (e.g., HIVE, PySpark, Tableau). The individual will support the team in strengthening of internal controls and enhancing governance and Quality Check (QC) program for financial controls across the Bank. The individual will support the team(s) in ensuring compliance with Finance policies and effectiveness of controls related to financial reporting.
• Managing end-to-end production of reports and dashboards supporting FRC in its mandate of oversight certain Finance policies and financial reporting controls
• Executing data pipeline and performing data engineering tasks using big data processing tools like HIVE, PySpark
• Performing bug fixes and updating existing business logic based on business feedback.
• Creating new metrics/tables and integrating them into the data pipeline on an ongoing basis
• Running any manual processes to support production of dashboards, e.g., preparing files for data ingestion into TD’s analytics environment

• Understanding metrics and validating those metrics with business partners, validating data quality for key performance metrics and performing root-cause analysis for any discrepancies noted, in alignment with relevant business partners
• Gathering requirements for creation of new metrics and reports for dashboards arising from evolving needs
• Collaborating with business partners in sourcing and maintaining reports and dashboard
• Leading review and walkthrough sessions with various business and technology partners
• Maintaining, prioritizing and implementing a feature backlog based on user feedback
• Enhancements of reporting and dashboard design to optimize dashboard performance
• Supporting management supervision and review, ongoing training needs, and change management.
• Documenting and setting up of operating procedures to support dashboard implementation e.g., data lineage, metric formulation, data modelling, use cases, etc.
• Preparing ad hoc reports and presentations, as required
• University degree in business analytics or other relevant fields
• 5+ years experience in data analytics, reporting and business intelligence roles
• Strong knowledge of big data processing tools like, Hive and HQL/SQL, Python and PySpark to extract and transform data
• Advance working knowledge of MS Excel, VBA and PowerPoint is highly preferred
• Experience in an accounting/finance role (financial services industry desirable)
• Internal controls experience will be an asset
• Familiarity with TD businesses, technology, finance and data ecosystem will be an asset
• Financial reporting, process, operations, internal controls, audit experiences will be an asset
• Excellent problem-solving skillsets with ability to interpret new business requirements, undertake deep-dive analysis and translate findings into actionable data insights
• Ability to work with numbers, large data sets and their interpretation for business impact
• Ability to make recommendations based on a combination of data, professional judgment and common sense
• Ability to navigate some level of ambiguity and execute
• Ability to synthesize data, extract meaning and utilize relevant information to identify opportunities and provide recommendations
• Effective communication skills (both written and verbal), organizational and time-management skills
• Good understanding of financial statement assertions and their practical application in controls

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. As a co-op/intern student at BMO, you will have the opportunity to be heard, keep growing and make a difference. You will be part of our campus program to gain the skills and knowledge needed to take on roles similar to the description listed below.

Our student experience is designed to integrate you to the BMO team from day one by adding value in the work you do. You will have the opportunity to participate in programs such as the Women in Technology Mentorship Program, BMO First Friend peer assignment, BMO Social Squad student-led activities, BMO U corporate learning platform and access to various Employee Resource Groups to further develop your network within BMO.

Interested in learning more about our campus program? Stay up-to-date with BMO Campus Recruitment by following us on Instagram @BMO_on_Campus and joining our LinkedIn group BMO Campus Recruiting & Early Talent.

Note: Only students currently enrolled in an academic program and returning to their studies will be considered for Co-op/Internship opportunities. Student who recently graduated are invited to apply to our New Grad opportunities which are available at

To apply for this opportunity, please submit your cover letter, resume and an unofficial copy of your academic transcript. By applying for this general posting, you will be considered for a number of different student opportunities across multiple locations. If you are selected to move forward, you will be provided additional information.

The BMO GAM Digital Engagement team is starting an exciting journey to modernize the current digital experience for investors and advisors. The team is seeking a well-rounded analyst who is comfortable working with marketing and systems data to support business strategy.

Consults on analytical solutions to understand, analyze, and synthesize requirements, goals and objectives relative to data and business intelligence needs and to enable high-quality, fact-based business decisions to drive better business outcomes. Provides advice on the configuration, functionality, applicability, and usability of data management, data analytics, and data visualization technology solutions. Supports the development of the strategy and roadmap for data quality and data analytics, data modeling, reporting, business intelligence, and the design and development of sophisticated decision support tools.
• Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions.
• Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.

• Builds reports and visualizations to effectively communicate data driven insights to users for a variety of audiences e.g. visualization solutions of data into reports, graphics, dashboards to illustrate facts, trends, and insights.
• Develops solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.
• Supports development and execution of strategic analytics & reporting initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
• Analyzes data and information to provide subject-matter insights and recommendations.
<li>Develops tools and delivers training programs for use of reporting tools and self-serve analytics by non-analytical end users
column2: may include delivery of training to audiences.

column1: • Documents and maintain operational procedures and processes relating to analytical and reporting processes.
• Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders in order to deliver on business objectives.
• Completes complex & diverse tasks within given rules/limits and may include handling escalations from other employees.

• Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.

    Qualifications:
• Knowledge and experience in data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to Tableau, SQL, R, Python.

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

column3:
>Requisition ID: 169910

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

column1: The Manager, Change and Integration, is responsible for delivering transformation activities for data and analytics across the enterprise. This mandate includes providing expertise to plan and execute the change interventions and strategies to ensure the executives, people managers, and employees at all levels adopt changes introduced through data and analytics programs, projects and initiatives to advance the Bank’s objectives. The incumbent is accountable for focusing on the people side of change and integration – including changes to processes, communications infrastructure, culture and standards – that maximize employee adoption and engagement and minimize resistance. This individual manages workstreams in training, communication, culture management, and stakeholder engagement across data and analytics. They will be responsible for the strategic execution to drive increased business usage of data & analytics across the organization.

The incumbent works to streamline change management activities and integrate interactions across data and analytics teams to drive faster adoption, higher utilization and greater benefits realization of data and analytics outputs in the Bank. In fulfilling the role, the incumbent interacts closely with cross functional working groups from both business and technical sides to support realization of the Bank’s Data and Analytics strategy.
Specifically, the individual will be responsible for:

• Organizing regular stakeholder engagements and working closely with teams to plan and execute key workstreams of the data & analytics culture change strategy and review results related to adoption of standards, processes and tools
• Implementing strategic communication and integration efforts for data & analytics to articulate its value and help businesses across the enterprise be data-driven (e.g., utilize more data & analytics in business decisions and become more self-sufficient)
• Collaborating with key stakeholders to deliver data & analytics upskilling opportunities across the global enterprise to raise its knowledge and maturity
column2:
Elevating the employee experience through departmental onboarding and development programs
• Contributing to the creative development and execution of high impact, engaging campaigns and content including: supporting internal communications for initiatives
column3: assisting with editorial calendars and content rollouts
column4: organizing events, developing written materials, multimedia and graphics in support of communications strategies

column1:
• Execute on key workstreams of the change roadmap for Customer Insights, Data & Analytics (CID&A), outlining business development plan and initiatives to raise data & analytics awareness, literacy, and usage
• Collaborate with the change management team for CID&A, leading and developing communications, training, brand awareness and requisite corporate culture change to drive adoption of data and analytics capabilities.
• Develop standard and reusable materials that can be leveraged by the CID&A, business lines, and corporate function partners, ensuring messaging and branding is consistent and aligned across data and analysis work streams and functions
• Deepen relationships with stakeholders across the enterprise to gain support of data & advanced analytics and build out a network of professionals to solve unique business problems
• Support the management of the enterprise Data, Analytics, and AI Community of Practice, equipping business lines and practitioners with the tools and information required to act as effective change agents across the bank
• Work closely with the broad Data Office team to execute creative work and strategies that will help achieve objectives such as enhancing the culture around the Bank’s data, increasing awareness, improving data capability understanding and value, and engaging business lines and corporate functions.
• Support organization of CID&A events such as townhalls, workshops, summits, etc., as required
• Coordinate partnerships (e.g. academia, industry vendors) to enhance data and analytics brand and talent, as required


Requirements & Qualifications:

• 3-8 years of work experience in Strategy, Change Management, Data & Analytics, Technology, Innovation, and Business Communication
• Demonstrated experience implementing Change Management and adoption strategies in an agile environment
column2:
Good understanding of culture change
• Experience in developing executive-friendly presentations and dashboards
• Strong communication skills with ability to present and influence diverse stakeholders
column3:
Spanish is desirable but not required
• Knowledge in communication best practices and approaches, as well as an innate ability to ‘connect the dots’ on seemingly remote thoughts or messages
• Effective execution skills to ensure the successful delivery/implementation of the change management strategy
column4:
Experience in project delivery and support
• Drive to succeed with bias towards action and ability to navigate large organizations and build collaborative relationships
column5:
Proven ability to engage and manage stakeholders in a complex, matrixed environment
• Strong curiousity to learn with adaptive and creative mindset
• Working knowledge of data and analytics technologies (big data tools, cloud/GCP, Hadoop, APIs, etc) and services (AI / Machine Learning, NLP, blockchain, chatbots, DevOps, agile delivery, etc) is an strong asset
• A Master’s degree in Business Administration, or Analytics and AI Management is an asset

column1: 5f33b2ec-b9ca-4e14-9ce3-9c09fd2e115a,190518298,TD Bank Group,"Senior Manager, Analytics & Insights",on_site,"Toronto, ON",2023-01-27T17:24:07.124Z,"<div class=""jobdetail-desc"" id=""gtm-jobdetail-desc"">

Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com
What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights.
We believe in the talent we grow to better serve our clients, and we know, many of the ground-breaking discoveries and products that represent the future at TD, can all be driven with data.

You’ll take the helm of a diverse, inclusive and collaborative group of highly skilled analysts that own reporting, insights and forecasting function for Canadian Fraud Performance Management. The Senior Manager reconciles and condenses/summarizes numerous metrics for our Executives and partners. As a leader with vision and key representative of your team, you’ll bring your talent for relationship-building to the fore, working closely with business owners and other business partners. You’ll work together to master their business objectives then identify their data and information needs and opportunities for adding value to the business. From there, you will oversee the development of ongoing analytics projects and initiatives, using your vast expertise to walk them through the process and provide ongoing support. Most importantly, your leadership inspires leadership in others, as well as the drive to execute with speed and precision and help bring TD into the future of business.
TD’s Fraud Strategy team is undergoing transformational change to become global market leaders. Come and lead this journey.
As a Senior Manager, Forecasting, Reporting and Insights you will:
• Oversee and lead a large and/or highly complex, and diverse analytics function for an area of significant risk, complexity or scope

<li>Strategically partner with leadership teams on the management of the portfolio and financials, with deep industry, external/internal, enterprise knowledge, recognizing and anticipating emerging trends and
column2: identifying operational efficiencies and opportunities with other business management /enterprise areas

column1: • Act as a “Single Point of contact’ for key Analytics initiatives including partnering with analytics teams and enterprise data and analytics capabilities
• Act as analytics expert on advanced analytics projects, challenging analytical thinking and methodology
• Facilitate key strategic discussions and provide thought leadership to executive audience (output may include strategic roadmap and/or deliverables/frameworks/short to long term goals etc.)
• Set operational team direction and partner to execute on common goals
• Manage teams of Business Insights & Analytics professionals/specialists
• Ensure team collaboration with partners on business problems/issues and provide fact-based analytical advice that aligns to strategy and drives shareholder value
• Manage raised client issues or priorities and contact appropriate areas to resolve or minimize business problems/issues
• Apply judgement, discretion and collaborate with internal partners to navigate and resolve ambiguous issues
• Review and craft the presentation of insights for executive leaders/business partners to drive strategic improvement
• Collaborate with business partners to shape and prioritize ad hoc analysis
• Use data systems and various sources to ensure team is equipped to formulate well-defined solutions to solve business problems
• Ensure team uses knowledge of data capabilities across the organization to build and deliver on business analytics and insights
• Oversee the development, testing and ongoing analysis for a business line or functional area employing both internal and external data from various sources

column2: assigning data request to staff based on skills and development needs

column1: • Build understanding of big data and advanced analytics capability
• Identify and articulate key LOB analytic needs and assist in accelerating their delivery

• Oversee strategies to attract, motivate and retain a highly diverse, qualified and engaged team to fulfill current and future business needs, creating and sustaining a high performing inclusive culture
Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:
• Bachelor’s degree in a numerate discipline (e.g. Statistics, Business) required
• Master’s degree in a numerate discipline (e.g. Statistics, Business) preferred
• Programming and databases knowledge, ability to process and analyze large volumes of data
• Background in reporting automation through BI tools like Tableau, Power BI, Hyperion, etc
• Strong leadership and general management skills in overseeing a team and working collaboratively across functions
• A high level of integrity, earning the respect and trust of her/his peer group and employees
• Ability to communicate strategy analysis to both technical and non-technical team members, either verbally or via documentation
• Conceptual thinker, ability to wade through data and arrive at conclusions
• Demonstrated analytical, financial modeling and problem-solving skills
• Solid understanding of Retail Products and Channels
• Knowledge of TD Finance system an asset
• Tools: SQL, Hyperion, Tableau, Power BI, Azure
• Sets appropriate context for the business unit/function to enable optimal performance and alignment to strategy
<li>Supports the creation of goals and objectives for the business unit/function
column2: Communicates those goals and objectives to the team

column1: • Builds capability support / executes plans to acquire, develop and retain the diverse teams with the skills and experience necessary to realize on current and future business strategies
• Role-models behaviors consistent with TD’s leadership profile, customer and employee experience agendas and risk and control culture
• Creates an extraordinary place to work advance and sustain a unique, inclusive culture that reflects TD’s diversity agenda, and creates an extraordinary employee experience
• Leads, coaches and develops a highly effective team by ensuring ongoing training and performance and development management

447413c0-f08c-4d41-8d37-3001af5234d9,194556479,Shopify Inc.,Senior Data Science Manager - Pricing/Promotions,on_site,"Ontario, Canada",2023-02-09T17:42:04.751Z,"

About the role

We are looking for a well-rounded Senior Data Science Manager with experience in pricing and incentive optimization to own projects whose scope impacts multiple disciplines and domains at Shopify. They will be responsible for deliverables that have implications on multiple product or service lines within Shopify’s plans & pricing organization. As a Senior Manager, they will grow not just individuals, but the leaders and teams that report into them.
• Use your experience in pricing optimization to define and implement plans & pricing strategies for Shopify.
• Define and guide the short-term and long-term data strategy for the money service line.
• Partner with other functional teams such as Engineering, Product, & Design to identify unsolved user and business needs resulting in data powered solutions that scale.

• Provide technical leadership to our data science teams and lead them as they analyze data, implement statistical techniques, create data visualizations, and build data pipelines (using Python, Spark, SQL, Mode, Tableau...etc).
• Cultivate a data-informed culture and deliver meaningful insights that drive product roadmaps and optimize business strategies.
• Drive excellent practices for establishing metrics & KPIs to drive cross-functional alignment.
• Collaborate with peer leaders in the product line Data Science team (and the broader Data org) to improve and drive the group-wide Data Science & Engineering vision.
• Documented experience in pricing optimization and defining pricing strategy through advanced analytics and data science efforts.
• Experience in driving customer growth through pricing optimization and experimentation.
• Been a leader in multiple tech companies where analytics on top of massive data sets drives product & business decisions.
• Previously managed other managers and can oscillate your leadership style relative to the needs of individual contributors that are also on your team.
• Exceptional problem solving and analysis skills combined with the ability to synthesize and effectively communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
• A product mindset that enables you to get to the root of problems faced by customers and users and to create data solutions and products to solve these challenges.
It would be great if you have experience with:
• Background in machine learning including experience implementing models at scale, including in the areas of price elasticity modeling and experimentation
• Experimentation: A/B test design and analysis, quasi-experiments
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

We know that looking for a new role can be both exciting and time-consuming, and we truly appreciate your effort. And remember, we want to know what you’re really interested in building and why you want to build it at Shopify, so please give us as much detail on this as you’d like in the answers on the next page. 👍 📖

column1: 897350c3-94aa-47df-a116-3a77eb0a0240,191127597,TD Bank Group,Senior Quantitative Analytics Analyst,on_site,"Toronto, ON",2023-01-30T17:24:05.768Z,"<div class=""jobdetail-desc"" id=""gtm-jobdetail-desc"">

Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com
Credit Risk Model Group (CRMG) provides subject matter expertise and creates a broad range of quantitative and qualitative models to support business and risk decisions.
• Participate in the development, tuning, and model documentation for new or amended Borrower Risk Rating (BRR), Facility Risk Rating (FRR), and Expected Loss (EL) models
• Engage with working groups of subject matter experts to ensure that all credit risk models are current and take into account best industry practices and standards
• Review and understand risk rating methodologies of public rating agencies (Moody’s, S&P, Fitch, DBRS) and identify potential gaps with internal models

• Review and complete robust documentation for all models, ensuring it is up to Model Validation and Model Risk Management standards. Reports include Model Development Reports, Annual Review Templates, and others as needed
• To participate in updating the Risk Analyst Peer Group database to facilitate comparative analysis on a quarterly basis
• To maintain the integrity of client information in the BRR and FRR databases, and to ensure that corporate compliance requirements related to client information are maintained on an ongoing basis
• To work closely with Credit Risk Policy in the launch of new initiatives or reviews, and to work extensively with TDBNA to ensure enterprise wide models are consistent cross-border
• To participate in extensive testing with Corporate Segment Technology Solutions (CSTS) to ensure that models meet design specifications and are operating as expected
• Create and manipulate extensive data spreadsheets for the purpose of model tuning, stress and sensitivity testing, and other model development purposes
• To maintain quarterly reporting to the Executive Steering Committee, including the Model Review Calendar, and One-Time Requirement tracking list
• Ensure that all model One-Time Requirements are closed by MVM on time
• To participate in data mining and data cleansing as required for model validations
• To participate in the model validation process as required, including providing documentation, expertise, and data for MVM
• To complete ad hoc analysis in a timely manner as requested
The successful candidate is expected to have:
• A university degree in Finance, Statistics, or a related discipline. A relevant professional designation (MBA, FRM, CFA) will be considered a plus

• Strong working knowledge and 3+ years extensive hands-on experience using MS Excel, MS Access, Python, R Language and or SQL in the context of data manipulation, data mining, statistical analysis, and predictive modelling
• Proficiency and extensive experience in creating and manipulating large data sets for data mining and statistical modelling from various internal and external source systems
• 3+ years of progressive work experience in a commercial/corporate banking function
• Working knowledge of Commercial Banking and TD Securities credit products, policies, and practices
• Working knowledge of concepts and methodologies, such as non-retail credit risk scoring techniques, used in the assessment of credit risk
• Working knowledge of Basel parameters (PD, LGD, EAD)
• Strong problem solving skills, ability to independently identify and solve problems in an effective and timely manner
• Strong communication skills (both written and oral), ability to effectively present technical, business, and project management subjects to multiple stakeholders

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

1289f1fa-24b3-4a93-9963-95f08fed3c94,188133207,Google,"Technical Solutions Developer, Google Cloud",on_site,"Toronto, ON, Canada",2023-01-18T17:20:02.892Z,"<div style="""">
Technical Solutions Developer, Google Cloud
Apply
• Bachelor\'s degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Math, or equivalent practical experience.
• 5 years of experience reading or debugging code in one or more of the following: Java, C, C++, Python, Shell, Perl, JavaScript.
• 5 years of experience with databases, data warehousing, information retrieval, or SQL.
• Experience troubleshooting and advocating for customer needs.
• Experience with distributed, columnar, analytic oriented databases, or distributed data processing frameworks.
• Experience with machine learning technologies, including developing, training models, or implementing solutions.
• Experience with open source distributed storage and processing utilities in Apache Hadoop or workflow orchestration products (e.g., Apache Airflow).
• Experience in data analytics, warehousing, Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) development, data science, or other Big Data applications.
• Understanding of basic web technologies, Transmission Control Protocol (TCP), Integration Platform (IP) concepts, Unix, or Linux basic administration and commands.
• Excellent attention to detail, troubleshooting, and communication skills.
About the job

The Google Cloud team helps companies, schools, and government seamlessly make the switch to Google products and supports them along the way. You listen to the customer and swiftly problem-solve technical issues to show how our products can make businesses more productive, collaborative, and innovative. You work closely with a cross-functional team of web developers and systems administrators, not to mention a variety of both regional and international customers. Your relationships with customers are crucial in helping Google grow its Cloud business and helping companies around the world innovate.

Technical Solutions Developers own customer issues and provide support to other support teams. You will be a part of a Global team that provides support to help customers seamlessly switch to Google Cloud. You will troubleshoot technical problems for customers with a mix of debugging, networking, system administration, updating documentation, and when needed coding or scripting.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
• Manage the customers problem through effective diagnosis, resolution, or implementation of investigation tools to increase productivity for customer issues on Google Cloud Platform products.

• Develop an understanding of Google product technology and underlying architectures by troubleshooting, reproducing, determining the root cause for customer reported issues, and building tools for faster diagnosis.
• Act as a consultant and subject matter expert for internal stakeholders in developing, sales, and customer organizations to resolve technical deployment obstacles and improve Google Cloud.
• Work as part of a team of Developers or Consultants that globally ensure 24-hour customer support.
• Understand customer issues and advocate for their needs with cross-functional teams (e.g., product, developing) to find ways to improve the product and lead high-quality production.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

To learn more about COVID vaccination requirements for US Google workplaces, read our Vaccination Entry Policy.

At Google, we’re committed to building a workforce that is more representative of the users we serve and creating a culture where everyone feels like they belong. To learn more about our diversity, equity, inclusion commitments and how we’re building belonging, please visit our Belonging page for more information.

We welcome and encourage people who are expecting and/or parents-to-be to apply to this or any other role at Google.

Google is a global company and, in order to facilitate efficient collaboration and communication globally, English proficiency is a requirement for all roles.

Consults on analytical solutions to understand, analyze, and synthesize requirements, goals and objectives relative to data and business intelligence needs and to enable high-quality, fact-based business decisions to drive better business outcomes. Provides advice on the configuration, functionality, applicability, and usability of data management, data analytics, and data visualization technology solutions. Supports the development of the strategy and roadmap for data quality and data analytics, data modeling, reporting, business intelligence, and the design and development of sophisticated decision support tools.
• Leads/participates in the design, implementation and management of new analytics & reporting solutions.
• Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions.
• Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.
• Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide subject matter insights and recommendations.
• Structures and assembles data into multi-dimensions with various granularities (e.g., demographics, customers, products, transactions).
• Monitors and tracks tool performance, user acceptance testing, and addresses any issues.
• Integrates information from multiple sources to enable more efficient processes, enhanced analysis and/or streamlined reporting.
• Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions.
• Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.

• Builds reports and visualizations to effectively communicate data driven insights to users for a variety of audiences e.g. visualization solutions of data into reports, graphics, dashboards to illustrate facts, trends, and insights.
• Develops solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.
• Supports development and execution of strategic analytics & reporting initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
• Analyzes data and information to provide subject-matter insights and recommendations.
<li>Develops tools and delivers training programs for use of reporting tools and self-serve analytics by non-analytical end users

column1: • Documents and maintain operational procedures and processes relating to analytical and reporting processes.
• Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders in order to deliver on business objectives.

• Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
• Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.

• Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.

    Qualifications:
• Typically between 4 - 6 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
• Knowledge and experience in data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to Spotfire, Tableau, SQL, SAS, R, Python, MATLAB, SPSS - Very good.
• Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience.

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

>Contributes to the overall success of the Fraud Management Group in Canada ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.

>Proactively contributes to the Fraud strategy by applying advanced analytics techniques to enhance fraud mitigation capabilities for multiple products across the Canadian Retail portfolio, including Day to Day Banking, Credit Cards, Unsecured Lending Products, Mortgages and Global Payments.
>Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
column5: >Develop, execute, and monitor fraud strategies for payment cards (credit and debit) including fraud types such as Card Present, Card Not Present (including 3D Secure), Account Takeover, etc.

column15: >Identify and escalate fraud risks that are or will become in excess of the Risk Appetite
column17: >Leverage data mining tools (SAS, Python, R) to formulate fraud strategies that minimize fraud losses while maintaining a positive customer experience and controlling operating costs

column3: >A University degree in statistics, mathematics or computer science
column5: >3-5 years analytical experience preferred including statistical analysis, ideally related to Fraud Analytics or Risk Management

column9: >Experience with PRM or similar fraud platform strongly desired
column11: >Strong prioritizing, planning, analytical, presentation, project management, and relationship building skills
column13: >Strong communication skills essential with clients, vendors and management
column15: >Must be self-motivated, energetic and results-oriented and be committed to adding value to the organization

50762f5c-9196-4b67-ad07-7625aa5ee7d8,214825251,Scotiabank,Senior Data Engineer - 8 Month Contract - CID&A,on_site,Canada : Ontario : Toronto,2023-04-13T17:22:02.754Z,"<div class=""joblayouttoken displayDTM""> <div class=""inner fontcolorb6a533a1"" style=""font-family:Arial , Helvetica , sans-serif

column3:
>Requisition ID: 174905

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

column1: The Customer Insights, Data, and Analytics organization at Scotiabank is focused on building high-value solutions across the bank. Our organization consists of accomplished professionals who blend expertise in computer science, data, machine learning, and banking to deliver innovative projects that drive the business. A key part of success for the group is having scalable, fast, and continuously evolving data processes, and this is the responsibility of the Data Office Data Engineering team. As an integral part of the team, the Data Engineer will be responsible for all technical aspects of the data pipelines that power advanced and descriptive analytics work.
We have a dynamic work environment that will provide you with exposure to leaders in data & analytics, the opportunity to continuously learn, and support to be innovative.

• Work with business teams across the organization (Canadian Banking, Intl. Banking, Treasury, GBM) to understand their data-driven goals
• Partner with advanced analytics teams to build powerful data assets and processes
• Be the subject matter expert on data driven processes, visualization workflows, and tools with which to analyze data
• Build automated data management and data quality capabilities into projects
• Build re-usable components to scale development across the organization, collaborating with other technical teams to streamline high-value data to the Analytics platforms
• Build re-usable managed datasets for consumption by both revenue generating analytics and operational corporate functions (e.g. finance, risk, etc.)
• Experiment & learn!

• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering, or related field or relevant experience
• Experience in finance is an asset
• Programming skills in Python, Scala, and /or Java. Experience with Spark is preferred
• Comfortable working in database environments. Experience with PostgreSQL, HDFS/Hive, MinIO an asset
• Exposure to Kubernetes, Airflow, Jenkins is an asset
• Familiarity with agile tooling to efficiently build as a team: git, Jira, Confluence, etc.
• Experience with visualization tools an asset: Power BI/Tableau
• Familiarity with data management capabilities (data registration, data quality, etc.) and ability to learn advanced data management toolsets
• High aptitude for diving in and picking up new technologies as required
• Eligible to work in Canada

Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com

column10: >What does TD stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and for almost every department, that begins with data.
column13: >As part of our Data and Analytics team, you’ll be a fundamental part of crafting business processes enterprise-wide by analyzing vast amounts of past and present data.
column16: >TD’s vision for the future? Tailored, customized banking products, services and experiences for every single customer. If you’ve been in business as long as we have, you know there’s no such thing as one size fits all, and a diverse, inclusive Data Analytics team is a massive part of that future achievement.

column6: >While you are a natural leader, you don’t mind getting your hands dirty. And in your role, you will simultaneously work to create data related solutions to drive business results, while working with senior leadership to communicate timelines and progress and identify business opportunities. You are not only a functional expert, you also possess broad managerial experience and specialized knowledge of regulatory and industry frameworks, using that knowledge to inform development cycles and develop industry leading analytic solutions. Most of all, your work ethic and thought leadership inspires your team to innovate with purpose, execute with speed, collaborate to deliver world-class data solutions and ultimately become leaders themselves.
column9: >We are looking for someone to work as part of a trailblazing team of data scientists who create groundbreaking analytical solutions that improve our core work enterprise wide.

b055dd06-4443-4ff9-9f09-e7648e88d2dd,265418794,Scotiabank,"Senior Manager, Data Ethics Governance and Operations",on_site,Canada : Ontario : Toronto,2023-08-31T16:22:02.390Z,"<div class=""joblayouttoken rtltextaligneligible displayDTM""> <div class=""inner fontcolorb6a533a1"" style=""font-family:Arial , Helvetica , sans-serif
column3: >

>Requisition ID: 183978

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

column1:
The Customer Insights Data and Analytics (CID&A) team at Scotiabank is at the forefront of the journey to transform the Bank into a data centric organization through impactful customer insights, innovative analytics, and well-governed data. One of the main areas of transformation is the way data is used, shared, and accessed at an enterprise level. The aim is to provide transparent, robust, and ethical data practices across the enterprise to enhance the protection of our customers’ data, and the way we deliver business value. We are looking to build our delivery team with influencers, makers, creators, and industry leaders who will drive us forward.
The role of the Senior Manager, Data Ethics Governance and Operations will be responsible for:

• Enabling the Bank’s adoption of the Data Ethics Framework with a Global scope
  • Leading definition and implementation of industry leading data ethics practices and processes
  • Supporting, facilitating, and monitoring the organization’s efforts to adhere to the Data Ethics Framework
  • Setting up the day-to-day operations of the team (e.g., reporting, metric/KPI/Audit tracking,).

We are looking for someone who will make key contributions in developing, planning, and executing the adoption of processes and tools that enable ethical data use, third party data sharing frameworks, and streamlining data access rights. This role will work closely with our legal, privacy, data office, analytics, and technology teams in the bank to design and develop the processes for the ethical use of data.

• Implement the operating model including standards, guidelines, and frameworks to enable ethical data use
  • Work closely with representatives across the bank to ensure activities are conducted in compliance with internal policies & procedures and emerging governing regulations
  • Works in cross-functional teams, providing guidance on data ethics standards and guideline
  • Participate in discussions focused on design and implementation of best practices and tools to support Data Ethics processes
  • Oversee the review process for: Data Ethics assessments (to provide ethical guidance for analytics, including AI and ML) and Sensitive Data reviews (to determine the level of protection required for data that is moving within the bank, including in cloud technology)
  • Ensures business stakeholder understanding, alignment and commitment to the objectives of the data ethics framework
  • Review the business stakeholders’ implementation of the data ethics framework for quality assurance and compliance
  • Ensure remediation and closure of audit issues within the stipulated deadline
  • Builds strategic relationships across the organization with counterparts in Risk, Compliance, Legal and other control functions to ensure consistency and alignment on best practices across the organization
  • Participate in planning and retrospective sessions, attend stand-ups, etc. – we work in an agile environment
  • Stay abreast of emerging ethical trends and ensure activities are always delivered with a best practice and innovation approach, reflecting appropriate technological developments for competitive business position
  • Lead a high-performance team – this is a people manager role

• 5+ years of experience in business/financial services
  • Knowledge and understanding of data governance, data policy, privacy
  • Ability to present ideas and facilitate discussions to build consensus at all levels.
  • Strong communication skills, both written and spoken
  • Ability to drive success in a high performing, flexible and small team environment
  • Strong analytical and communication skills and an ability to communicate and convey technical concepts into “layman terms”
  • Results orientation and pragmatic approach to decision making
  • Self-motivated, solution driven individual and adaptable to a fast-paced environment

column1: 31ef2877-ebb0-4c5c-8bfa-833cc76e0a98,265418913,TD Bank Group,"Senior Advisor, Business Insights",on_site,"Toronto, ON",2023-08-31T16:23:03.025Z,"<div class=""jobdetail-desc"" id=""gtm-jobdetail-desc"">

We’re committed to providing fair and equitable compensation to all our colleagues. As a candidate, we encourage you to have an open dialogue with your recruiter and ask compensation related questions, including pay details for this role.
What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights.
We believe in the talent we grow to better serve our clients, and we know, many of the ground-breaking discoveries and products that represent the future at TD, can all be driven with data.

With your wealth of experience with data and insights, you’ll act as a top advisor to your business partners and contacts across TD. Your goal? Work positively and professionally with your partners to inspire world-class, comprehensive analytical support. As a subject matter expert on the subject, TD will look to your interpretation of vast and complex data in the form of ongoing, multidimensional insights and relevant data analysis. You’ll use all the analytics tools at your disposal – including profiling tools, segmentation and advanced modelling and analytics – to add new dimension and drive to TD’s business growth and value. Finally, you own your space and are at the top of your game when it comes to relationship building, which will be key in your partnerships across the organization.
We are looking for someone to lead and cultivate a sizeable team of Business Insights & Analytics professionals/specialists.
As a Senior Advisor, Business Insights, you will:
• Work closely with business partners to gain deep understanding of the business and relevant objectives in order help drive the strategic direction of respective business and/or the enterprise
• Formulate relevant data analysis through comprehensive profiling tools, segmentation, as well as using advanced modeling and analytics
• Lead on the interpretation of complex business issues, generate multifaceted insights and find opportunities to help drive business growth or address business/enterprise needs
• Ensure team collaboration with partners on business problems/issues and provide fact-based analytical advice that aligns to strategy and drives shareholder value
• Generally accountable for a significant business or area that has cross business or enterprise wide impact or accountability
• Enterprise domain/ functional expert, requiring broad managerial and deep specialized knowledge at the enterprise, business, regulatory and industry levels
• Undertake and complete a variety of complex initiatives requiring seasoned specialist knowledge and/or the integration of cross functional processes
• Present and communicate generated insights and recommended business actions to stakeholders/ business leaders in an easily digestible manner
• Act as the primary contact with business to bridge and translate business requirements to analytics and reporting needs for a given domain/business
• Apply positive relationship management efforts to constructively influence and inspire working partners where appropriate
• Serve as an authority on a given business domain and provide business expertise to place context around analytics discovery and inform recommendations
• Raise data/process related problems and communicate to relevant teams in a timely manner and make recommendations for resolution
• Provides day-to-day support and delivery of analytics
• Build insights solutions end to end (from initial demand to results/recommendation presentation) ranging in complexity

• Enhance analytics capability by developing a “best-in-class” analytics team that delivers meaningful insights that drive measurable business value. Help make analytics a competitive advantage for TD.

• Oversee strategies to attract, motivate and retain a highly diverse, qualified and engaged team to fulfill current and future business needs, creating and sustaining a high performing inclusive culture
• Navigate complex organizational boundaries, stakeholder management, develop, manage and deliver on project/program plans

What can you bring to TD?
Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:
Ideal candidate will possess a broad depth of experience as a technologist in the data analytics space, with years of experience focusing on financial crimes.
• Experience in data analysis using programming languages such as Python, SQL, R, SAS or equivalent.
• Ability to communicate and explain analytical results.
• Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
• Proficiency in cloud computing and big data platforms, such as AWS, Azure, Spark, or Hadoop.
• Knowledge of visualization techniques, using software such as Excel, Tableau, Power BI.
Preferred candidate will posses one or more certifications within a financial crimes and accounting concentration:

Our Values
At TD we’re guided by our purpose is to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues, and share a set of values that shape our culture and guide our behavior. In exchange for how our colleagues show up to help TD succeed, we are committed to delivering a colleague experience grounded in Impact, Growth and a Culture of Care. No matter where you work across TD, we empower you to make an impact at work and in your community, explore and grow your career and be part of our caring and inclusive culture.

Making Your Well-being a Priority
A caring and supportive culture that promotes colleague well-being is core to who we are. At TD, we focus on total well-being with extensive programs to help colleagues assess, manage, and improve their well-being across four core pillars — physical, financial, social and mental/emotional. In addition, we champion a safe, inclusive and supportive work environment to help colleagues feel a sense of belonging, and supported in their personal and professional growth. Through our focus on total well-being, we know that we can help our colleagues thrive, contribute to our culture of care, and support better business outcomes … because when colleagues feel their best, they’re more likely to do their best.

Our Total Rewards Package
Our Total Rewards package reflects the investment we make in our colleagues to help them, and their families achieve their well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes a base salary, variable compensation, and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits including medical, dental, vision & mental health coverage, savings and retirement programs, paid time off, banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition programs.

How We Work
At TD, we believe in-person connections fuel collaboration and collective creativity. Our workplace experience empowers colleagues to do great work side-by-side at TD locations, while offering flexibility to work remotely where it makes sense for the work and team. Our teams work in one of three workplace models: hybrid, onsite and primarily remote. Wherever our colleagues are working, they’ll always have access to the TD community and experience our culture of care.

Who We Are
TD is one of the world’s leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues. TD is a customer obsessed organization, and we are deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you’ve got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we’re here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing – and so will you.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
At TD, we’re committed to fostering an environment where all colleagues are encouraged to bring their authentic selves to work, experience equitable opportunities, and feel respected and supported. We’re dedicated to building an inclusive workforce that reflects the diversity of the customers and the communities in which we live and serve.

How We’re Helping Make an Impact in Communities
TD has a long-standing commitment to help drive progress towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. That’s why we launched the TD Ready Commitment in 2018, now a multi-year North American initiative. Under the TD Ready Commitment, we are targeting a total of $1 billion by 2030 in community giving four key, interconnected drivers of change: Financial Security, Vibrant Planet, Connected Communities, and Better Health. It’s our goal to help support change, nurture progress, and contribute to making the world a better, more inclusive place for our customers, colleagues, and communities.

Accommodation
Your accessibility is important to us. Please let us know if you’d like accommodations (including accessible meeting rooms, captioning for virtual interviews, etc.) to help us remove barriers so that you can participate throughout the interview process.
We look forward to hearing from you!

2a1f3709-bbee-4142-8946-101b04d747a0,271560933,RBC,"Associate Director, Environmental & Social Risk Analytics",on_site,"Toronto, ON, Canada",2023-09-19T02:17:04.218Z,"<div class=""jd-info au-target"">

Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

As part of the Environmental & Social Risk Analytics team within Group Risk Management, you will play a role in the management, monitoring, and mitigation of environmental and social (E&S) risks at RBC. You will support and lead the design and implementation of key climate and E&S risk initiatives by providing research and data analytics and insights.

A significant focus of this role will be the calculation of RBC’s financed emissions across different asset classes within carbon-intensive sectors and setting and tracking progress on net-zero targets.

• Work with the Director, E&S Risk Analytics to assist in the advancement of RBC’s capabilities in measuring financed emissions, setting net-zero targets, and delivering carbon accounting insights across the enterprise.
• Support target setting through economic and industry research, making powerpoint slides and reports, and presenting research to a wide range of internal stakeholders.

• Collaborate with diverse internal stakeholders across business lines and functions to share E&S Risk data and insights, to inform risk management, business strategy, and ESG and climate disclosures.
<li>Identify opportunities to improve environmental & social risk data processes and take a leading role in implementing these changes

• Optimize data quality and results by seeking out public and private data sources and working with internal stakeholders to source RBC data to improve our climate risk measurement and management capabilities.
• Lead workstreams and collaborations across multiple teams to accomplish the above
• Contribute to the development and management of junior members of the E&S Risk Analytics teams
• An interest in Environmental and Social Risk in general and climate change in particular
• Experience in working in an analytics team, especially those tasked with solving difficult and/or vaguely-defined problems
• The ability to synthesize data into business insights and communicate these clearly to diverse audiences

• An advanced understanding of programming and querying languages, including SQL and python OR a proven ability to both code in another data analytics language (e.g. R, MATLAB, SAS) and the ability learn a new language quickly
• Experience developing presentations, visualizations and dashboards for senior executives and an interest in developing advanced analytical capabilities
• Demonstrated ability in mathematical, statistical, financial or economic analyses on large, complex datasets and in translating data into business insights
• A desire and proven ability to build new and innovative approaches to complex problems with minimal direction
• Commitment to quality and accuracy with a high level of attention to detail.
• Knowledge of climate change science with experience in the development and use of climate and economic scenarios, models, projections and data.
• Knowledge or familiarity with the climate risk and/or target setting guidance issued by PCAF, NZBA, TCFD, ISSB, and/or OSFI (B-15)
• Knowledge or familiarity with internal RBC wholesale lending data systems
<li>Experience with or knowledge of carbon-intensive sectors, e.g. agriculture
• Knowledge and experience in quantitative model development, testing and validation.
• Experience working with a diverse range of stakeholders.

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
