4458ac0c-1716-40fe-b1b8-14ca96827b4d,273696044,CN,"Intern, Solution Engineering",on_site,"Ontario, Canada",2023-09-25T12:30:02.475Z,"<div class=""p-panel p-p-b-xl""><div><div id="""" class=""p-htmlviewer"">

At CN, everydaybrings new and exciting challenges. You can expect an interesting environmentwhere you’re part of making sure ourbusiness is running optimally and safely―helping keep the economy on track. We welcome students who share theirideas, perspectives and understanding of newtechnologies withour teams. In return, we provide the opportunity towork on exciting projects with experienced collaborators who are happy to share their knowledge, all within a mutually-agreed to framework. Youwill be able to thrive in our close-knit, safety-focused culture workingtogether as ONE TEAM. The opportunities we offer are meaningful because thework we do matters. Join us!

Canadian National Railway Company (CN) is looking for a highly motivated person to fulfill a full-time (40h/week) Intern,Solution Engineering position in enter Montreal, QC for winter 2023 (January – April).

The Intern, Solutions Engineering is responsible for contributing to the delivery of customer solutions in collaboration with other members of the Customer and Intermodal Solutions and Innovation team who will act as coaches and mentors. The role’s path is determined based on interest and career aspiration in order for the position to be an opportunity to work in the chosen fields of interest and learn more about cutting edge cloud-based enterprise solutions and mission critical systems.
• Participate to solution architecture and design including defining and documenting the design of architecture of the solutions to be delivered
• Participate in Application Program Interface (API) and µServices and databases design to meet business requirements
• Participate in front-end layers design for both web and mobile
• Contribute to code base for backend and frontend
• Contribute to a code base for data transformation and enrichment
• Engage in the peer review process and pair programming
• Automate testing and deployment with Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD) pipelines
• Write and execute test scripts in accordance to requirements specification
• Knowledge or interest in full stack polyglot development (e.g., Java, Python, Javascript, Typescript, NodeJS, Angular, NativeScript, and ReactNative)
• Knowledge or interest in databases or related programs (e.g., Structured Query Language (SQL), NoSQL, Document, GraphQL, Search - PostgreSQL, and MongoDB)
• Knowledge or interest in modeling complex systems and data including Unified Modeling Language (UML)
• Knowledge or interest in DevOps (e.g., Azure DevOps, GitHub, GitLab)
• Knowledge or interest in Test automation, Test-driven development (TDD), Behavior-driven development (BDD), Acceptance test–driven development (ATDD)
• Knowledge or interest in µService/API architecture (e.g., SpringBoot/Spring Cloud/API Gateway/ApiGee, Anthos)
• Knowledge or interest in Distributed Systems and Enterprise Messaging Architecture (e.g. Kafka, Message Queue)
• Knowledge or interest of cloud platform Azure and Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
• Knowledge or interest in functional testing, performance testing and test automation
• Working towards a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering
*Any experience/education/skills/knowledge for these above would be considered as an asset

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

column1: The Market Risk group provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, controlling and communicating on the nature and extent of all material market and trading credit risks and to ensure the implementation of and compliance with risk management policies and procedures. The incumbent will lead in developing and promoting a “Best in Class” risk oversight environment for the market risk associated with RBC’s Commodities Trading business and activities
<li>Oversee and enhance risk control processes for Local market risk: Develop key sensitivity metrics, implement metrics and establish risk reporting
column2: establish and implement appropriate limits to ensure that business is operating within approved policies and limits
column3: identify supplementary risk controls that may be required to manage the risks and exposure as necessary

column1: • Monitor trading activities and exposures to ensure they are within approved policies and limits, and that reports are timely and accurate.
• Provide insights and commentary on key risks and exposures versus market trends and potential events.
• Work on a particular project to improve the market risk framework.
• A Master’s degree in Finance, Economics or a Quantitative subject
• Knowledge of market risk concepts (sensitivity analysis, VaR, stress testing etc.)
• Knowledge of financial products: Forwards, Swaps, Options.
• Strong written and oral communication skills with the ability to condense complex details into narratives suitable for communication with senior risk and business management
• Sufficiency in Excel-VBA, and other programming languages like Python and/or SQL.
• Knowledge of commodity markets (Oil, Natural Gas, Precious and Base Metals, etc).

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
• Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
• Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
• Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
• Opportunities to do challenging work and make a difference
• Opportunity to learn variety of asset classes within RBC business units
• Opportunity to learn and lead comprehensive and amalgamated ’commodities businesses and strategies’ within Market Risk
• Potential to utilize transferable skills and grow within other related business areas

Please note: This posting is for a 4-months Winter 2024 Student placement with a start date of January 2024, and end date of April 2024. In order to be eligible for this 4-months Student position, you must either:
<li>Be returning back to school after the work term end-date of April 2024
• If you are not returning back to school (i.e. are graduating in April 2024), you must require the full 4-months work term as a mandatory component to in order to graduate successfully.
Please ensure that you meet these eligibility requirements before applying - candidates who apply but are found to be ineligible are not able to be considered.

We encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we accept applications on a rolling basis, but please note that the formal application deadline is October 6, 2023. Should you be selected to progress, someone from our team will reach out directly to provide instructions on next steps. Otherwise, feel free to check for progress updates by logging in to your RBC profile. If the status has not changed, it denotes the fact that your application is still under review.

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. The successful candidate for this role will be required to be located within Ontario for the duration of the work term. Details regarding the specific virtual, hybrid, and in-office arrangements for this Integrated Learning/ Co-op position are to be discussed with the Hiring Manager.

The Data Analyst will be part of the Toronto based Financial Systems & Workflows Team within the Investment Finance Division, reporting to the Manager, Financial Systems & Workflow. The DataAanalyst will support the development of the portfolio analytics capabilities and support BI solutions for the Investment Finance team and its stakeholders to make informed decisions. The Data Analyst will work with various datasets, employ various data analysis techniques, and communicate their findings to stakeholders. To succeed in this role, the ideal individual needs a strong attention to detail and be a team player with a proven ability to build relationships between the business groups. A keen desire to explore new technologies and implement innovative solutions will enhance the success of the role.
• Design and develop comprehensive dashboards and reporting leveraging Power BI or similar business intelligence tools
• Work across functional areas to understand and identify reporting objectives to develop relevant reporting capabilities
• Collect, cleanse, and process data sets from various sources, including databases, spreadsheets and external sources to ensure accuracy and consistency
• Identify, analyze, interpret and report on trends or patterns in data sets

• Review extracts, reports, printouts, and performance indicators to identify, troubleshoot and resolve problems, including data quality, data integrity issues, and follow the divisional data governance policies
• Explore data sets and draw meaningful conclusions and insights, including identifying critical metrics and KPIs
• Evaluate, analyze, and recommend potential solutions that enhance analytics and reporting
• Conduct gap analysis to identify and recommend process improvements that affect data quality
• Investigate, evaluate and/or propose solutions to identified problems
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including finance, accounting, and IT, to address data-related challenges
• 3+ years of experience in financial management and investment support environment with exposure to relevant applications and workflow activities
• University degree in Accounting, Finance, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related discipline
• Experience with data visualization tools like Power BI, or data visualization libraries
• Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages, such as Alteryx, SQL Python or others
• Strong communication skills (written and verbal) to effectively convey complex findings to non-technical stakeholders
• Experience in defining, implementing, and supporting innovative business solutions
• Familiarity with database systems and data storage technologies
• Experience with machine learning and predictive modeling is an asset
• Ability to maintain an innovative mindset focused on delivering business value in a fast-paced and dynamic environment

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $127.4 billion in net assets as at June 30, 2023. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with more than 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

As Head, Business Intelligence & Insights, you will play a crucial role in shaping our strategic direction by leveraging data to help senior leadership make informed decisions, manage risks, and drive innovation. You will lead a high-performing team and implement business intelligence initiatives that will help BMO Global Asset Management (GAM) deliver an optimal client experience, grow revenue, and drive efficiency. This role requires a leader who is strategic minded, has exceptional technical skills, and has a proven track record of success in building advanced analytics teams and capabilities.
• Develop and execute the vision and roadmap for Business Intelligence & Insights capabilities to support BMO GAM growth strategy
• Collaborate with senior leadership to identify opportunities for data-driven growth and efficiency improvements
• Lead and mentor a team of analysts, data scientists, and business intelligence professionals
• Foster a culture of continuous improvement, innovation, and learning

• Leverage advanced analytics capabilities (predictive, prescriptive, and machine learning) to uncover patterns, trends, and insights that may not be apparent through traditional descriptive or diagnostic analytics. Leverage these capabilities to help forecast market trends, customer demands, and emerging technologies
• Drive innovation and competitive advantage by uncovering insights from data to identify new market opportunities, innovative product ideas, or process improvements
• Research and apply continuous improvement in data visualization by identifying trends and patterns to transform raw data into actionable business insights
• Establish reporting dashboards using visualization techniques that help users quickly identify key trends and business metrics that are actionable and relevant to them
<li>Develop tools and training programs for “self-serve analytics”
column2: may include delivery of training to audiences

column1: • Document data flow, systems, and processes to improve the design, implementation, and management of business/group processes
• Evaluate and implement digital tools that enhance data insight capabilities
• Stay up to date with the latest BI and analytics technologies and tools

• Partner with Marketing, Digital, and Distribution teams to create personalized client experiences by leveraging data to understand individual preferences, behaviors, and needs. Uncover insights that will allow us to create personalized product recommendations, tailored marketing messages, and customized digital experiences
• Foster strong internal and external networks and work with and across multiple teams to achieve business objectives
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide tailored solutions
• Present insights and recommendations to senior leadership and other key stakeholders
• Proven experience building & leading a Data Science function
• Strong understanding of the Asset Management business would be an asset

• Typically, 9+ years of direct experience in this field or 15+ years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree (MMA, PhD, Master’s Engineering or Computer Science) or an equivalent combination of education and experience
• Technical leader viewed as a thought leader for innovation
• Expert level of proficiency in all aspects of advanced data & analytics tools and capabilities

column2: >At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

>As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

column3: >

>Requisition ID: 185783

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

column1: Join the fast based team environment at Scotiabank as a Manager, Digital Analytics. The incumbent is a tagging, data analytics and insight specialist supporting digital marketing and banking initiatives across multiple channels and platforms to help drive engagement, leads, sales and loyalty.

The successful candidate will create and tell comprehensive stories about how users behave using data. You’ll deliver analytics projects of moderate complexity, partnering with other analysts and cross-functional teams along the way. Through ongoing analysis, you will gain actionable insights that better address the business goals of our internal stakeholders.

Candidate Value Proposition
• The successful candidate will have the opportunity to collaborate with analytics, marketing and digital banking squads to help optimize the efficiency and effectiveness of digital marketing campaigns, digital banking experience, and product strategy.

• Develop Looker Studio dashboard in scrum setting to iteratively translate business requirement in visualization and insights
• Work with senior stakeholder to perform on-demand product/digital analytics request
• Prepare detailed documentation to outline data sources, analysis, and algorithms used and developed
• Present results to business line stakeholders and help implement real world data-driven changes
• Analyze and interpret clickstream data, providing insights to inform digital banking experience optimization and campaign strategies.
• Work with technical analytics resources to ensure tracking code is consistently applied and managed
• Be flexible and thrive in an evolving environment
• Adapt to change quickly and adjust work accordingly in a positive manner

• Proactively initiate, research, and perform data analysis and provide ad hoc reports to internal stakeholders on web usage, user engagement, and behavioral analytics on websites and email campaigns
• Identify patterns and trends in marketing results and online activity and report on findings
• Analyze digital marketing data and user behavior patterns to provide valuable insight and to optimize user engagement and improve the effectiveness of marketing campaigns
• Monitor site and campaign traffic and determine cross-promotion, cross-sell and lead-gen opportunities
• Assist in the development and documentation of best practices for improving operational efficiencies within the digital analytics team
• Familiarity with tag audit tools like ObservePoint and Tag Inspector
• Identify bugs and erroneous analytics tags and provide solutions to development team
• Work with Digital Channels to advise on our continually evolving digital strategy
• Ability to provide clear and concise technical direction, expertise, advice and tracking solutions to frontend developers, backend developers, and analytic teams to build tools for measurement of client platforms

Skills and Experience:
• 3+ years of proven working experience as a Digital Analyst, Digital Marketing Analyst, or similar role
• 3+ years of experience with data segmentation and reporting within Google Analytics and/or Adobe Analytics as well as experience with Google Tag Manager including setting up and configuring accounts for new websites and goals
• Working knowledge of GA4
• Proficient in building dashboards leveraging and blending data from multiple data sources, as well as extracting data from data environments such as BigQuery
• 2+ years of working experience with SQL and relational databases technologies/concepts for both
• Experience with Looker Studio and/or Power BI

Nice-To-Have Skills:
• Expertise in Google Analytics implementation using Google Tag Manager
• 2+ years of experience programming in Python or Spark
• 2+ years of experience with statistical analysis, machine learning and digital analytics (e.g., hypothesis driven analysis, and fraud/anomaly detection)
• Experience working with digital advertising platforms (Facebook Business Manager, Google Ads, DoubleClick Manager, AppNexus) and search engine optimization is an asset

Degrees or Certifications:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in in STEM, or relevant field

column3: >At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.
>If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
>Bell’s Field Services team is proud to be the face of the Bell brand, performing the best installation and repair services and maintaining Bell’s network for our residential and business customers.

column2:
>Position Description:
Bell Field Services Operational Support team is a dynamic team where our main goal is to ensure we are delivering customer support to Canadians. The team works in a highly complex space involving many system interactions with dozens of internal teams to manage those interactions. Day-to-day, you’ll collect data & develop opportunities that will drive the future direction of the operations team and help to streamline the complex business problems they face. You will use your analytical skills to improve the understanding of KPIs while working to improve their limitations. And your attention to detail will help you push projects and process changes forward even when there is incomplete data or resources. A successful candidate will gain exposure with many people across various levels at Bell.

Job Duties/Accountabilities:
• Code: create code to join various systems to translate raw data into meaningful stories
• Analyze: perform extensive analysis to identify & size trends in performance
• Create: think outside the box to deliver creative opportunities to the business
• Collaborate: work with experts in different teams to understand end-to-end processes
• Sell: build compelling business cases to convince our partners to invest in our proposals

>Essential Skills & Abilities:
• University or College degree in engineering, economy, computer sciences, physic, mathematics or relevant experience in equivalent domain
• 1-3 years experience in business intelligence related functions (analysis, coding, etc.)
• Proficient with MS Excel (pivot tables, functions, charting)
• Knowledge of SQL and relational databases
• Well-versed in applied statistics
• Excellent communication skills and ability to quickly build straight-to-the-point presentation and deliver them with passion

Preferred Qualifications/Competencies:
• Experience in Microsoft Office applications, Excel, Powerpoint, Visio
• Experience with SAS & Python
• Experience with data visualization software such as PowerBI
• Knowledge of process modelling & mining techniques

column1: ef0d1d5f-5a50-4f99-bf4f-d4d08d4fbe20,165148922,Google,"Student Researcher, MS, 2023",on_site,"Toronto, ON, Canada",2022-11-10T17:20:01.826Z,"<div style=""""> <div class=""gc-card gc-card--expanded gc-job-detail gc-job-detail--loaded"">
Student Researcher, MS, 2023
Apply
Participation in this program requires that you are located in Canada for the duration of the engagement.

This opportunity is intended for students who are pursuing a MS degree with an anticipated graduation date after December 2024, depending on their program and unique circumstances. If you are graduating before December 2024, we encourage you to apply to the Internship openings.

To start the application process, you will need an updated CV or resume and a current unofficial or official transcript in English (PDFs preferred). Please ensure your anticipated graduation dates (in MM/YY) and any proficiency in coding languages are listed on resume.


Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Waterloo, ON, Canada
• Currently enrolled in a Master\'s degree in Computer Science, Linguistics, Statistics, Biostatistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics, or Natural Sciences.

• Experience in one area of computer science (e.g., Natural Language Understanding, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Quantum Information Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, etc.).
• Currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to the program after completion of the internship.
• Currently attending a degree program in Canada.
• Experience as a researcher, including internships, full-time, or at a lab.
• Experience contributing to research communities or efforts, including publishing papers in conferences or journals.
• Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages (e.g., C/C++, Java, MATLAB, Go, Python, etc.).
• Ability to speak and write in English fluently.
About the job

The Student Researcher Program’s primary objective is to foster academic collaborations with students through research at Google. Join us for a paid Student Researcher position that offers the opportunity to work directly with Google research scientists and engineers on cutting-edge research projects.

The Student Researcher Program offers more opportunities for research students to work on critical research projects at Google in a less structured way. The program allows for opportunities beyond the limitations of our traditional internship program on aspects such as duration, time commitment, and working location (with options for on-site or remote). The topics student researchers work on tend to be open-ended and exploratory, and don\'t always have a clear deliverable like a traditional internship would.

Google Research is building the next generation of intelligent systems for all Google products. To achieve this, we’re working on projects that utilize the latest computer science techniques developed by skilled software engineers and research scientists. Google Research teams collaborate closely with other teams across Google, maintaining the flexibility and versatility required to adapt new projects and foci that meet the demands of the world\'s fast-paced business needs.

Responsibilities

  • Participate in research to develop solutions for real-world, large-scale problems.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

To learn more about COVID vaccination requirements for US Google workplaces, read our Vaccination Entry Policy.

At Google, we’re committed to building a workforce that is more representative of the users we serve and creating a culture where everyone feels like they belong. To learn more about our diversity, equity, inclusion commitments and how we’re building belonging, please visit our Belonging page for more information.

We welcome and encourage people who are expecting and/or parents-to-be to apply to this or any other role at Google.

Google is a global company and, in order to facilitate efficient collaboration and communication globally, English proficiency is a requirement for all roles.

77098104-2c23-4465-b3e5-7700f1b21641,165049253,Nexxt Intelligence,NLP Application Developer,full,"Toronto, ON, Canada",2022-11-10T14:26:06.232Z,"

NLP Application Engineer

We are looking for a NLP Application Engineer to join our growing team to help grow inca, a conversational AI platform for consumer research. Interactive, data-centric, NLP-powered web applications form a key component of our product offering, and you will be working across our stack (Tailwind, React.js, Node.js, Python, AWS) to integrate exciting innovations in AI into delightful web applications, built using best practices and with robust data pipelines. This opportunity will allow you to work in an established startup, and to learn from an experienced team of software developers, market researchers, data analysts, and machine learning researchers.
These are some (but not all) of the ways that you will contribute to our team and product:
• Building engaging user interfaces designed for market researchers to accelerate and improve their workflows by leveraging state-of-the-art advances in AI.
• Extending cloud-native data pipelines to achieve high-performance, highly-available, and robust processing of semi-structured data at scale..
• Improving developer operations and infrastructure including CI/CD, automated testing, system monitoring, security and data protection compliance, etc.
• Contributing to product ideation, user experience, NLP experimentation, and application architecture as a core technical member of our team.
We look at candidates holistically, and will not rule out any applicant based on a lack of one specific skill set. These are some of the assets that a great candidate would bring:
• 3+ years of professional full-stack experience in any stack
• Expertise in some combination of Python, Node.js, or Typescript
• Familiarity with Git, Docker and other development tools
• Proficiency in frontend development with intuitive sense of design (React.js preferred)
• Keen interest in integrating AI capabilities into web applications
• Real world experience building data-centric applications and/or pipelines

This position is permanent full-time, and flexibly hybrid (primarily remote, with headquarters in Toronto). If you are interested, please send your CV and a brief email, explaining your interest and describing one or more projects that you’ve worked on, to jobs@nexxt.in.

We particularly encourage applications from groups underrepresented in the technology industry. Check out https://nexxt.in/about to learn more about our team and company culture!

column3:
>Requisition ID: 167822

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

column1: The GBM Analytics team has been focused on building out a library of sophisticated models and the requisite infrastructure to enhance data-driven decision making across the bank, with a focus on businesses in Capital Markets and Group Treasury. Our team consists of highly accomplished business professionals who blend expertise in Mathematics, Computer science, Statistics, Capital markets and Treasury, to architect and deliver innovative technical solutions driving business value. Our work spans a broad technology stack involving the development of data pipelines, predictive models and data visualizations. We are seeking an enthusiastic professional with experience in applied Machine Learning, AI and requisite domain knowledge to continue to build out and lead our modeling efforts in some of projects within the GBM Analytics portfolio.

• Define, build and manage the entire lifecycle of a Machine Learning/Analytics project from Scoping to Deployment with a delivery oriented approach, collaborating with cross-functional teams.
• Design, build and implement models to solve business problems using advanced statistical & machine learning techniques.
• Distill and transform data-driven insights into a tangible Product.
• Lead and guide a change mandate across the team on innovative use of Alternative Data sources.
• Motivation to learn about new advancements in Machine Learning as well as new domains in Capital Markets.

• A technical undergraduate degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics or similar. Postgraduate degree specialized in Data Science/Machine Learning preferred.
• 1-2 years of hands-on experience as a Data Scientist.
• Proficiency in Python, SQL and Git workflow.
• Hands-on experience in working with and reconciling big data sets using technologies such as Hive/PySpark.
• Familiarity with advanced machine learning tools and libraries.
• Expertise in end-to-end advanced Machine Learning processes in various platforms including Cloud(GCP preferred).
• Familiarity with Time-Series modeling.
• Good understanding of Machine Learning model explainability and interpretation.
• Experience with visualization tools such as PowerBI, Plotly.
• Strong presentation skills and experience with building a compelling narrative based on complex data and analytics.

• Experience with building and maintaining data pipelines.
• Experience with UNIX tools and shell scripting.
• Preference will be given to candidates with experience in Capital Markets, Treasury or other relevant field.

column1: 5f6f4103-9b20-40be-a49e-323bfe16f43a,172476104,CIBC,"Senior Quantitative Analyst, Risk Model Performance & Analytics",on_site,"Ontario, Canada",2022-12-01T17:06:04.209Z,"<div class=""css-n35a3n"">

column3: >relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

column1: At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Quantitative Risk is part of CIBC’s Capital Market Risk Management (CMRM), which is led by the Executive Vice President and Chief Risk Officer. CMRM is accountable for the identification, management, and control of the risks taken by CIBC Capital Markets. Quantitative Risk is responsible for providing continuous enhancements, controls, and the monitoring of all models used for risk measurements of Capital Market products, including compliance with current and new regulatory regimes.

As the Senior Quantitative Analyst, Risk Model Performance & Analytics, you will be responsible for CIBC’s Initial Margin Model and monitoring of the adequacy of the model as well as the accurate risk capture of Initial Margin under ISDA SIMM v2.5. You will have frequent interaction with CIBC and client’s collateral teams through this process. You will be responsible for ongoing enhancement of the model as new versions are released.

Additionally, you will be responsible for creating and streamlining analysis and reporting processes through automation and creation of tools for more effective and proactive risk management. You will work closely with our colleagues within Risk and our Technology partners.
You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

• Problem Solving and Communication – Ensure effective identification of issues impacting Capital Market Risk Management models performance, timely communication and escalation of identified issues to relevant stakeholder groups and senior management, and adequate prioritization for resolving identified issues.

• Automation and Creative Solutioning – Using development best practices, you will be expected to identify opportunities to automate workflow and processes. Utilize your understanding of financial modelling to automate and further develop creative solutions. Create and enhance documentation pertaining to model governance and controls.

• Domain Knowledge – Demonstrate in-depth understanding of valuation & risk models. Demonstrate and continue to grow knowledge of trading and hedging strategies, Capital Markets products, and regulatory changes pertaining to market risk capital and Initial Margin requirements. Remain abreast of market environment, news and events, and be proactive in assessing their potential impact on model performance. Develop expertise in CMRM and Capital Markets systems, processes and underlying models.

• Relationship Building – Develop and maintain excellent relationships with various groups across Capital Markets Risk Management, Capital Markets, Technology and Finance as most of the issues identified through model performance monitoring require collaborative effort among multiple teams to resolve. Establish and maintain clear and concise lines of communication and foster a collaborative culture while keeping in mind that this role is part of Capital Markets Risk Management and is thus a 2nd line of defense with the accountability of providing effective challenge, monitoring, and oversight.
• You demonstrate knowledge of Financial Risk Management. You have strong knowledge of financial markets and products as well as the foundations of risk measurement and risk management.

• You’re a certified professional. You have a graduate degree in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Quantitative Finance, Computer Science, and/or related program. You have strong quantitative skills and experience.

• You\'re digitally savvy. You have solid technical skills ( e.g. Python, R, C++, etc.) and you seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools, systems and trends.
• You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
• You\'re passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships, and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners.
• You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results, both within our department and across the broader CMRM team.
• You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
• Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

• We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
• Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
• We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day
column2: a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

• You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.

9a55171f-ef0a-4dcf-b16a-aeef4c8df202,170608192,OMERS,Data & Analytics Strategy Analyst,on_site,"Ontario, Canada",2022-11-24T17:42:05.034Z,"
The Data & Analytics Strategy Analyst will be joining the dynamic Architecture, Infrastructure, Data & Analytics team. Reporting to the Associate Director of Strategy and Product, you will work closely with all facets of OMERS to support the delivery of new and existing data and analytics products and services to drive sustainable growth at OMERS.
As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

• Preparing compelling communications, PowerPoint presentations, emails, newsletters, website, BI dashboards and use other mediums to convey key messages to multiple levels of the organization including senior most leadership
• Operating as a thought leader in the creation of planning, strategy, objectives, key results, and KPI development for the Data & Advanced Analytics team
• Preparing business cases, KPI frameworks, roadmaps and pipeline summaries
• Preparing data visualizations in PowerBI following a visual storytelling approach to conveying strategic insights that enable rapid decision making
• Preparing product backlogs, supporting the product management approach to data, analytics and AI capability development, facilitating in Agile Scrums and facilitating design thinking sessions
• Conducting non-routine analyses, including data gathering, processing, analysis employing advanced statistical and ML methods, with ongoing deliverables to improve the quality of insights teams
To succeed in this role, you have:
• A Bachelor\'s degree with quantitative component (e.g., Business, Commerce, Science)
• 3+ years of experience in analytics development, analytics translation to the business and data visualization
• The ability to create executive level PowerPoint presentations
• The ability to be a collaborative team player with superior influencing skills, who builds relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward
• An outcome focused, critical thinking mindset with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business
• The ability to assess and evaluate impacts based on various scenarios to form fact-based recommendations using quantitative analysis
• Experience in preparing high quality communications across a variety of mediums
• Experience in market research and user research
• Strong Business Acumen and understanding of business operations
• Experience in defining user personas, user journeys and scoping a backlog

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $121 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2021. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and
column3: >guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

a344de4c-a82a-4f06-948f-a6b784c18f6b,176656517,NVIDIA,"Senior Manager, Autonomous Machine Business Group",on_site,"Ontario, Canada",2022-12-12T17:42:04.182Z,"<div class=""css-1r0myd7"">

For more than two decades, NVIDIA has pioneered visual computing, the art and science of computer graphics. With an unusual focus on this field, we offer niche platforms for the gaming, professional visualization, data center and automotive markets. Our work is at the center of the most consequential mega-trends in technology - virtual reality, artificial intelligence and self-driving - and there has never been a more exciting time to join our team. NVIDIA\'s World Wide Field Operation Group is looking for a Senior Manager in Tokyo, Japan for supporting Embedded markets.
• Enthusiastically grow Automotive, Factory Automation, Robotics, Smart-city (AI video surveillance) businesses with our embedded (Jetson) and data center products
• Matchmaking and bridge global end customers with embedded and enterprise system partners
• Develop outstanding strategic relationships with customers\' R&D and procurement teams in order to understand customers\' system architecture, existing solutions, development plans and competition
• Develop new opportunity pipelines and drive design wins
• Understanding and guide delivery of NVIDIA value proposition, key features, product messages, positioning
• Engage appropriate NVIDIA resources as part of a virtual sales team
• Provide market and partners feedback to product teams to drive strategic alignment
• Provide projects pipeline, forecast and accounts update periodically
• 10+ years Embedded Product and Sales experience and experience managing a team
• Excellent both English and Japanese / communication / presentation skills
• Data Center business experience is a plus
• Distributor and channel management experience is helpful
• Familiar with AI DL, Embedded Linux and Android environments is a plus
• Education: BS EE, Computer science is plus

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us. If you\'re creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

ebe45f23-1fb5-4635-a19b-f58fb801dde9,189730414,TD Bank Group,"Senior Business Insights Analyst, Fraud Strategy & Resiliency",on_site,"Toronto, ON",2023-01-24T17:24:03.520Z,"<div class=""jobdetail-desc"" id=""gtm-jobdetail-desc"">

Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com

TD Fraud Performance Management strives to protect TD Bank Customers, shareholders and employees from financial crimes and fraud. Aligned with TD strategy and risk appetite, TD Fraud Performance Management develops analytics capabilities, processes, and layers of defense to mitigate fraud. The team operates within Enterprise Protect requiring both strategic and tactical responses to ever-changing fraud patterns and provides a unique opportunity to apply critical thinking and analytical skills in a fast-paced environment.

The Senior Business Insights Analyst, Fraud Strategy & Resiliency will be part of a unique and new mandate for the Canadian Performance Management team. The team will lead a platform and process resiliency mandate across all current and future fraud platforms and processes at TD. A forward-looking role, this role will ensure appropriate oversight, early warning frameworks, incident playbooks, linkages to upstream and downstream systems are in place to run the bank fraud processes. The role will provide ample exposure working across various internal and external stakeholders in the bank and opportunity to make a big impact.
You will build on your deep analytics experience and process mindset to:
• Understand and improve the operational impacts of our fraud defense strategies
• Evaluate business processes, anticipate requirements, uncover areas for improvement, and develop and implement solutions.
• Participate in ongoing reviews of business processes and develop optimization strategies.
• Maintain confidence of the business via continuous engagement and achieving deliverables
• anticipate and explain potential fraud risks associated with strategic initiatives across TD
• help design policy, process, or strategic changes to enable the bank to safely deliver its strategic roadmap
• provide deep fraud and process expertise into solving larger, Fraud-driven strategic initiatives
• identify emerging fraud trends and support the teams’ developing defenses against emerging and in-market fraud trends

The successful candidate will work collaboratively with a diverse team of Fraud solution developers, data scientists, business insights analysts, operational agents and subject matter experts and applies fraud business expertise leveraging advanced tools and detection systems to manage risk appropriately. The incumbent will be accountable for loss and customer experience targets.
• Perform periodic and targeted monitoring like QA and QC reporting, testing and business KPIs.
• Evaluate current early warning reporting, identify gaps, and lead remedial action.
• Supports development of new monitoring reports, dashboards using interactive dashboards
• Assists senior members of the Fraud Resiliency group in current/target state process assessment
• Identify and escalate gaps in process or technology hindering efficiency and/or effectiveness of the Analytics or Operations teams
• Assists in review of new technologies and assesses reasonableness of business cases to understand potential investment opportunities
• Leverage subject matter expertise to independently investigate new, high-risk exposures under tight timelines
• Produce timely diagnostics to identify system, strategy, and operational issues
• Participate in defect analysis to identify and remediate coverage gaps
• Works with business partners to understand new intent, and to liaise with project team as fraud management representative
• Collaborates with business partners to develop solutions that minimize fraud risk while enabling business partners to achieve bank strategic priorities
• Occasionally provides IT release support to ensure projects reliably deliver on fraud requirements
• Undertakes and completes a variety of complex projects and initiatives requiring specialist knowledge and/or the integration of cross functional processes within own area of expertise.
• Support the continuous improvement agenda for our operational partners
• Maintain strong relationships with internal stakeholders such as Fraud Operations, Internal Audit, Internal Business Partners, Vendor Managers etc.
• Acts as a subject matter expert and represents the team or bank at project meetings or industry forums
• 3+ years of work experience in an analytical capacity
• Graduate or undergraduate degree or technical certificate (e.g., engineering, mathematics, statistics, computer science, or analytics)
• Ability to quickly and independently structure and deliver on new problems not previously tackled by the bank
• Creative, Critical, Conceptual thinker, ability to wade through data and arrive at conclusions
• Motivated to constantly strive to find innovative ways to enhance capabilities
• Ability to effectively manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
• Ability to “tell the story” to both technical and non-technical team members
• Ability to take initiative and work independently under tight timelines
• Ability to work collaboratively and build relationships
• Passion in analytics with a customer-first mindset
• Experience using analytical software tools such as Python, R, SQL, Tableau and Excel for data analysis, automation, and reporting
• Process engineering and/or Lean Six Sigma background preferred
• Experience in fraud management and fraud detection platforms is an asset

Inclusiveness
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

column1: 52341bea-8e99-4e16-825f-8a70015f8f1d,188135012,TELUS,"Senior Data Engineering Consultant, TELUS Business Solutions Marketing Analytics",on_site,"Ontario, Canada",2023-01-18T17:42:03.262Z,"<div>

Our Team – TELUS Business Solutions Marketing Analytics - has a mandate to build solutions for our stakeholders using data to drive business outcomes. We love to turn data into stories - stories about money falling through the cracks, success stories about our products and services, but most importantly stories about our customers and how we can enhance their experience.

Come join our team if you have a passion for data, analytics, and marketing, the courage to innovate, embrace change and embody spirited teamwork to support stakeholders across a wide variety of teams.
Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

As a Senior Data Engineering Consultant in the team, you will be working with Business Stakeholders and the Data Scientists to build data assets that will be leveraged by the data scientists for machine learning/AI models to protect the customer base, acquire new customers and to enable intelligent marketing campaigns. Your solutions will have a direct impact on marketing sales targets and P&L.
• Design and build scalable and resilient Data & Analytics solutions in Google Cloud Platform – architect technical solutions to obtain, process, store and provide insights based on processed data
• Build data assets for machine learning purposes on Google Cloud Platform
• Work on automation and optimization of internal processes
• Provide data analysis and standard reporting support
• Design, develop, and review data architecture, model, flow, and integration – be hands on and involved with every stage of the ETL pipeline

• Keep up to date with the evolving Cloud technology and Big Data technology, share the knowledge across the organization by enabling best practices, standards, governed processes and relevant technologies
• 5 years of experience in big data analytics and distributed systems
• Experience in writing code/ETL processes/Monitoring processes in a production ready environment
<li>Knowledge of Big Data with a focus on data engineering
• Experience implementing production level deployments at an enterprise scale on Google Cloud Platform
• Strong coding and development skills in programming languages (e.g. Python, PySpark etc.)
• A Strong understanding of data structures, databases, data lakes, and data ingestion and transformation routines
• Post graduate education in Data, Advanced Analytics, Computer Science Eng/Programming or any other relevant program
• Machine Learning and AI, including classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP, optimization, and deep learning experience or knowledge

ef93c6bb-0e92-41db-9cc1-1c72f13f5d15,189570730,CN,"Intern, Enterprise Architecture",on_site,"Ontario, Canada",2023-01-23T17:42:07.850Z,"<div class=""p-panel p-p-b-xl""><div><div id="""" class=""p-htmlviewer"">

At CN, everydaybrings new and exciting challenges. You can expect an interesting environmentwhere you’re part of making sure ourbusiness is running optimally and safely―helping keep the economy on track. We welcome students who share theirideas, perspectives and understanding of newtechnologies withour teams. In return, we provide the opportunity towork on exciting projects with experienced collaborators who are happy to share their knowledge, all within a mutually-agreed to framework. Youwill be able to thrive in our close-knit, safety-focused culture workingtogether as ONE TEAM. The opportunities we offer are meaningful because thework we do matters. Join us!
Canadian National Railway Company (CN) is looking for a highly motivated person to fulfill a full-time (40h/week) Intern, Enterprise Architecture position in Canada for summer 2023 (May – August).

The Intern, Enterprise Architecture is responsible for supporting emerging technologies and innovation practices. The incumbent researches the latest technology trends applicable to railroading and has the opportunity to communicate trends and innovations to the larger CN I&T community. The role is exposed to the fundamental workings of the railroad across many business disciplines as well as to Research and Development (R&D), architecture, and solution delivery best practices. The position is performed within a team of experienced thought leaders and passionate professionals that solve exciting enterprise challenges in a fun and collaborative atmosphere. The exceptional breadth of exposure to numerous opportunities from “classic” mainframe systems to the bleeding edge of distributed Artificial Intelligence (AI), from telecom to finance and everything in between provides a unique opportunity to understand the workings of a large supply chain enabler.
• Research technology trends in the railroad and adjacent industries then document how they would be applied
• Prepare technical radars and reports for specific innovation topics
• Assess potential suppliers on their product and service offering, including both start-ups and market leaders
• Support the delivery of proof of concept and prototyping initiatives, including business cases, data gathering, and delivery planning
• Develop and execute innovative communication strategies for digital tools such as Yammer and SharePoint
• Shadow meetings with research partners and suppliers
• Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience
• Deals with pressure and change by staying calm to quickly adapt to changes
• Knowledge of Scientific written communication and technology principles
• Knowledge of AI, Machine Learning, Internet of Things (IoT), Big Data, Computer Vision, advanced analytics, automation, and positioning technologies

• Knowledge of technologies and practices such as Optimizers, Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAVs), wearables, extended reality, Blockchain, autonomous vehicles, digital twins, edge computing, control towers, data governance, and railroad operations*
• Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
• Working towards a Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, or Business
*Any experience/education/skills/knowledge for these above would be considered as an asset

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

9ae1caf6-a4f1-46ff-a570-b09d2d3ab8e7,185923384,RBC,Senior Full Stack Engineer (very flexible on the years of experience),on_site,"Toronto, ON, Canada",2023-01-11T15:06:51.221Z,"

RBCers across Technology & Operations, Chief Data Office, and Personal and Commercial Banking will present their team’s mandates and priorities as well as any current and upcoming roles at the RBC Information Session(Hybrid). Networking and speed interviews will follow team presentations.

Please Note: Applicants without those years of experience are encouraged to apply. RBC is very flexible on the amount of experience they are looking for in this role and looking forward to meeting you in person if you are available.
Due to capacity and space limitations, RBC encourages Vector’s upcoming grads and alumni to attend the session in person and looks forward to meeting all others virtually.

Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

What if you could use your technology skills to work on products that make an impact when it comes to delivering unforgettable client experiences? Our team is building capabilities that enable the end-to-end transformation of our customers' journeys –building and leading with technologies that put data privacy and responsible AI practices at the forefront. We’re a team of resilient, collaborative people with a hunger for learning and delivering trusted data and AI-powered capabilities to support top-notch client experiences and we have our sights set on building the tech stack of the future with modern, flexible architecture by building once, and reusing across channels – how’s that for efficiency?

We’re building a team who is not afraid to challenge the status quo, embraces innovation, and is excited to bring a fresh perspective. We’re looking for a talented and passionate Lead Engineer to join our team in Toronto. People who join our team will be able to work on the most innovative solutions to enable self-service analytics capabilities delivered via both public and private cloud platforms using event and microservices-based architectures. Join our team today and magnify your impact influencing the future of banking on a global scale. RBC is committed to being the destination of choice for technologists, driven by our engineering culture of curiosity, bold ambition and outcomes

As the Lead Full Stack Engineer, you will play a key role in our immediate and long-term strategic technical delivery direction for a multi-disciplined team of technologists. Nurturing culture and facilitating learning and knowledge sharing will be second nature to you as well as applying your technical know-how to ensure that the team is on the leading edge of technical delivery practices. You’ll have the tools and support needed to achieve extraordinary results that render a significant impact extending beyond the boundaries of traditional technology roles. Ideas start here – and you will build great technology.

If you have a passion for delivering top-notch data and AI-driven services and applications and are passionate about data privacy, security and responsible AI related technologies - we have a spot for you on our team.
• Design & execution of hybrid and multi-cloud application deployments of AI/ML-driven applications and data services that enable our trusted data and AI mission
• Develop methodologies & frameworks for systematically validating the performance, security, and trustworthiness of deployed ML models
• Apply design thinking and an agile mindset in working with other engineers, data scientists and business stakeholders to continuously experiment, iterate and deliver on new initiatives
• Actively engage with stakeholders to gather requirements and ideate software solutions and support creation of scalable software
• Write clean, functional code for large-scale distributed applications
• Test software (unit, system, integration and acceptance testing) to ensure responsiveness and efficiency and where required troubleshoot, provide solutions to fix / debug and upgrade software
<li>Partner with and support other teams as required
column2: there are many teams, yet we are one team.

column1: • Leverage best practices in continuous integration and delivery, with a strong commitment to quality
• Explore new capabilities and technologies to drive innovation

<li>Experience (6+ years) working software delivery teams in mid to large software/IT organizations developing scalable, highly available and performant applications and microservices, participating in design sessions and code reviews with skills in the following areas:<ul>
• Data Engineering & API Development: expertise in at least one major programming language (Java, Python, Scala etc.) and messaging technology (e.g., Kafka etc.)
• Cloud and Containers: AWS, OpenShift, Docker, Pivotal Cloud Foundry
• SQL/Data Stores: PostgreSQL, S3, HDFS, Elasticsearch, Redis etc.
• A passion for simplifying and automating work, making things better, continuous learning, solving open-ended problems, improving efficiency and helping others
• Strong communication skills with ability to work cross-functionally to articulate, measure and solve issues
• Great attention to detail, organizational skills and an analytical mind
• Experience with Airflow, graph databases, Jupyter Notebooks, other ML-related technologies

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
• Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
• A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
• Opportunity to work on cool stuff and make a difference
• Work in a fun, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
• Access to world-class learning resources and relevant programs

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.
