You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

At Sun Life, we work together, share common values and encourage growth and achievement. We offer many career paths that attract a wide variety of talent and skills. Follow a path that lets your talents shine.

Join a team that is growing the Data and Analytics capabilities of Group Retirement Services (GRS) at Sun Life Canada. As a member of the GRS Strategy, Data & Analytics team, you will play a pivotal role in building out data products and maintaining data capabilities to enrich our client experience and arm internal stakeholders with data & analytic solutions to help drive informed decisions.

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be responsible for leveraging our Big Data (EDL) capabilities to assemble various streams of data and turning it into organized data products that fuel into analytical tools. Working with a diverse team of data and analytics professionals, Senior Data Engineer will lead the entire lifecycle of data in GRS business – from ETL to mining insights from the data, to making data accessible and useful for data analysts in the team to build analytics services and self-serve solutions for our stakeholders.

Given this mandate, this role requires an experienced data engineer (5+ years) with deep experience in building data ETL process, governing data products, and a solid understanding of data needs of data analysts. The candidate must have relevant experience in the following areas:
• Data Discovery – i.e. scoping new data sources, understanding and leveraging current data sources
• Data Governance - i.e. manage data catalogue, interpret metadata
• Communication and liaison experience between business, data analysts and IT
• Design and engineer highly scalable business data models that provides accurate and reliable data to support analytics, reporting, dashboards, and marketing campaigns.
• Ensure automated processes and internal data repository preserves data integrity and high data quality by managing the alignment of source data platform
• Lead the research and evaluation of new data sources, both internal and external, and implement processes and logic to integrate into GRS data model
• Support data analysts with data discovery and rapid assembly of large datasets for analytics & reporting consumption
• Analyze data to support model development and to identify potential areas for improvement
• Manage and execute on business data requests ensuring requests are aligned to business priorities and the request fulfillment meets the business needs
• Oversee governance framework and strengthen data security by setting up user control and documenting data models, architectures and algorithms
• Ensure that data requests fall within the scope of the Master GRS Privacy Impact Assessment and any potential Model End User Compliance guidelines are adhered to
• 5+ years of hands-on experience working with data
column2: in-depth knowledge in engineering data products for analytical model (i.e. Python, SQL, SAS, etc.)

About the role

Commercial Analytics improves the decision making process in the Commercial, Revenue, and Support organizations with data. We do this by enhancing the effectiveness of data measurements, providing objective analytical insights, building scalable data solutions, and maturing the data literacy in our organization. Our craft requires both good technical skills and strong business acumen. It is both an applied science and arts discipline. Currently we’re in search of a Data Science Manager. In this role you’ll be responsible for…
• Unlocking the value from data to create better human experience in Commerce
• Provide BI, data insights and decision support to empower the core business operation in the Commercial group including Revenue, Merchant Success, and Support
• Provide the Core analytics capability with a bias towards building innovation solutions that can scale across different user groups in our 5000+ business unit
• Lead a multidisciplinary team of analysts and data scientists to enable the business with strategic data insights to operate more effectively and efficiently.
This work will impact the top line (growth/sales) of the company since the work helps identify areas of opportunity for our Sales org.

column4: >As a Senior data engineer in Data Management, AML/ATF Models and Analytics team, you will contribute to build better way to approach all banking systems data for AML/ATF by using your advanced engineering , analytical and communication skills to work with different business partners across whole Scotiabank. column1: NVIDIA’s Worldwide Field Operations (WWFO) team is looking for a Data Science focused Solution Architect with expertise in Machine Learning (ML), Deep Learning (DL) and Data Science platforms. Exposure to inferencing technology (e.g., understanding of model compression techniques, model compilation or model serving) would be an added value. In our Solutions Architecture team, we work with the most exciting computing hardware and software, driving the latest breakthroughs in artificial intelligence. We need individuals who can enable customer productivity and develop lasting relationships with our technology partners, making NVIDIA an integral part of end-user solutions. We are looking for someone always thinking about artificial intelligence, someone who can maintain synergy in a fast paced, rapidly evolving field, someone able to coordinate efforts between corporate marketing, industry business development and engineering.

You will be working with the latest HPC architectures coupled with the most advanced neural network models, changing the way people interact with technology. As a Solutions Architect, you will be the first line of technical expertise between NVIDIA and our customers. Your duties will vary from working on proof-of-concept demonstrations, to driving relationships with key executives and managers to evangelize accelerated computing. Dynamically engaging with developers, scientific researchers, data scientists, IT managers and senior leaders is a meaningful part of the Solutions Architect role and will give you experience with a range of partners and concerns.
• Develop and demonstrate solutions based on NVIDIA’s state-of-the-art AI and ML software and hardware technologies to customers.
• Work directly with key customers to understand their technology and provide the best solutions.
• Perform in-depth analysis and optimization to ensure the best performance on GPU architecture systems. This includes support in optimization of both training and inference pipelines.

• Partner with Engineering, Product and Sales teams to develop, plan best suitable solutions for customers. Enable development and growth of product features through customer feedback and proof-of-concept evaluations.
• Build industry expertise and become a contributor in integrating NVIDIA technology into Enterprise Computing architectures.
• Excellent verbal, written communication, and technical presentation skills in English.
• MS/PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Electrical/Computer, or equivalent experience Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, other Engineering fields
• 5+ years of academic and/or industry experience in fields related to machine learning, deep learning and/or data science.
• You are excited to work with multiple levels and teams across organizations (Engineering, Product, Sales and Marketing team)
• You are a self-starter with attitude for growth, passion for continuous learning and sharing findings across the team.
Ways to Stand Out from The Crowd:
• Experience running large scale distributed DL training.
• Background with working with larger transformer-based architectures.
• Experience using DevOps technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, Singularity, etc.
• Understanding of HPC systems: data centre design, high speed interconnect InfiniBand, cluster storage and scheduling related design and/or management experience.

",,https://nvidia.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/NVIDIAExternalCareerSite/job/France-Courbevoie/Senior-AI-Solutions-Architect_JR1965794,feed-importer@jobboard.io,,,,2023-05-25T16:20:03.878Z,False,0,1,9,https://talenthub.vectorinstitute.ai/jobs/228138970-senior-ai-solutions-architect-at-nvidia,,expired,2023-05-22T16:15:00.000Z,import-xml-feed:Selenium-Scraper,Enterprise (500+),Application Click Through,Technology (Product Development),Senior Level,Masters Degree,New Posting,

column14: >At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

column4: >We help the world’s largest financial institutions navigate the intricate regulatory environment to effectively manage and assess capital in support of their ongoing strategies. More than ever, financial institutions are investing in enhancing their capital management capabilities to make better business decisions, presenting us with the unique opportunity to rally together to solve our clients’ most complex challenges.

>EY’s Financial Services Risk Management (FSRM) practice is a consulting unit that provides risk management support to banks, insurers and asset managers. Our team includes individuals who have industry, client and product knowledge as well as quantitative, regulatory, project management and technology professionals.

>We are seeking a Senior Manager with minimum 10-years experience in Data Risk, Data Quality, and Data Governance Management acquired in the banking industry or in consulting services to join our team.

>As a Data Risk, Quality and Governance Management Senior Manager you will provide subject matter expertise on the design, development and implementation of data risk programs to help our clients proactively identify and manage risks related to their data. You will also provide subject matter expertise to help our clients improve the quality of their Finance and Risk Data through strong governance practices aligned to regulatory expectations.

>You will develop materials, tools and methodologies to support client delivery, thought leadership and go-to-market activities (including conferences, client proposals, targeted campaigns). You will actively participate in business development activities to identify, generate and close new business opportunities.

>You will be responsible for leading multiple client engagement teams, overseeing and managing the delivery team, and delivering high-quality services and deliverables to our clients based on industry leading practices, EY frameworks, and regulatory expectations for Data Risk, Quality and Governance Management.

>This role provides the unique opportunity to build a professional network, tackle complex data issues, and provide thought leadership to shape the understanding and management of data risk, quality and governance management across industry leading clients and domains.
>Helping clients establish data governance and risk programs to drive data ownership and stewardship into the client businesses
column7: >Performing data governance reviews, designing target operating models, designing/implementing/assessing IT and data controls, performing data risk and data literacy assessments
column10: >Conducting current state assessments, evaluating assessment results, and presenting findings in a logical and easy-to-understand manner (for both Data Risk and Data Governance Management)
column13: >Conducting data quality and completeness certifications for finance and risk datasets and providing actionable recommendations (e.g., historical data certification of credit risk data)

column4: >If you’re a natural leader with a talent for answering and communicating complex client problems, we’re interested in you. You’ll need to be great at influencing people, ready to listen and confident in challenging the status quo. If you have a genuine passion for helping businesses and addressing their most pressing problems, this role is for you.

>At EY, our Total Rewards package supports our commitment to creating a leading people culture - built on high-performance teaming - where everyone can achieve their potential and contribute to building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. It's one of the many reasons we repeatedly win awards for being a great place to work.

>We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you to decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:
>Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry

column4: >Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. From our actions to combat systemic racism and our advocacy for the LGBT+ community to our innovative Neurodiversity Centre of Excellence and Accessibility initiatives, we welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.

column2: >At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

column1: The Expert Solution Design is responsible for building, managing, and optimizing data pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers, shaping the enterprise Data as a Service (DaaS) model and delivering on IT business models. The Expert Solution Design develops best practices and optimizes data pipelines to deliver products and services aligned with business expectations. The incumbent plays a pivotal role in operationalizing data and analytics initiatives, defining and building CN’s data integration and DaaS platform roadmap.

column3: > Ensure optimal data delivery architecture and processes are consistent throughout ongoing projects
> Optimize CN’s data architecture to support the next generation of products and data initiatives
> Build, manage, and optimize data pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers such as business or data analysts and data scientists
> Build data and domain event models, implement business rules, and engineer scalable data pipelines
> Ensure compliance with data governance and security requirements while creating, improving and operationalizing integrated and reusable data pipelines
> Enable faster data access, integrate data reuse, and improve time-to-solution for data and analytics initiatives
> Integrate analytics and data science results with business processes
> Collaborate with stakeholders and architects to model data landscape and define secure data exchange approaches
> Meet with stakeholders to identify fit-for-purpose within CN’s existing data ecosystem and deliver options and agile solutions
> Design and develop processing pipelines that ingest data into Data Hubs
> Expose the data into meaningful formats, like GraphQL
> Provide day-to-day support and technical expertise to both technical and non-technical teams
> Participate in building data engineering expertise and framework
> Acquire, ingest and process data from multiple sources and systems
> Design and develop Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) pipelines using multiple sources of data in various formats
> Conduct metadata management, data cleansing and preparation
> Use Agile methodologies to streamline project delivery aligned with goals, timelines, and budget
> Build monitoring and debugging tools to analyze data pipelines
> Help unify software development and operations seamlessly, efficiently, and cost effectively
> Improve software quality, automate processes, and accelerate software releases
> Use Agile development practices for code reviews and testing to develop and deliver data pipelines
> Develop and implement test plans and scripts for various data quality processes

column1: The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday and offers remote work.

column3: > Minimum 5 years of experience in a data engineering role, working in different data management disciplines including data integration, modelling, optimization and quality
> Experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with business stakeholders in support of a departmental or multi-departmental data management and analytics initiative
> Experience with at least 2 of the following technologies: Python, Scala, SQL, Java
> Experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Spark, etc.
> Experience with Cloud and non-Cloud based Hadoop ecosystem
> Experience with Cloud platforms such as Azure, Google Platform or Databricks
> Experience with traditional data warehousing and ETL tools (Informatica, Talend, Pentaho, DataStage)
> Experience deploying applications into production environments such as code packaging, integration testing, monitoring and release management

> Experience with multiple database technologies such as Distributed Processing (Spark, Hadoop, EMR), traditional RDBMS (MS SQL Server, Oracle, DB2, MySQL, PostgreSQL), NoSQL (MongoDB, DynamoDB, Cassandra)
> Experience working in an Agile team environment
> Bachelor\'s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Software Engineering
> Master’s Degree or PhD in Data Management, Data Analytics, Information Systems, or a related quantitative field*

column1: *Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset

column3: > Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing
> Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work
> Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity
> Ability to work across structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data, extracting information and identifying linkages across disparate data sets
> Demonstrates commitment to high standards of ethics, regulatory compliance, customer service, and business integrity
> Expertise in a combination of Scala, Java or Python
> Expertise with Big Data architecture and distributed computing processes and platforms such as Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Kafka, etc.
> Expertise with one or more SQL-on-Hadoop technology (Hive, Impala, Spark SQL, Presto)
> Knowledge of software engineering best practices such as code reviews, testing frameworks, maintainability and readability

column2: >CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

column1: ad7dff0f-cfb0-46ff-9da6-171aaafa79ae,198034030,TD Bank Group,Software Engineer  ML Engine (Layer 6),on_site,"Toronto, ON",2023-02-20T17:24:05.053Z,"<div class=""jobdetail-desc"" id=""gtm-jobdetail-desc"">

Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com

Layer 6 is a leading Canadian machine learning applied research company, a fully owned subsidiary of TD Bank Group. Layer 6 develops advanced machine learning and deep learning systems that have the power to uplift large populations while advancing the field of artificial intelligence. Our research is supported by access to massive datasets, close collaboration with world renowned academic faculty, and a uniquely scalable machine learning platform.

Our technical capabilities have been publicly recognized through a number of wins in various international machine learning competitions, including the prestigious ACM RecSys Challenge (the only repeat winner in 2017 and 2018 and runner-up in 2019), Google’s Landmark Retrieval Challenge (2nd place in 2018, 3rd place in 2019), the Stanford Question Answering Dataset (2nd place in 2019), 3rd YouTube-8M Video Understanding Challenge (winner in 2019) and Open Images 2019 – Visual Relationship (winner in 2019).

The goal of the ML Engine team is to enable training and deploying robust and high-performing models by providing a solid foundation and allowing for fast iteration. We are looking for world-class engineers to take on the challenging problem of shipping core machine learning engine from 0 to 1. This Engine which will be used across the Bank. You will work with ML Product Engineers, Ops teams, and Research Scientist to ensure our framework can support use cases deployed on our computing infrastructure.
• Own and ship product features that enable ML engine capabilities
• Work with product owners and tech leads to design, ship, and refine significant components of the product.
• Work with research scientists and MLOps team to maintain service product.
• Experience with building and scaling data-intensive software.
• You value good software design and sweat over details in code and API design.
• You enjoy learning new technology and also educating others.
• You take great personal pride in building robust and scalable software.
• You strive to communicate clearly and with empathy.
• You are highly accountable and have a strong sense of ownership.
• Ability to do detailed code reviews and give thoughtful feedback.

Experience building a library or a framework.
Experience with Big Data technologies and frameworks including but not limited to Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark, Cassandra, Kafka, Elasticsearch
Comfortable with statistics.
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms.
Knowledge of distributed systems.

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
Student Researcher, BS, 2023
Apply
Participation in this program requires that you are located in Canada for the duration of the engagement.

This opportunity is intended for students who are pursuing a BS degree with an anticipated graduation date after December 2024, depending on their program and unique circumstances. If you are graduating before December 2024, we encourage you to apply to the Internship openings.

To start the application process, you will need an updated CV or resume and a current unofficial or official transcript in English (PDFs preferred). Please ensure your anticipated graduation dates (in MM/YY) and any proficiency in coding languages are listed on resume.


Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Waterloo, ON, Canada
• Currently enrolled in a Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, Linguistics, Statistics, Biostatistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics, or Natural Sciences.

• Experience in one area of computer science (e.g., Natural Language Understanding, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Quantum Information Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, etc.).
• Currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to the program after completion of the internship.
• Currently attending a degree program in Canada.
• Experience as a researcher, including internships, full-time, or at a lab.
• Experience contributing to research communities or efforts, including publishing papers in conferences or journals.
• Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages (e.g., C/C++, Java, MATLAB, Go, Python, etc.).
• Ability to speak and write in English fluently.
About the job

The Student Researcher Program’s primary objective is to foster academic collaborations with students through research at Google. Join us for a paid Student Researcher position that offers the opportunity to work directly with Google research scientists and engineers on cutting-edge research projects.

The Student Researcher Program offers more opportunities for research students to work on critical research projects at Google in a less structured way. The program allows for opportunities beyond the limitations of our traditional internship program on aspects such as duration, time commitment, and working location (with options for on-site or remote). The topics student researchers work on tend to be open-ended and exploratory, and don\'t always have a clear deliverable like a traditional internship would.

Google Research is building the next generation of intelligent systems for all Google products. To achieve this, we’re working on projects that utilize the latest computer science techniques developed by skilled software engineers and research scientists. Google Research teams collaborate closely with other teams across Google, maintaining the flexibility and versatility required to adapt new projects and foci that meet the demands of the world\'s fast-paced business needs.

Responsibilities

  • Participate in research to develop solutions for real-world, large-scale problems.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

To learn more about COVID vaccination requirements for US Google workplaces, read our Vaccination Entry Policy.

At Google, we’re committed to building a workforce that is more representative of the users we serve and creating a culture where everyone feels like they belong. To learn more about our diversity, equity, inclusion commitments and how we’re building belonging, please visit our Belonging page for more information.

We welcome and encourage people who are expecting and/or parents-to-be to apply to this or any other role at Google.

Google is a global company and, in order to facilitate efficient collaboration and communication globally, English proficiency is a requirement for all roles.

column14: >At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

column4: >We currently have career opportunities for Senior Consultants and Managers in our Canadian Capital Markets (CM) consulting team. Our team works to build a better world by transforming businesses through the potential of our people, technology, and innovation. Emerging technologies are transforming all lines of business and requires our customers to embrace these new technological capabilities and see them as new competitive advantages.

>We work collaboratively with some of the top executives in financial institutions of all sizes and scales, helping them create and realize the best solutions for the future of their business. Each project is different, so you’ll need to be able to excel in ambiguous situations and confidently navigate ever-changing circumstances. We’ll look to you to be a self-starter, have the ability to translate complex information into simple terms, manage teams, and deliver long-term solutions with confidence. On this team, you’ll have the unique opportunity to imagine the future as well as create it, where you can craft ideas and implement them for our clients.

>As a part of the CM practice, you will advise clients and assist in solving Business and Technology problems in Capital Markets industry. You will provide clients with functional analysis, design, implementation, and technical program management support services.

>You will support or lead the delivery of customer engagements, build customer relationships and lead team development. This will include generating new business opportunities by developing ideas and solutions to present to internal and external clients.

>This will include assisting with performing analysis of business requirements, translating requirements into functional specifications, design of technical solutions and requirements for implementation by development teams. Assisting with feature design, business process decomposition, supporting technical system integration, configuration of systems, modernization, optimization, decommissioning and analysis of underlying front to back data requirements

>You will also be able to support client technology organizations with front to back SDLC, provide hands-on support across one or multiple phases of the process and have experience with Technical Project Management and Agile ways of working.

>Individually and as a member of EY team, you will converse with the with Capital Markets buy side and sell side technology, operations and business clients on traded products and the end-to-end trade lifecycle levels of AVP to Senior VP/Director. You will have the ability to understand business problems and advise on proposed technology solutions. Summarize and document technical discussions, translate technical decisions into business English language and communicate with client’s business stakeholders. Liaise between business and technology teams.
>You will have the ability to effectively integrate with and leverage offshore development teams to scale and accelerate software delivery to meeting deadlines and close work

>Agile, growth-oriented mindsets. What you know matters. But the right mindset is just as important in determining success. We’re looking for people who are innovative, can work in an agile way and keep pace with a rapidly changing world. Experience in business development or delivering against financial targets in a service-oriented context is a plus
column7: >High-performance tech leaders. A strong track record of management of large teams delivering strategic technology-enabled transformations and major digital implementations. Demonstrated team leadership experience in complex contexts, in addition to project management, advanced analytical and problem-solving skills
column10: >Great communicators. Communication is key — we strive to bring our best interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills, whether we’re writing an e-mail, building a proposal, drafting an architecture diagram, or cutting code.

Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

Are you obsessed with data and identifying ways to harness and scale data intelligence across an entire organization? Do you love collaborating with fellow data professionals to develop innovative data solutions that lead to positive business outcomes? If your answer is yes, we would be delighted to have you onboard TELUS’ Data Strategy & Enablement team to provide vision and strategic guidance, while driving flawless execution on the development and evolution of large-scale machine learning environments.

You’ll be part of a multidisciplinary team of data wizards who are capitalizing on analytics and insights to deliver exceptional products and services for our customers. In turn, we hope you’ll enjoy being a valued member of Canada’s #1 global workplace with a world-leading culture featuring extensive community-giving initiatives, flexible work environment including remote work, award-winning opportunities for career development, and a competitive compensation and benefits package.
As a technology company, data is central to our mission to create better outcomes for our customers, especially as we strive to deliver next generation networks like 5G
column2: unlock the full potential of the Internet of Everything to power smart homes, businesses, industry, healthcare and cities
column3: and deliver an incredible customer experience. Our Data Strategy & Enablement team is at the helm of building world-class data solutions by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced Augmented Intelligence (AI) tooling, high quality data, and a data product and platform-oriented culture. At the same time, this team remains passionate champions of reliability, security and privacy by design, and is committed to creating the utmost level of privacy and security protections for all data on our networks and systems.

column1: You’ll provide vision and strategic guidance to evolve from common static analysis to dynamic machine learning deployments, as well as expand our teams’ access to deep insights that improve the customer experience. You’ll work with a talented team of Data Scientists and other professionals to manage TELUS’ data platforms and offer the best possible analytics experience to internal stakeholders using the data. And finally, as a trusted advisor and partner, you’ll collaborate across various business units to accelerate the transformation of our platforms, improve the customer and team member experience, and drive business efficiencies.
• Build and maintain scalable data infrastructure that offers a best-in-class experience for internal stakeholders including consistent extraction of value from the data
• Drive data ingestion and processing in innovative ways that inform strategic priorities and decision-making across the organization
• Foster continuous systems transformation as we migrate infrastructure and applications to Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
• Build expertise in the team to expose efficiency insights across data platforms in the cloud
• Manage our cloud data analytics platform priorities to make sure data security and privacy are top considerations
• Implement automation and monitoring tools through a test-driven approach and mindset
• Drive the adoption of new cloud technologies to further advance TELUS’ data transformation strategy
• You are recognized for your 8+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical capacity
• You are sought out for your 5+ years’ experience of data warehouses/cloud architectures and platforms implementation with experience implementing and performance tuning
• An expert understanding of data warehouses/cloud architectures and ETL processes
• Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases and query authoring (SQL), as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases
• Experience with cloud platforms: GCP, Amazon or Azure (GCP gives you an edge!)
• Experience with Python and software engineering best practices
• Advanced knowledge in Dataflow, Spark and Kafka, as well as other data pipeline components
• Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools such as Airflow
• Having a proven track record in leading data analytics platform projects
• Ready to work in new and challenging work environments
• Getting excited by the opportunity to build a team\'s capabilities to create value and innovate through data, and doing so in an agile manner with a bias for action and speed
• Envisioning and delivering future technical roadmaps while inspiring others along the way
• Being a senior strategist and mentor who is sought out when it comes to analyzing and translating technicalities into business implications
• Working in cross-functional teams with exemplary communication and coordination skills
• Proving your analytical skills with root cause analysis of issues
• Demonstrating resilience, a questioning mindset, and strong observation skills and curiosity – you never settle for the status quo!
• Caring passionately about your stakeholders and providing them with the data and insights they need to deliver on their customer and business outcomes
• Post graduate education in Data Engineering, Cloud DevOps or Advanced Analytics
9037bf3c-ef41-412b-ba0f-9559750c192c,204324011,CN,Specialist Data Design,on_site,"Ontario, Canada",2023-03-13T17:42:03.002Z,"<div class=""p-panel p-p-b-xl""><div><div id="""" class=""p-htmlviewer"">

At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

column2:
>The Specialist, Data Design is responsible for understanding business requirements, creating data definitions, data quality requirements, define data transformation rules, as well as logical and physical data models. The incumbent brings technical expertise to ensure the quality and accuracy of data, then process, designs and presents it in ways to help people, businesses, and organizations make better decisions.

Main Responsibilities

column1:
Data Design and Management

· Build conceptual, logical, and physical data models

· Build source to target mapping documents to describe data transformations

· Design and develop curated data assets in Data Lake and Data Warehouse to support reporting, data science and data engineering

· Define, document, and maintain standards and best practices around data modelling

Testing, Troubleshooting and Delivery

· Assess and design data architecture components (e.g., data model, mapping, data flows, and transformations) to make sure they are well integrated and aligned with the data and technical architecture

· Troubleshoot data issues within the business and present solutions and recommendations

· Define unit testing to ensure Data Engineers follow specifications

· Participate in the delivery and support of data quality and consolidation initiatives

· Propose simplification initiatives to allow for more effective data design, and management

Requirements

Experience

Data Design and Modelling

· Between 3 to 5 years overall work experience

· Minimum 3 years of experience in analysis, data design and data modelling

· Experience performing root cause analysis to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement

· Experience with big data processing

· Experience in real time data streaming and loading

· Experience modelling data for data science projects*

· Experience working with Scale Agile Methodology (SAFe)*

· Experience with semi-structured and unstructured data*

*Any experience for these above would be considered as an asset

Education/Certification/Designation

· Bachelor’s Degree specializing in Computer Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics and Statistics, or other quantitative field, related degree, or equivalent experience

Competencies

· Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing

· Applies analytical thinking

· Innovates through problem solving

· Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work

· Demonstrates organizational abilities

· Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity

· Works independently with little supervision

Technical Skills/Knowledge

· Advanced knowledge of dimensional modelling techniques, data modelling and data architecture best practices

· Advanced SQL skills

· Knowledge of Azure Data Lake (ADLS), Data Warehouse, Data Factory, Development Operations (DevOps) Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD), Databricks, and Business Intelligence or relevant data environment

About CN

column2:
> CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

For internal candidates, note that the grade level of the position will depend on the employee\'s experience.

column1: CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

8479d20e-c7e6-48a6-898c-9bd40306cfa9,206568607,RBC,"Senior Analyst, Environmental & Social Risk Analytics",on_site,"Toronto, ON, Canada",2023-03-20T17:16:02.666Z,"<div class=""jd-info au-target"">

Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

As part of the Environmental & Social Risk team within Group Risk Management, you will play a role in the management, monitoring, and mitigation of environmental and social (E&S) risks at RBC. You will support the design and implementation of key climate and E&S risk initiatives by providing research and data analytics and insights. A significant focus of this role will be the calculation of RBC’s financed emissions across different asset classes within carbon-intensive sectors and setting and tracking progress on net-zero targets.
The role will report to the Director, E&S Risk Analytics

• Gather and analyze data required for climate and social risk measurement and work with the Director, E&S Risk Analytics to use this data to inform actionable steps in the management and monitoring of environmental & social risk.
<li><span>Identify opportunities to improve environmental & social risk data processes and take a leading role in implementing these changes

• Optimize data quality and results by seeking out public and private data sources and working with internal stakeholders to source RBC data to improve our climate risk measurement and management capabilities.

• Collaborate with diverse internal stakeholders across business lines and functions to share E&S Risk data and insights, to inform risk management, business strategy, and ESG and climate disclosures.

• Work with the Director, E&S Risk Analytics to assist in the advancement of RBC’s capabilities in measuring financed emissions, setting net-zero targets, and delivering carbon accounting insights across the enterprise.
• Contribute to and lead development and delivery of presentation and reports.

• Degree in a quantitative discipline such as accounting, statistics, economics, econometrics, finance, mathematics, physics, engineering and/or a relevant professional qualification, with concentration in quantitative methods
• An interest in Environmental and Social Risk in general and climate change in particular
• An advanced understanding of programming and querying languages, including SQL and python
• Experience developing presentations, visualizations and dashboards for senior executives and an interest in developing advanced analytical capabilities
• Demonstrated ability in mathematical, statistical, financial or economic analyses on large, complex datasets and in translating data into business insights
• A desire and ability to build new and innovative approaches to complex problems.
• Commitment to quality and accuracy with a high level of attention to detail.
• Knowledge of climate change science with experience in the development and use of climate change and economic scenarios, models, projections and data.
• Knowledge or familiarity with the climate risk and/or target setting guidance issued by PCAF, NZBA, TCFD, ISSB, and/or OSFI (B-15)
<li>Experience with or knowledge of carbon-intensive sectors, e.g. agriculture
• Experience with or interest in agile or design thinking methodologies or frameworks.
• Prior Product Management knowledge/experience or an interest in Product Management.
• Knowledge and experience in quantitative model development, testing and validation.
• Knowledge of wholesale and retail credit risk rating systems with experience in parameter estimation, portfolio management, or risk appetite.
• Experience working with a diverse range of stakeholders.

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
• A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable.
• Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
• Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.
• Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
• Opportunities to building close relationships with clients.

All companies are not the same. What makes TD special as a business is also, what makes us special as an employer.
TD’s Colleague Promise: A better you. A better us.
A more confident you means a stronger us. We empower you to grow your skills, gain new perspectives, and create impact at work and in your community. That’s our unique and inclusive culture.

TD Insurance is part of TD Bank Group, one of Canada’s largest financial institutions. TD Insurance helps protect clients from the ‘accidents of life’ with a wide range of products including credit protection, life, health, travel, home and auto insurance. With more than three million clients, TD Insurance authorized products and services are available online, over the phone, and through a network of more than 1,000 TD Canada Trust branches.

In Canada, we have two lines of business, General Insurance and Life and Health. Our General Insurance business is one of the top home and auto insurance groups in Canada and the national leader in group insurance and affinity marketing. Our Life and Health business is the number one provider of critical illness insurance and direct life and health insurance in Canada.

At TD Insurance, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment. With a Canada-wide workforce of over 4,000 employees and offices in Atlantic Canada, Quebec, Ontario and Alberta, our company is always growing and can help you to grow. TD Insurance offers a stable and dynamic work environment where talent is appreciated and professional development is taken seriously. More than just a job, we offer rewarding careers.

We are hiring for the position of Intern / Co-Op III to provide a range of operational and analytical support and perform transactions and other processing activities. This role will not only provide you introductory experience in a professional setting, you will also be equipped with skills and experiences that contribute to the completion of your studies and prepare you to build a career in your chosen discipline. In this role, you will:
• Develop and improve the various actuarial models used
• Take part in the production of regulatory rate change submissions
• Take part in the production and analysis of monthly financial results
• Participate in various research projects and market studies
• Maintain and develop the underwriting rules in place
• Currently enrolled in an actuarial, math or related university program
• Strong academic records and positive work term feedback
• Quantitative proficiency and comfortable with large datasets
• Proficient in Microsoft Excel (Formulas), and Microsoft Office Suite
• Ideal candidate posses knowledge of R Shiny

• Not required but would be an asset: Previous Actuarial work experience Pursuing actuarial exams Knowledge and experience with SAS/SQL, VBA, R, Emblem, Radar, Python, Moody’s Analytics/GGY Axis and additional programs & languages University courses in Property & Casualty, Pricing/Ratemaking, Reserving, Life & Health, etc.
• This position is a 4-month work term and will commence May 5th- August 25th, 2023
• Applications must include a transcript, cover letter (one letter-sized page or less) and a resume (maximum of 2 pages).

column3:
>Requisition ID: 174650

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

column1: Reporting to the Sr Manager, Non Pre-Approval Origination, the Sr Analyst will assist the senior manager in monitoring new accounts origination trends for unsecured Lending portfolio, support on credit risk strategy initiatives and other ad-hoc analysis will be required as necessary.

The Sr Analysts generally works within the established framework to carry on responsibilities under the supervision of the Senior Manager of Non Pre-Approval origination. A high degree of self-assurance, initiative and business sense is required of the Senior Analyst in order to carry out the position responsibilities proactively in a timely and effective manner.

The Sr Analyst will also use in-depth portfolio analytics to optimize approval/decline decision criteria, automation decision, and limit assignment strategies for New and Existing customers, learn about shifts in consumer credit behavior, and identify risks/opportunities that will impact the Risk Appetite Framework. These tasks will be accomplished leveraging extensive consumer data, credit risk and lending business expertise and advanced analytics techniques including machine learning.

• Create and maintain reports and dashboards that provide actionable insights.
  • Execute on data requests accurately within a timely manner.
  • Owner of the end-to-end reporting process (from raw data in SQL tables to automated production-grade dashboards) and be the key point of contact.
  • Improve monitoring on new accounts acquired through different channels and special programs. Track vintage performance and ensure a healthy growth of the portfolio.

• Analyze strategy effectiveness and proactively identify any emerging risks, make recommendations to support business growth while maintaining losses within risk appetite.
  • Ensure all new approved credit is aligned with risk appetite and regulatory requirements and will optimize risk/return over the long term.
  • Gain a deep understanding of various adjudication platforms and systems. Implement strategy changes across different technology platforms and channels.
  • Identify opportunities to improve/test new risk strategies with building a robust and competitive portfolio in mind.

• Collaborate and communicate effectively with business partners (product, operation, customer growth etc.) on new acquisition initiatives.
  • Represent Risk’s point of view and liaise with stakeholders throughout the organization to listen actively, communicate, and explain risk measures clearly and as appropriate.
Required: Bachelor’s degree or higher or equivalent work experience
A minimum of 1-3 years with an organization in the risk/portfolio management field or data science • Prior experience in a retail lending environment or credit risk management is an asset.
Proficiency in programing and database (SAS/Enterprise Miner or similar statistical software including the ability to apply advanced statistical techniques, SQL, R, Python).
Able to translate data into digestible dashboards and business insights (Tableau, PowerBI). • Strong ownership mentality and can-do attitude.
Ability to work effectively within a team, able to multi-task and strong analytics skills. • Attention to detail with personal accountability to ensure accuracy.

column3:
>Requisition ID: 174199

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

column1: The successful candidate will be part of a dynamic, innovative team that supports the Marketing Analytics & Product functions within Scotiabank’s Canadian Bank Analytics group. The individual will develop statistical models, data-mining and analytical solutions to solve a wide array of business problems, including how to drive acquisition, migration and engagement strategies across our customer base.

Scotiabank provides a collaborative work environment where you get to see end-to-end how your work can shape and define strategies. We will provide you the opportunities to gain exposure to different businesses across the organization, a wide variety of analytical tools that will allow you to build complex decision engines and predictive models, work with big data, structured and un-structured.
What will you do in this role?

• Design and integrate customer segmentation, channel analytics, campaign optimizations and recommendation/decision engines to help elevate our customer’s experiences across various channels and move to a personalized 1:1 customer journey
  • Synthesize data across multiple platforms to identify trends and deliver key insights and business recommendations around a customer-first approach to driving engagement and results across our marketing channels and campaigns, to then bringing these recommendations to market through execution and measurement
  • Act as a modelling and analytics generalist, provide subject matter expertise on modelling/segmentation, advanced analytics, data mining and statistical analysis to internal stakeholders
  • Ability to validate and measure effectiveness of customer/channel/campaign strategies to continually make ongoing changes and improvements
  • Supporting key information technology initiatives, such as enhancements in single view of customer, customer/ channel data warehouse, CRM and campaign management tools
  • Effectively communicate results of highly technical projects to stakeholders and deliver high quality, high impact analytical solutions to business problem
Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed?

• Analytical background: preferably Master or PhD degree with a quantitative focus, such as statistics, applied mathematics, economics, computer science
  • 5 years of related experience needed, preferably within a financial, retail or consulting industry, customer segmentation and channel analytics an asset
  • Demonstrated experience of developing and implementing statistical models (predictive & descriptive) and advanced analytics with hands-on experience with Python, SAS and Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Looker and Vertex AI etc.)
  • Experience with relational databases and solid SQL skills (SQL Server, DB2, MySQL)
  • Experience with Bash/Unix Shell Scripts with Python/Docker/Airflow used for automating tasks
  • Familiar with container-based deployments using Docker, working with Docker images, Docker Hub and Docker-registries and Kubernetes.
  • Familiar with Hadoop Big Data ecosystem (Hive, Spark, Pig, Sqoop) an asset.
  • Demonstrated experience developing and implementing recommendation engines in a multi-channel marketing environment an asset
  • Strong business acumen: understanding of business and financial models and ability to link communication tactics to strategic objectives from a financial perspective
  • Self-motivated, strong quantitative skills, attention to detail, a high aptitude for problem solving and a natural interest in understanding customer behavior

• We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
  • We provide you with the tools and technology needed to succeed
  • You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders
  • We offer a competitive total rewards package that includes a base salary, a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), 4 weeks of vacation, personal & sick days, paternity/maternity leave top-ups and much more.

column3:
>Requisition ID: 175543

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

column1:
The Manager, Portfolio Insights, SDA Risk, GRM will monitor key risk performance of the Retail Automotive portfolio, and contribute to the
development and enhancement of business intelligence tools and provide actionable insight to the Automotive Risk teams as well as product and
business line partners.

The role is highly technical and requires expert SAS, data analytics and BI tools knowledge, as well as ability to optimize and maximize
efficiency of existing processes. The incumbent will deliver strategic analysis to senior management while working with multiple stakeholders
and partners to facilitate development of Risk-Reward opportunities. He/She will develop optimal analytical methodologies to assess the growth
opportunities, and monitor results.

• Use a variety of Business Intelligence analytical and reporting tools (ex. SAS, Python, Tableau) to provide dynamic reporting on key
performance metrics to various stakeholders in GRM and business lines. Lead new report creation and look for opportunities to optimize
workstream.
• Provide actionable insights and meaningful messages from the reporting to drive credit risk decisions. Able to tell a story by synthesizing
vast amounts of data into coherent messages.
• Proactively provide strategic analysis that will assist in optimizing risk rewards ratios and grow the portfolios
• Collaborate with Strategy and Policy teams to provide measurement and reporting on strategic initiatives such as acquisition dynamics
and quality, line optimization and collections effectiveness
• Analyze strategy effectiveness , leverage champion/challenger capabilities to confirm assumptions and recommend changes, identify if
any credit risks are or will become in excess of the risk appetite framework and make recommendations on how to mitigate.

• Champion a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
• Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.

• Explore opportunities for using latest innovative analytics and Business Intelligence tools to showcase portfolio dynamics, derive
insights and streamline processes
• Aim to move from descriptive to prescriptive analytics by focusing on key drivers of portfolio risk and profitability

• Ensure all business line strategic priorities (i.e. life-cycle strategies, early warning triggers, provisioning, etc.) are consistent with Risk
Appetite Framework. Recommend changes to business line strategies to ensure the Bank does not take on more credit risk than
planned.
• Actively pursue effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and
effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF
risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory
Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.

• Bachelor's or Graduate Degree in Math, Engineering, Computer Science, Marketing, Economics or Statistics
  • 3+ years analytical experience required
  • Must be proficient with MS Office, SAS, SQL, Python, Power BI, Tableau
  • Strong communication skills essential with clients and management
  • Strong prioritizing, planning, analytical, presentation, project management, people management and relationship building skills
  • 1+ years’ experience in Retail Products is a great asset

Requisition ID: 168147

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

The role Manager, AI and Machine Learning, AML/ATF Models and Analytics is responsible for applying sophisticated statistical and AI/Machine Learning technique to develop and implement better models and solutions for Transaction Monitoring, Payment and Name Screening and Client risk Rating.

This role contributes to the overall success of the Global Risk Management’s AML/ATF team by ensuring specific individual goals, plans, and initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives, and ensures all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.
• Apply sophisticated modeling techniques, including AI and Machine learning, to develop and implement innovation models and solutions for the Bank's AML program.

• Research and understand the latest advances in AML/ATF analytics and predictive models to a wide range of products and services across the enterprise customer base in order to continually enhance the model performance for AML/ATF and ABAC models

• Participate with, the model development teams to scope, understand and appropriately document AML/ATF risk, develope and update statistical approaches with longer term strategies to mitigate this risk and improving the model performance across products and services globally
• Contribute to the development of optimal AML/ATF strategic alternatives by identifying and presenting opportunities for the effective deployment of analytics for AML program
• Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge

• Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.
• Assist the team in ensuring all procedures and practices are complied with regulatory and internal requirements
Experience with statistical modeling and data science methods

Experience programming in Python, Scala, R and C++. Experience with databases such as Oracle or SQL Server
AML/ATF (including ABAC) experience or analytical knowledge
Master’s degree or higher in science, technology, engineering or mathematics

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: ""for every future"", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank

column1: 44bcefa4-7aa8-4ee3-86d0-a61c4dd3f463,211705897,NVIDIA,"Solutions Architect, Conversational AI Technology",on_site,"Ontario, Canada",2023-04-03T17:42:04.425Z,"<div class=""css-1r0myd7"">

NVIDIA’s Worldwide Field Operations (WWFO) team is looking for a Data Science focused Solution Architect with expertise in Machine Learning (ML), Deep Learning (DL) and Data Science platforms. In particular we are looking for a candidate with understanding of modern Natural Language Processing (NLP), Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) or Text To Speech (TTS) workflows. Exposure to inferencing technology (e.g. understanding of model compression techniques, model compilation or model serving) in the above mentioned space would be an added value. In our Solutions Architecture team, we work with the most exciting computing hardware and software, driving the latest breakthroughs in artificial intelligence. We need individuals who can enable customer productivity and develop lasting relationships with our technology partners, making NVIDIA an integral part of end-user solutions. We are looking for someone always thinking about artificial intelligence, someone who can maintain synergy in a fast paced, rapidly evolving field, someone able to coordinate efforts between corporate marketing, industry business development and engineering.

You will be working with the latest HPC architectures coupled with bleeding edge NLP, ASR and TTS models, changing the way people interact with technology. As a Solutions Architect, you will be the first line of technical expertise between NVIDIA and our customers. Your duties will vary from working on proof-of-concept demonstrations, to driving relationships with key executives and managers in order to evangelize accelerated computing. Dynamically engaging with developers, scientific researchers, data scientists, IT managers and senior leaders is a meaningful part of the Solutions Architect role and will give you experience with a range of partners and concerns.
• Develop and demonstrate solutions based on NVIDIA’s state-of-the-art NLP, ASR, TTS and broader Conversational AI software and hardware technologies to customers
• Work directly with key customers to understand their technology and provide the best solutions
• Perform in-depth analysis and optimization to ensure the best performance on GPU architecture systems. This includes support in optimization of both training and inference pipelines.

• Partner with Engineering, Product and Sales teams to develop, plan best suitable solutions for customers. Enable development and growth of product features through customer feedback and proof-of-concept evaluations
• Build industry expertise and become a contributor in integrating NVIDIA technology into Enterprise Computing architectures.
• Work closely with customer\'s data science and IT teams
• Excellent verbal, written communication, and technical presentation skills in English.
• MS/PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Electrical/Computer Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, other Engineering fields
• 5+ years work or research experience with Python, C++ software development
• A proven track record of academic and/or industry experience in fields related to machine learning, deep learning and/or data science.
• Work experience and knowledge or modern NLP, ASR or TTS.
• You are excited to work with multiple levels and teams across organizations (Engineering, Product, Sales and Marketing team)
• Capable of working in a rapidly changing environment without losing focus.
• Ability to multitask effectively in a fast-paced environment.
• Action-oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Strong time-management and organization skills for coordinating multiple initiatives, priorities and implementations of new technology and products into very complex projects
• You are a self-starter with attitude for growth, passion for continuous learning and sharing findings across the team
Ways to Stand Out from The Crowd:
• Experience running large scale distributed DL training.
• Background with working with larger transformer based architectures for NLP, CV, ASR or other.
• Experience applying NLP, ASR, TTS technology and its deployment to production.
• Experience using DevOps technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, Singularity, etc.
• Understanding of HPC systems: data center design, high speed interconnect InfiniBand, Cluster Storage and Scheduling related design and/or management experience.

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

column1: As a Analytics DevOps Senior Engineer, your responsibility will be to write scripts to manage and automate MLOps and DevOps for analytics deployment of software releases. You will evaluate the latest MLOps solutions to optimize our MLOps platform.

• Hands-on with Spark and pySpark.
• Passion to continual learn new and changing technologies.
• Strong self-leaning skills as we work with many new technologies.

• GCP experience a strong asset.
• Working knowledge of docker.
• Modern DevOps practices .
• Previous experience with Git and Gitflow.
• Comfortable presenting to large groups.
