> Strong architecture knowledge within numerous fields: business, application, information, and technology architecture facets.
> Hands-on experience in at least one of the Data Integration development technologies (Mulesoft, Kafka, Qlik Replicate, Azure Data Factory).
> Strong Informatica Intelligent Cloud Services (IICS) or IBM DataStage experience will also be considered.
> Good understanding of application design patterns (Dependency Injection, Microservices, and others) and modern platforms (API/Microservices, Mobile, MBaaS, Mulesoft, Container).
> Knowledge and working experience in Google Cloud Platform – Big Query, Cloud SQL, Dataproc, Cloud Storage.
> Comparable working experience in Azure Ecosystem will also be considered.
> Strong ability to bring a complex concept to actionable architecture deliverables.
> Strong capacity to learn new concepts and technology quickly with the capacity to coach, mentor, and develop others by teaching them.
> Strong ability to taking hard decisions by understanding and explaining trade-offs between business enablement and economic impacts.
> The role requires people skills to influence and orient business and technical audiences toward a common goal that is satisfying all stakeholders.
> Very good ability to build collaborative cross-functional relationships, pulling together and maintaining a cohesive and high-functioning team.
> Strong ability to lead the team on a mandate and to lead decisions.
> Ability to deliver mandate with great autonomy – self-driven.

column3:
>Requisition ID: 173614

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

column1: Working within Global Risk Management (GRM), this position will take accountability and drive the production of data driven analyses resulting in actionable insights that improve the Bank’s Operational Risk performance. Additionally, support Global Operational Risk (GOR)’s data governance process to ensure compliance with the Bank’s data standards.
Leverage your strong analytical and data management background to collaborate with various business partners to:

• Lead the development, implementation, and monitoring of Global Operational Risk data strategies to mitigate Operational Risk events and support business line decision making
• Act as a ‘Single Point of contact’ for key Analytics initiatives including partnering with analytics teams and enterprise data and analytics capabilities
• Act as analytics expert on advanced analytics projects, challenging analytical thinking and methodology
• Deliver on analytical projects that provide actionable insights to improve Operational Risk decision making
• Ensure team collaboration with partners on business problems / issues and provide fact-based analytical advice that aligns to strategy and drives shareholder value
• Recommend improvements to existing processes to support data analytics, including data collection in Source systems
• Introduce changes under a test/control framework to help drive objective, evidence-based decisions
• Work closely with leadership teams to create data strategies that support data modeling
• Build strong and influential internal relationships (with stakeholders such as other Bank data and analytics teams, GOR teams, third parties, etc.) to help ensure business objectives are being met
• Ensure all GOR’s data processes comply with the Bank’s data standards, including support with the monitoring of data quality processes.

• Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
• Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
• Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.
• Champions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment.

column1: e7f123cb-0852-4526-a751-a1bf403213f6,218282647,Google,"Software Developer III, Infrastructure, Google Cloud Platforms",on_site,"Toronto, ON, Canada",2023-04-24T17:20:02.934Z,"<div>
Software Developer III, Infrastructure, Google Cloud Platforms
Apply
• 2 years of experience with software development in C++.
• 2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms in either an academic or industry setting.
• Master\'s degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical fields.
• 2 years of experience building and developing large-scale infrastructure, distributed systems or networks, and/or experience with compute technologies, storage, and/or hardware architecture.
About the job

Google\'s software developers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We\'re looking for software developers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile
column2: the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software developer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our software developers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

column1: Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google\'s product portfolio possible. We\'re proud to be our engineers\' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
• Participate in, or lead design reviews with peers and stakeholders to decide amongst available technologies.
• Review code developed by other developers and provide feedback to ensure best practices (e.g., style guidelines, checking code in, accuracy, testability, and efficiency).
• Contribute to existing documentation or educational content and adapt content based on product/program updates and user feedback.
• Triage product or system issues and debug/track/resolve by analyzing the sources of issues and the impact on hardware, network, or service operations and quality.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

To learn more about COVID vaccination requirements for US Google workplaces, read our Vaccination Entry Policy.

At Google, we’re committed to building a workforce that is more representative of the users we serve and creating a culture where everyone feels like they belong. To learn more about our diversity, equity, inclusion commitments and how we’re building belonging, please visit our Belonging page for more information.

We welcome and encourage people who are expecting and/or parents-to-be to apply to this or any other role at Google.

Google is a global company and, in order to facilitate efficient collaboration and communication globally, English proficiency is a requirement for all roles.

d4581324-19ab-434c-b3d0-2894ca3a2d7c,210223736,OMERS,"Director, Data Integration & Performance Platform",on_site,"Ontario, Canada",2023-03-30T17:42:05.285Z,"<div class=""css-13brsu4"">

OMERS overall vision is to play a leadership role in the pension industry and be first of class, deliver superior services and to grow and attract investment partners. The core values are to be fair, have high integrity, respect for each other, provide superior service and work as a team.
The Corporate Objectives for OMERS is to provide secure pensions for all their constituents by:
• Investing to earn outstanding returns with due regard for risk
• Providing high quality service to our members and employers
• Building a culture of excellence and pride in OMERS
OMERS Operating Principles are: Financial Strength, Accountability, Member Focus, Talent and Reporting.

This is an opportunity to join a forward-looking leadership team to help design and lead a digital transformation that will enable OMERS Capital Markets, Total Portfolio Management, and Corporate Finance functions to deliver on our pension promise. Our team is at the early stages of defining a strategic roadmap, and the selected leader will be a key member of the team that will work with our internal partners to understand their needs and deliver outcomes, with excellence. This role joins a team on a journey, with significant future potential in a global, sophisticated, and complex enterprise.

Reporting to the VP, Finance Platform, Capital Markets, the Director, Data Integration & Performance Platform leads a team of business system analysts and technical analysts that support and deliver change to data management and performance measurement products, as well as our investment data warehouse, and provide data integration services across mission critical investment systems supporting OMERS Capital Markets. As the lead product manager for this scope of services, the incumbent will be responsible for understanding and delivering against department objectives, and the needs of our internal partners.

This incumbent will drive strategic initiatives that will enhance the capital markets data & analytics capabilities at OMERS, and will be required to have a deep understanding of modern trends in data management, architecture, cloud infrastructure, and utilities, through continuous learning and industry engagement.
• Lead the execution of transformation initiatives to modernize OMERS’ data management and performance measurement capabilities for Finance in support of Capital Markets.
• Manage the end-to-end delivery of changes to the investment data warehouse and performance applications.

• Ensure the timely and accurate delivery of investment data, P&L and performance to internal partners. Includes assisting in the root cause analysis and resolution of data quality issues by tracing data lineage and analyzing technical processes.
• Engage partners to identify and prioritize new features through pro-active engagement and maintenance of the product backlog.
• Lead two layered teams, comprising of analysts to senior managers, with vision, clarity, and technical expertise, providing relevant coaching for professional development.

• Partner with Capital Markets Finance and Data & Technology experts to deliver data integration and reporting solutions, including integrations between order and execution management, accounting, data warehouse, and performance systems.
• Facilitate vendor governance processes to influence the product roadmap and escalate service issues.
• Develop and institute solution design principles that are forward-thinking and optimize for efficacy, sustainability, and time to market.
• Use metrics and feedback to improve organizational processes, implement best practices, and enhance performance, creating a culture of excellence and continuous improvement.
• Mature change delivery processes and drive a transformation to Agile and DevOps.
• Track and report on product roadmaps, completed work, capacity, backlog, KPIs, etc.
• Document and maintain key processes and controls, for training, continuity, and audit purposes.
• Develop relationships among partners by supporting a culture of transparency, collaboration, and service excellence.
• Influence and represent the broader team’s leadership, to accomplish collective wins.

• Minimum 9 years experience in data management and analytics roles managing data warehouse platforms, including production support, change initiatives and/or large transformation programs in the Financial Services industry
• Minimum of 5 years experience leading, managing and coaching a team with diverse skills and backgrounds, with a demonstrated history of contributing to their development and success
• Expert knowledge of SQL and cloud enabled data management solutions
• Expert knowledge of ETL/ELT tools and design patterns
• Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in a related field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Accounting, or Finance
• Knowledge of the investment lifecycle and data domains for exchange traded and OTC products, including exotic instruments
• Hands-on experience with delivering complex data assets and a proven ability to manage multiple projects
• Experience implementing and delivering change to leading investment applications, including but not limited to Eagle, Calypso, and Charles River
• Experience with the Azure cloud platform and/or Snowflake are nice to have
• Excellence in all types of communication and facilitation with colleagues at all levels
• Self-motivated with strong, proven, analytical and problem-solving skills
• Commitment to standards of professionalism, internal controls and compliance
• Indications that you fit our desired culture, which mixes beautiful work with smiles and laughter
• High standards of business and ethical values including the ability to deal with confidential information
• A people-first focus with a desire to develop meaningful, positive relationships across all levels of the organization
• A teammate mentality coupled with servant leadership
• A sense of urgency, optimism, and a desire to deliver excellence
• A desire to drive debate, to speak candidly and to listen empathetically
• Strong orientation towards strategy, change and results

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $124 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2022. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with more than 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. 09e9fc40-f36a-4dc5-b970-119d1bab8513,218284079,Sun Life Financial,Senior Data Scientist (Health),on_site,"Ontario, Canada",2023-04-24T17:41:03.294Z,"<div class=""css-h386p3"">

You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

To support the vision of helping Canadians live healthier lives, Sun Life Health brings together Sun Life’s Group Benefits and Health Ecosystem businesses, including Lumino Health (an innovative platform launched in 2018). By uniting these two groups, Sun Life Health can deliver on transformative health solutions for both Clients and Canadians. If you’re passionate about improving health for Canadians, and like to take on big challenges in a supportive environment, the Data Science & Analytics (DSA) team in Sun Life Health is the right fit.
• Being the analytics translators to identify and deliver high-impact data science use cases
• Building dashboards and reports to monitor progress and help extract valuable insights from vast amounts of data
• Partnering with other Analytics/IT groups to leverage expertise of Data Engineers/Developers to explore and solve complex business problems
• Supporting various teams within Sun Life Health to leverage best practices associated with data management and develop processes that support data driven decision making

The Senior Data Scientist’s primary focus is to collaborate closely with the health product and strategy team to launch and test new ideas and solutions to generate innovation within Sun Life’s Health Ecosystem, and to identify data science use cases, create the project execution plan and to drive the project through its life cycle. As part of this life cycle, you will create/maintain data models, provide expertise in data interpretation to support strategic decision making, and leverage analytical skills to highlight trends and insights from data. You will also be responsible for feasibility study of use cases for production at scale and automation.
Identify potential data science/machine learning opportunities, create and execute end-to-end plan for implementation and delivery
• Work closely with health product and strategy team to define use case and scope
• Identify appropriate data sources relevant to the modeling application
• Create data pipeline for extracting the data into AWS S3
• Perform data preprocessing to ensure data quality
• Apply feature engineering principles to create feature space
• Create labels if known and appropriate to the problem at hand
• Apply machine learning models to identify model with best performance
• Perform cross validation and hyper parameter tuning to optimize model performance
• Monitor deployed model for data and model drift
• Participate in the technical design, development, and testing of models/analysis and in the creation of user documentation and processes
• Create and maintain ETL processes and automated dashboards that can be leveraged to find insights
• Develop and present reporting solutions to key stakeholders and partners
• Learn about business processes to analyze, interpret, and advise managers on analytical findings
• Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure effective use of reporting and analysis, and provide support if needed
• Understand and incorporate technology best practices with a primary focus on Tableau and Python
• Diligently perform quality assurance and risk assessment guidelines to minimize operational, reputation, and legal risk
• Experience with developing machine learning, statistical and optimization models and creating/maintaining visualizations and dashboards in Tableau (minimum 2 years)
• Experience in healthcare and familiarity with health data (1 year)
• Familiar with data science project life cycle
• Technical mindset with a degree in Computer Science,
column3: >Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or other data science related fields, and 3-5 years of relevant experience. A graduate degree would be an asset, a combination of education and work experience will also be considered.

• Ability to succeed in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, and quickly find alternative solutions to business and data challenges
• Attention to detail and in-depth planning, organizational and time management skills
• Experience working with relational databases and creating data models with efficient design
• Experience with AWS SageMaker would be an asset.

In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. column1: ee915a38-782a-416a-82ea-b740e0904bae,218284078,Sun Life Financial,Senior Business Data Engineer,on_site,"Ontario, Canada",2023-04-24T17:41:03.131Z,"<div class=""css-h386p3"">

You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

At Sun Life, we work together, share common values and encourage growth and achievement. We offer many career paths that attract a wide variety of talent and skills. Follow a path that lets your talents shine.

The Client Experience Office (CXO) is an important pillar of Sun Life’s corporate strategy and as such, is seeking experienced data engineering individuals with a proven track record working with data consumers to extract meaningful insights from enterprise data. Senior Business data engineers play an indispensable role in assembling the necessary data products that fuel myriad of analytical models used by our various business units across Canada.

Reporting to the Manager of Data Engineering, the Senior Business Data Engineer will be a key member of Data Enablement Team responsible for building enriched data products that provide deep insights about our Client, Advisor, Product, Transactions along with their intricate relationships. The Senior Business Data Engineer will work with data analysts and data scientists to help answer complex business enquires such as identifying new business opportunities, understanding our client behavior and optimizing areas of our sales cycles.
• Obsessed with understanding our enterprise data and interpreting it in the best way possible to derive business value
• Design and engineer data models that represent our key business entities such as our Advisor, Client & Product
• Ensure high level of data quality and data integrity are maintained across data sources for business
• Convert complex business and technical rules into logic for data flows and data pipelines
• Work with our Data Science teams to implement data products for various use cases
• Collaborate with stakeholders and incorporate into solution design for various use case requirements
• Standardize metadata into a common glossary along with the necessary documentation for data consumers
• 3-5 years hands-on experience working on AWS technologies for data processing and analytics
• 2+ years experience with AWS Glue for ETL
• 3 years experience in Pyspark and SQL
• 5 years hands-on experience with relational database systems, relational models, dimensional models etc.
• 3-5 years experience with engineering data products as input to various analytical models
• 3-5 years building feedback loops between model deployment and its data – i.e. tune & tweak data products to achieve scale, optimization, etc.
• Sound understanding of data management principles (data warehousing, data quality, master data management, etc.)
• Sound understanding of data modelling and a passion for analytics
• Proven track record in leveraging SQL and SQL-based programming to solve business problems
• Ability to translate complex business requirements into a set of data ingestion pseudocode
• Proven ability to leverage knowledge of data engineering to extract, conform and integrate a variety of operational data sources into pro‐duction-grade data products
• Demonstrate blend of tenacity, creativity, and discipline required to develop ground breaking self-serve data models that data scientists can consume

column1: Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

We are searching for a talented candidate to become our team’s Manager, Enterprise Data Engineering. Reporting to the Director – Enterprise Data Engineering, the successful candidate will be responsible for leading a team of accomplished data analysts, engineers and architects supporting our data and analytics platform transformation. This role will be an agent of change and support the evolving strategy, data and analytics roadmaps as well as provide overarching direction to support our TELUS Business Solutions Team (TBS).

The portfolio will focuses on continuous improvement to our GCP engineering practices (common ingestion framework), CI/CD pipelines, DevOps, SRE, real-time data ingestion, addressing technical debt and support the Business Master Data Management (MDM) and Revenue Generating Unit (RGU) workstreams. Our team is a cloud first team and leverages the latest technologies to fuel our mission and purpose.
At TELUS, we put ‘Customers First’. With a broad set of responsibilities and a high degree of visibility across the TELUS organization, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to:
• Lead a team of talented data platform Analysts, Engineers and Architects to drive the modernization of our data platforms
• Foster internal and external stakeholder relationships, including managing senior executive participants
• Provide guidance to establish standards and best practices for building enterprise grade data pipelines
• Work with our preferred Cloud service providers to align our roadmap based on their release schedule for services and product offerings.
• Construct comprehensive business cases and financial models leveraging various methods to support strategic projects and decisions with data driven insights
• Utilize internal and external data points coupled with market research on marketplace dynamics impacting TELUS and the Data Strategy team to inform opportunities and risks for the team
• Create technology roadmaps for business partners, executive management, and external audiences to enhance strategic decision making and support technology investment recommendations
• Collaborate with key stakeholders to create, track and evolve the team scorecards and strategic imperatives
• Support the annual strategic and financial planning process
• Flex your communication, negotiation, and influencing skills, working with a broad set of internal stakeholders, executives and external partners
• Mentor, lead, and support a diverse and very talented team
You have experience in technical leadership, managing data platforms, business intelligence tools and setting architectural direction
• You can communicate clearly and effectively in both technical and business matters able to translate technical considerations into business implications
• You are analytical and outcome-oriented with a proven ability to translate business requirements into high-level design models
• You have hands on knowledge of foundational cloud data architecture of lakes, warehouses, data modeling, and life cycle management
• You have demonstrated experience with the governance and oversight of data privacy, security and the ethical use of data in previous roles
• You have experience with cloud migration projects, agile methodologies, and DevOps practices
• You have impressive people leadership track record with proven ability to recruit, coach, mentor and lead high performing teams in a fast-paced environment
• You are a skilled relationship builder and skilled at prioritization, negotiation and influencing
• You can pivot between supporting the urgent needs of the business and the long-term roadmap
• You have experience working on and supporting large, complex technical projects that involve multiple stakeholders and business units
• You have exposure to tools, technologies and programming languages including, but not limited to, Python, Airflow (composer), SQL, Apache Nifi, Hive, Spark, Dataflow (Apache Beam) and Kafka
• You have experience creating a vision for and implementing a culture of change to drive CI/CD, DevOps and other opportunities for operational effectivenes
• 5+ years of progressive and relevant work experience with enterprise data
• Experience with the data offerings in the Google Cloud Platform
• Excellent communication skills and ability to lead a large team
1b9accf4-f6b9-4596-873b-39a82e83382a,219393199,Borealis AI,Research Director,on_site,"Ontario, Canada",2023-04-27T17:27:02.383Z,"<div class=""container w-full tb:w-8/12 m-auto greenhouse mb-36"">

Borealis AI is looking for a Research Director. The role includes directing a team of machine learning researchers and managing other research team leads with the goal of delivering AI-based products for the financial services industry. In addition, you will provide leadership and deliver on initiatives that improve the effectiveness of the entire research organization.
• To join the Borealis AI research leadership team and shape the research organization as a whole and contribute to its overall performance.
• To work with the Borealis AI business development team to identify viable artificial intelligence products that will add significant value to RBC stakeholders.
• To lead a team of machine learning researchers delivering cutting edge AI technology to support these products.
• To partner with Borealis AI’s product and engineering teams to ensure the seamless delivery of these products.
• To manage other research team leads and provide guidance and support.
• To help recruit, mentor and retain a high-performing research team across Borealis AI.
You’re our ideal candidate if you have:
<li>A Ph.D. degree in Computer Science or a related technical field
<li>10 years of experience leading research teams in machine learning in a product-centric environment or equivalent experience
<li>A track record of successful people management including mentoring junior researchers and engineers, experienced high-performance researchers, and research managers
• Experience delivering successful high-impact machine learning products
<li>Involvement across the research and development lifecycle, from prototyping to production, engaging with stakeholders to develop solutions that meet business needs
<li>Broad research interests and detailed knowledge of cutting edge machine learning techniques across multiple areas
<li>The ability to formulate and drive multiple research projects independently
<li>A history of high quality academic publications (e.g., NeurIPS, CVPR, AISTATS, ICLR, ICML etc.) and community recognition for excellence
<li>Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential
<li>A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable
• Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto, Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.

RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.
b66c43ef-d620-4bfb-b36a-d83cfaed0cb0,217991214,Borealis AI,Data Engineer,on_site,"Ontario, Canada",2023-04-23T17:27:01.479Z,"<div class=""container w-full tb:w-8/12 m-auto greenhouse mb-36"">

We’re looking for an enthusiastic data engineer who’s excited by the opportunity of designing distributed systems to support applications at the forefront of machine learning technology. As a Data Engineer, you’ll be responsible for owning and delivering systems to efficiently acquire, prepare, and process data for state-of-the-art AI solutions that we build at Borealis AI.

Engineering plays a vital role at Borealis AI, turning our machine learning models into products that generate exponential business value. We understand the financial system we operate in, and we have the resources, knowledge and tools to improve it. Our team of 40+ engineers work with leading Machine Learning researchers to accelerate, build and deploy products that will enhance risk applications, reduce fraud, help millions of people manage cash flow, access credit and plan for their financial futures. In the finance sector, millions of people are counting on us to get it right.
<li>Helping build a world-class AI platform for Borealis AI and RBC
<li>Designing and building data pipelines for Borealis AI projects
<li>Building efficient data systems and abstractions for Borealis AI projects
• Collaborating with research, engineering and business teams to model and deliver on their data needs.
<li>A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent. A master’s or PhD in Data Systems sub-field is an asset
<li>3+ years of software development experience in a high-responsibility, minimal-supervision environment
<li>Practical experience with all components of data requirements for ML systems ranging from data acquisition, storage, modelling and process, and serving in production systems
<li>Strong enterprise experience with data systems and infrastructure at scale
<li>Solid understanding of query optimization and modern data stack including Flink, dbt, spark, SQL engines, Parquet/Arrow, etc.
<li>Strong experience with writing modular, robust, scalable software in Python 3.x
<li>Strong communication skills and a collaborative attitude
• Hands-on experience deploying data systems in Cloud, AWS experience is an asset.
<li>Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential
<li>A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable
<li>Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
• Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale.

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto, Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.

RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

595f5d69-bde9-4a2c-98c8-67a0b1e5a562,236452209,Scotiabank,"Data Scientist, Financial Crimes Risk Management Models and Analytics - 12 Month Contract",on_site,Canada : Ontario : Toronto,2023-06-15T15:52:03.725Z,"<div class=""joblayouttoken rtltextaligneligible displayDTM""> <div class=""inner fontcolorb6a533a1"" style=""font-family:Arial , Helvetica , sans-serif
column3: >

>Requisition ID: 179463

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

column1:
Purpose of Job
We are seeking a highly analytical and skilled Data Scientist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, statistical modelling, and machine learning. The Data Scientist will be responsible for designing, enhancing, and implementing data-driven solutions supporting the Bank's AML/ATF Client Risk Rating models.
This role contributes to the overall success of Global Risk Management’s AML/ATF team by analyzing and improving client risk rating models thereby enhancing operating efficiency and is conducted in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies, and procedures.

Key Job Accountabilities
• Apply range of modeling techniques from basic statistical models to AI and Machine Learning, to develop, maintain and implement models for client risk rating case generation in support of Scotiabank’s AML/ATF program
• Creation and maintenance of documentation for models and for the results data analysis
• Collaborating and coordinating with teams from model validation, internal audit, and external audit to ensure that models meet all legal and regulatory requirements
• Communicate complex data findings and insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders
• Support the communication with first and second lines of business and other stakeholders, and recommending changes to AML/ATF client risk rating models as appropriate
• Support the communication with model users to ensure that model limitations are properly understood, and that models meet model governance/usage requirements

Skills, Experiences and Functional Competencies
• Experience with statistical modeling and data science methods
column2:
programming in Python (familiarity working with popular libraries for data science, machine learning, and visualization: such as Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, Matplotlib, Seaborn, ggplot2), querying using SQL or any SQL-like language is preferred, experience with Apache Spark is beneficial
• Experience with databases such as Oracle or SQL Server, as well as big data technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, Spark, or other distributed computing frameworks
• Experience with cloud-based infrastructure and tools, (specifically GCP) and either Linux and/or BitBucket is beneficial
• Nice to have experience with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, Keras, or PyTorch
• Strong communication (both oral and written) and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a hybrid team environment

column1:
Education and Other Requirements
• Bachelor’s degree or higher within STEAM, (science, technology, engineering, analytics, or mathematics), statistics, data science, artificial intelligence, computer science, computer engineering, financial modelling or related
• Fluency in both English and Spanish is preferred

4f269690-0cc3-4815-8e4a-25de032955b3,235604756,Roche,Finance Center of Excellence - Advanced Analytics Lead,on_site,"Mississauga, ON, Canada",2023-06-12T20:28:02.819Z,"

The Position

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Finance Advanced Analytics & Machine Learning Product Owner to join our team. This Product Owner will be responsible for driving and supporting (and in some cases, developing) our use cases and execution of Predictive Forecasting and Statistical Modeling capabilities to our Finance data that generates valuable insights to our organization. You will be working in an innovative, solution focused way, bringing your Finance subject matter expertise into an agile team approach, partnering closely with various functions in our global organization.

You need to be well versed in exploration of data and analytics, statistical modeling and predictive forecasting capabilities, and blending this with our core products in the Advanced Analytics space (R, Python, SAP Analytics Cloud, and others). You will be collaborating across Finance and with our Informatics and Shared Services Data Science organizations to execute in building a strategic approach to our Advanced Analytics capabilities for the Finance organization and our business stakeholders.

This role is for a Digital for Finance team member with extensive experience and subject matter expertise in Analytics in Finance in the Pharmaceutical or similar industry, with a comprehensive understanding of key financial processes and systems, organizational needs, and with a value focused approach.
The successful candidate will be responsible for:
• Developing a deep understanding of the organization's financial data needs and identifying opportunities to leverage data to drive business outcomes.

• Working closely with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, data analysts, and business stakeholders to define product requirements and drive the development of machine learning and descriptive, predictive and prescriptive analytics and use cases.
• Defining and monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs) for our advanced analytics products to measure their effectiveness and impact.
• Be a steward for digital capabilities, helping to identify and develop capabilities in the advanced analytics space from the finance perspective
• Staying up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in advanced analytics and recommending changes to improve the organization's finance strategy in this area.
<li>Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or a related field
• Minimum of 5 years of experience in finance, data analytics, or a related field.
• Strong project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks effectively.
• Experience in the areas of core financial forecasting activities and processes
• Experience in Advanced Forecasting, including familiarity with developing or supporting time-series or statistical forecast models
• Experience in Advanced Data Analytics, including designing and/or delivering advanced quantitative data analyses leveraging large/complex datasets
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
• Strong analytical skills, with the ability to analyze complex data sets and draw insights that drive business outcomes.
• Data & Analytics project implementation experiences that exploit the full capabilities (discover, design, implement and optimization)
• Technology and Data savviness, passionate about latest technology trends and data driven mindset, innovative and curious mindset, with a passion for learning and teaching

If you are passionate about finance, leveraging powerful advanced analytics technologies to drive actionable insights, and are looking for an exciting opportunity to make an impact in a dynamic and growing organization, we encourage you to apply for this position.
** This role is NOT eligible for relocation**

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

Roche Pharma Canada has its office in Mississauga, Ontario and employs over 850 employees. The Mississauga facility is bright, vibrant, fosters collaboration and teamwork, and is reflective of Roche's truly innovative culture.

As of January 4, 2022, Roche requires all new employees who work in Canada to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 on the date they take office. This requirement is a condition of employment at Roche that applies regardless of whether the position is on a Roche campus or remotely. If you have a valid reason for not being fully immunized, which is limited to certain specific medical reasons or other valid reasons protected by applicable human rights laws, you may request an exemption and / or adaptation measures regarding this vaccination requirement.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

083cd1ec-d711-406a-b936-91fb9d78efaa,249063922,Roche,Principal Scientist II Bioinformatics,on_site,"Mississauga, ON, Canada",2023-07-20T16:20:18.730Z,"

The Position

Roche Sequencing Solutions (RSS), a business within Roche Diagnostics, focused on developing a disruptive Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) platform along with a portfolio of reagents, assays and informatics solutions for multiple disease areas. We are looking for a Principal Bioinformatics Scientist in the NGS Algorithms and Applications team to support the algorithm development efforts.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with assay scientists, software engineers and other bioinformatics scientist and apply your strong knowledge in next generation sequencing technologies. This will include illumine SBS (sequencing by synthesis), nanopore, etc. to design and develop algorithms for read processing, alignment, and variant (SNV, SV, insertions/deletions, CNV, TMB, MSI) callers etc. This will be used in our products that will affect patient care.
• Lead algorithm development effort for NGS applications including conceptualization, method development and implementation of production level algorithms in an Agile environment.
• Follow software development process and deliver and maintain documentation that explains why and how as well as the final design for scientific, marketing, and regulatory uses

• Present internally or externally (peer-reviewed publications or conference proceedings) and communicate updates across multiple functions in the organization. Transfer algorithm to production teams and provide scientific support for updates and maintenance
• Support bioinformatics pipeline to continue development for existing products

• PhD in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or other quantitative field combined with 2 - 6 years of experience of designing novel algorithms for NGS data analysis for example read processing, variant calling (SNV, insertions/deletions, CNV, SV, TMB, MSI etc.), variant annotation and analyzing large scale complex genomic datasets.
• Experiences in developing novel algorithms, complexity analysis, as well as demonstrated skillset in statistical and mathematical modeling is a Must.
• Experience implementing high-quality and efficient product level code.
• In depth knowledge of sequencing (long and/or short read), cancer molecular biology, bioinformatics tools, statistical methods.
• Proficient with programming languages (C++ and/or Python) in a distributed Linux environment
• Experience with Machine learning / Deep learning (used in NGS context) is a plus.
• Hands-on experience using a workflow management system such as Nextflow or Snakemake, using Docker and cloud computation resource and storage
• Strong written and verbal communication skills with ability to adjust to technical and non-technical audiences
• Result-oriented individual that thrives in collaborative multi-disciplinary teams. Excels at incorporating feedback in a professional manner.
• One or more first/co-first author publication(s) in a high-impact peer reviewed journals is highly desired.
Relocation assistance is not available for this role.

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

Roche Pharma Canada has its office in Mississauga, Ontario and employs over 850 employees. The Mississauga facility is bright, vibrant, fosters collaboration and teamwork, and is reflective of Roche's truly innovative culture.

As of January 4, 2022, Roche requires all new employees who work in Canada to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 on the date they take office. This requirement is a condition of employment at Roche that applies regardless of whether the position is on a Roche campus or remotely. If you have a valid reason for not being fully immunized, which is limited to certain specific medical reasons or other valid reasons protected by applicable human rights laws, you may request an exemption and / or adaptation measures regarding this vaccination requirement.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

4f7fcf71-680e-4a47-ba55-78d8e4489afc,253593282,League,Data Engineer ,full,Canada,2023-07-31T17:46:55.507Z,"

About League Founded in 2014, League is a platform technology company powering next-generation healthcare consumer experiences. Payers, providers, consumer health partners and employers build on League’s healthcare CX platform to deliver high-engagement, personalized healthcare experiences people love. League recently announced a $95 million funding round led by TDM Growth Partners, backer of breakthrough platforms Square, Twilio and Slack, bringing the total funding to $220 million. League is also among Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500, CB Insights’ Digital Health 150 and was named the Next Healthtech Unicorn by Accenture, among many other acknowledgements.

As a Data Engineer, you will build personalized & data driven healthcare products and pipelines that power our business intelligence insights. You will help build and support a highly available, secure and governed data platform.

In this role, you will work as part of a small multi-disciplinary team to establish and evangelize a data driven culture. This team will not only work with the product team closely but will also support non-engineering functions like Marketing and Business Strategy.

To thrive in this role, you are someone who works well in cross-functional teams and enjoys collaborating. Furthermore, you understand the business impact of your work and enjoy measuring and presenting it. You enjoy working with product management and other stakeholders to find the best solution to the problem at hand, iterate over it and can balance technical complexity with delivering customer value.

Our platform and applications run on Google Cloud. You will be working on building infrastructure for real-time and batch pipelines to ingest and transform data from a variety of sources. You will have an opportunity to experiment with new frameworks and paradigms, and freedom to put cutting-edge tech in production to shape the future of digital health!
• Translate business needs into data and analytics requirements, with attention to details.
• Utilize a variety of distributed computing platforms and tools to build scalable ETL / machine learning pipelines.
• Analyze, tune, troubleshoot and support the data infrastructure ensuring the performance, integrity, and security of data.
• Use sound agile development practices (testing and code reviewing, etc.) to develop and deliver data products.
• Experience in a cloud Data Stack - preferably GCP.
• Experience in coding in python and SQL.
• Experience in implementing CICD, error handling and monitoring for scalable pipelines.
• Experience in performing root cause analysis of production issues , performance tuning and optimization.
• Experience in building real time streaming data pipelines with tools like Dataflow
• Experience in supporting reporting tools as a platform eg- Looker, Tableau.
• Experience in data modeling, data governance and data discovery tools.
• Experience in healthcare datasets like EMR and Claims and interoperability standards like FHIR.
• Responsibility and accountability for executing League's policies and procedures
• Notification of HR, Legal, Compliance & Security of any incidents, breaches or policy violations
All Authorities are limited to the extent set out in the Authorization Policy

USA APPLICANTS ONLY: The US-specific compensation range below for this full-time position is exclusive of bonus, equity and benefits. This range reflects the minimum and maximum target for base salaries for the position across all US locations. Where in the band you may land is determined by job-related skills/experience and location. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your location during the hiring process.Compensation range for USA applicants only$122,000—$183,000 USDAt League, everyone is welcome. We believe individuals should not be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you are an individual in need of assistance at any time during our recruitment process, please contact us at recruitinginfo@league.com.

Our Application Process: Applying to a role you love can be exhausting, and understanding the next steps can feel vague and uncertain. You have done the hard part of submitting your application
column2: let's do ours by sharing potential next steps

column1: • You should receive a confirmation email after submitting your application.
• A recruiter (not a computer) reviews all applications at League.

• If we see alignment with League's needs, a recruiter will reach out to learn more about your goals. The recruiter will also share the team-specific interview process depending on the roles you are exploring.
• The final step is an offer, which we hope you will accept!
• Prior to joining us, we conduct reference and background checks. Additional checks could be required for US Candidates, depending on the role you are exploring.
Here are some additional resources to learn more about League:
• Learn about our platform, leadership team and partners
• Highmark Health, Google Cloud, League: new digital front door to seamless care

• League raises $95 million USD in Series C to build world’s leading healthcare CX platform

Recognize and Avoid Employment scams. Practice safe job searching.

Scammers are getting craftier and leveraging fake job postings to get personal information. Know the warning signs and protect yourself from scammers. Learn more here. Privacy PolicyReview our Privacy Policy for information on how League is protecting personal data.

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

Are you obsessed with data and identifying ways to harness and scale data intelligence across an entire organization? Do you love collaborating with fellow data professionals to develop innovative data solutions that lead to positive business outcomes? If your answer is yes, we would be delighted to have you onboard TELUS’ Data Strategy & Enablement team to provide vision and strategic guidance, while driving flawless execution on the development and evolution of large-scale machine learning environments.

You’ll be part of a multidisciplinary team of data wizards who are capitalizing on analytics and insights to deliver exceptional products and services for our customers. In turn, we hope you’ll enjoy being a valued member of Canada’s #1 global workplace with a world-leading culture featuring extensive community-giving initiatives, flexible work environment including remote work, award-winning opportunities for career development, and a competitive compensation and benefits package.
As a technology company, data is central to our mission to create better outcomes for our customers, especially as we strive to deliver next-generation networks like 5G
column2: unlock the full potential of the Internet of Everything to power smart homes, businesses, industry, healthcare and cities
column3: and deliver an incredible customer experience. Our Data Strategy & Enablement team is at the helm of building world-class data solutions by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced Augmented Intelligence (AI) tooling, high-quality data, and a data product and platform-oriented culture. At the same time, this team remains passionate champions of reliability, security and privacy by design, and is committed to creating the utmost level of privacy and security protections for all data on our networks and systems.

column1: You’ll provide vision and strategic guidance to evolve from common static analysis to dynamic machine learning deployments, as well as expand our teams’ access to deep insights that improve the customer experience. You’ll work with a talented team of Data Scientists and other professionals to manage TELUS’ data platforms and offer the best possible analytics experience to internal stakeholders using the data. And finally, as a trusted advisor and partner, you’ll collaborate across various business units to accelerate the transformation of our platforms, improve the customer and team member experience, and drive business efficiencies.
• Build and maintain scalable data infrastructure that offers a best-in-class experience for internal stakeholders including consistent extraction of value from the data
• Drive data ingestion and processing in innovative ways that inform strategic priorities and decision-making across the organization
• Foster continuous systems transformation as we migrate infrastructure and applications to Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
• Build expertise in the team to expose efficiency insights across data platforms in the cloud
• Manage our cloud data analytics platform priorities to make sure data security and privacy are top considerations
• Implement automation and monitoring tools through a test-driven approach and mindset
• Drive the adoption of new cloud technologies to further advance TELUS’ data transformation strategy
• You are recognized for your 8+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical capacity
• You are sought out for your 5+ years’ experience of data warehouses/cloud architectures and platforms implementation with experience implementing and performance tuning
• An expert understanding of data warehouses/cloud architectures and ETL processes
• Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases and query authoring (SQL), as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases
• Experience with cloud platforms: GCP, Amazon or Azure (GCP gives you an edge!)
• Experience with Python and software engineering best practices
• Advanced knowledge in Dataflow, Spark and Kafka, as well as other data pipeline components
• Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools such as Airflow
• Having a proven track record in leading data analytics platform projects
• Ready to work in new and challenging work environments
• Getting excited by the opportunity to build a team\'s capabilities to create value and innovate through data, and doing so in an agile manner with a bias for action and speed
• Envisioning and delivering future technical roadmaps while inspiring others along the way
• Being a senior strategist and mentor who is sought out when it comes to analyzing and translating technicalities into business implications
• Working in cross-functional teams with exemplary communication and coordination skills
• Proving your analytical skills with root cause analysis of issues
• Demonstrating resilience, a questioning mindset, and strong observation skills and curiosity – you never settle for the status quo
• Caring passionately about your stakeholders and providing them with the data and insights they need to deliver on their customer and business outcomes
• Post-graduate education in Data Engineering, Cloud DevOps or Advanced Analytics

column3: >

>Requisition ID: 189674

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

column4: >The mandate of this role is to oversee the Portfolio Risk Analytics & Reporting for the Automotive Lending portfolio to optimize risk/return within Global Risk Management to assist Canadian Banking judicious priorities. In this role, the incumbent will develop and monitor key performance indicators of the automotive portfolio scrutinized through different lenses to maximize risk adjusted return while managing portfolio PCL.

>The incumbent will provide the team along with business line partners advanced data assessment, monitoring and measurement on the health of the Automotive portfolio to ensure strategies and policies are within the Risk Appetite Framework.

>This position plays a key role by using data, systems, research and analysis to identify portfolio trends, risk and opportunities across Automotive lending portfolios (Prime, Lease and SDA) by setting prudent risk controls and applicable tactics.

>The Senior Manager will proactively contribute to portfolio risk oversight by delivering comprehensive analytics that measure customer performance across multiple dimensions. The role is highly technical and requires expert SAS/Python, data analytics and BI tools skills.

>Use a variety of Business Intelligence analytical and reporting tools (i.e., SAS, Python, Tableau) to provide dynamic reporting on key performance metrics to various stakeholders in GRM and business lines. Lead new report creation and look for opportunities to optimize workstream through automation.
column7: >Maintain performance monitoring on new accounts acquired through different channels and special programs
column8: ensure performance align with targets, explain discrepancies/ emerging trends that may impact portfolio health (short term and long term).

column27: recommend changes to enhance performance and overall customer experience.

column4: >Stay informed of competitive landscape, partnering with the business line to ensure that as risk managers our processes, strategies and policies consider the changing landscape.

column3: >The Enterprise Protect is an enterprise-level body that strives to protect TD Bank Group customers, shareholders and employees from financial crimes and fraud. Aligned with TD strategy and risk appetite, Enterprise Protect develops and evolves enterprise policies, advanced analytics capabilities and operational processes to improve governance, oversight, and collaboration between fraud management and other control functions within the Bank.
column6: >The Canadian Performance Management (CPM) team operates within Enterprise Protect in a fast-paced environment requiring both strategic and tactical responses to changing fraud patterns and provides a unique opportunity to apply critical thinking and leadership skills in an innovation centric environment

column3: >As the most senior technical individual contributor within Canadian Performance Management, you will be responsible for leading complex initiatives, assisting with projects and being the trusted fraud SME. You will work across fraud portfolios, interact with vendors and partners across Enterprise Protect and beyond. You will provide required coverage and support to assist or lead incidents, represent fraud at forums, and will assist with urgent escalations. With deep analytics and fraud experience you would provide consultation support and take part in ideation and solutioning of fraud problems.

column5: >Leads or consults in ideation and solutioning of immediate threats as well as proactive mitigation of more complex strategies
>Reviews fraud attacks to understand and address coverage gaps across fraud portfolios
>Leads defect analysis to identify and remediate coverage gaps across fraud portfolios
>Provides insights and support decision-making at the executive level
>Uncovers and resolves process gaps throughout the bank, helping inform the departmental priorities
>Supports project intent and ongoing partner projects, leveraging fraud expertise to help develop resilient products and processes
>Ensures fraud requirements were reliably delivered within project IT releases across the bank

column1: Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:

column5: >Ability to effectively manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
>Detail oriented, tech-savvy, and proficient working with big data
>Ability to quickly and independently structure and deliver on new problems not previously tackled by the bank
>Demonstrated analytical, modeling and problem solving skills
>Conceptual thinker, ability to wade through data and arrive at conclusions
>Ability to communicate strategy analysis to both technical and non-technical team members, either verbally or via documentation
>Ability to take initiative and work independently under tight timelines
>Strong interpersonal and leadership skills and comfort in interacting with all levels of management
>Advanced in Python and SQL and possesses working knowledge in PySpark for data analysis and/or reporting
>Demonstrated experience with various fraud engines (e.g., TSYS CardGuard, ADS, Cardinal and VRM)

column1:
Our Values
At TD we’re guided by our purpose is to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues, and share a set of values that shape our culture and guide our behavior. In exchange for how our colleagues show up to help TD succeed, we are committed to delivering a colleague experience grounded in Impact, Growth and a Culture of Care. No matter where you work across TD, we empower you to make an impact at work and in your community, explore and grow your career and be part of our caring and inclusive culture.

Making Your Well-being a Priority
A supportive culture that promotes colleague well-being is core to who we are. At TD, we focus on total well-being with extensive programs to help colleagues assess, manage, and improve their well-being across four core pillars — physical, financial, social and mental/emotional. In addition, we champion a safe and inclusive work environment so colleagues feel a sense of belonging and feel supported in their personal and professional growth. Through our focus on well-being, we know that we can help our colleagues thrive, contribute to our culture of care, and support better business outcomes, because when colleagues feel their best, they’re more likely to do their best.

Our Total Rewards Package
Our Total Rewards package reflects the investment we make in our colleagues to help them, and their families achieve their well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes a base salary, variable compensation, and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits including medical, dental, vision & mental health coverage, savings and retirement programs, paid time off, banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition programs.

How We Work
At TD, we believe in-person connections fuel collaboration and collective creativity. Our workplace experience empowers colleagues to do great work side-by-side at TD locations, while offering flexibility to work remotely where it makes sense for the work and team. Our teams work in one of three workplace models: Hybrid, Onsite and Primarily Remote. Wherever our colleagues are working, they’ll always have access to the TD community and experience our culture of care.

Who We Are
TD is one of the world’s leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues.
TD is deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you’ve got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we’re here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing – and so will you.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
At TD, we’re committed to fostering an environment where all colleagues are encouraged to bring their authentic selves to work, experience equitable opportunities, and feel respected and supported. We’re dedicated to building an inclusive workforce that reflects the diversity of the customers and the communities in which we live and serve.

Accommodation
Your accessibility is important to us. Please let us know if you’d like accommodations (including accessible meeting rooms, captioning for virtual interviews, etc.) to help us remove barriers so that you can participate throughout the interview process.

How We’re Helping Make an Impact in Communities
TD has a long-standing commitment to help drive progress towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. That’s why we launched the TD Ready Commitment in 2018, now a multi-year North American initiative. Under the TD Ready Commitment, we are targeting a total of $1 billion by 2030 in community giving four key, interconnected drivers of change: Financial Security, Vibrant Planet, Connected Communities, and Better Health. It’s our goal to help support change, nurture progress, and contribute to making the world a better, more inclusive place for our customers, colleagues, and communities.
We look forward to hearing from you!

column3: >relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

column1: At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

The Decision Science team is a central hub of data science expertise within Personal and Business Banking, and is leading the way in applying the best practices in predictive science, machine learning, leveraging massive datasets and the latest in big data technology platforms to truly revolutionize personalization to drive client experience. The Senior Data Scientist ensures that sound analytical methods and processes are followed and predictive models are built on sound data samples. As a Senior Data Scientist you will apply your knowledge and experience of data modelling to solve a wide range of challenging business problems and bring innovative solutions. This position pro-actively contributes to the portfolio management function in the area of model design, model building, model governance and model performance monitoring and other analysis to help optimize the effectiveness and profitability of projects, marketing campaigns, pricing, optimization, contracts and other business decisions across our products. You’ll interact with groups across the organization from Products, Segments, Marketing to Channels and Risk. You will work with structured and unstructured data to produce end-to-end solutions, taking models from experiment to deployment.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

Data Science Expertise: Provide advanced analytics solutions to solve business problems by leveraging traditional statistical, machine learning and optimization techniques. Ability to conduct self-directed research, typically using non-traditional resources to solve business problems.

Modeler: Participate in model development by conducting detailed quantitative analysis work to support the model development. Support deploying statistics and machine learning models in development and production environments. Work closely with other senior modelers to facilitate effective dissemination of model related documents and model governance and model performance to business partners.

Business Consulting: Conduct business problem assessment independently. Gather relevant information related to business processes, functions and operations to evaluate data credibility and quality. Utilize creative thinking to modify or select the most suitable procedure/approach to solve a business problem. Perform in-depth analysis for the purpose of identifying revenue generation and cost saving opportunities, developing proposals and make recommendations for model usage to the downstream partners.

Market Relevancy: Participate in an analytics community whose goal is to foster and share analytic approaches across the enterprise. Liaise with internal and external sources, colleagues, and others to obtain, provide, verify and discuss information and best practices. Passionate innovators, creators, collaborators, and leaders who are up for the challenge of building the bank of the future and delivering solutions that meet our clients’ changing needs

You can demonstrate experience in working with large multivariate datasets including both structured and unstructured data and related tools (e.g., SQL, Spark). Must have experience coding in high level programming languages such as SAS, R or Python. Must have experience coding with data modelling packages in SAS EG and Enterprise Miner. Experience with MS Office and Tableau is an asset.

You’re a certified professional. You have current accreditation and a Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Physics, Economics or related quantitative field.
You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

• We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
• Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
<li>We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day
column2: a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

Supports the research and development of quantitative risk modeling methodologies and related strategies in support of the management of risks arising from business/group portfolios and products. Summarizes statistical findings, draws business conclusions, and presents actionable business recommendations used in the management of risks and related activities e.g. associated internal controls

column1: • Develops agreed analytical solution by applying suitable statistical techniques (e.g., A/B testing, prototype solutions, mathematical models, algorithms, machine learning, artificial intelligence) to test, verify, refine hypotheses.
• Summarizes statistical findings and draws conclusions and presents actionable business recommendations. Presents findings & recommendations in a simple, clear way to drive action.

    Qualifications:
