• Data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to Spotfire, Tableau, SQL, SAS, R, Python, MATLAB, SPSS.
• Relevant experience in risk, capital, and/or treasury management is preferred.
• A professional designation in Finance or Risk management is preferred.
• Professional designation in Finance or Risk management required.
• Deep knowledge and technical proficiency gained through extensive education and business experience.

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

column3:
>
About OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics

>At OTTO Motors, we believe material handling is one of the most dangerous and unproductive parts of modern industrial operations. Our mission is to create safer, more productive and fulfilling workplaces with autonomous material handling technology. Most recently, OTTO Motors was recognized among the top 1% of Canada’s highest-performing global private companies by Communitech. Our loyal customers are also the most recognizable brands in the world and trust OTTO Motors to fulfill their mission-critical material handling needs: General Electric, Toyota, Hershey, Caterpillar, Berry Global, and more. For more information about us, visit www.ottomotors.com.

column7: >The localization and mapping team’s primary responsibility is the development of the core robotics software responsible for environmental perception, mapping and localization on all our vehicles. You will be responsible for evaluating state-of-the-art ideas from academia and industry, and taking these ideas out of the lab and into the real world, identifying opportunities to improve, and developing high-performance software to run in real time on the robots. As part of the perception team you will continue to advance the cutting edge of robotics research through collaboration with our academic partners and contributions to research publications and open source initiatives.
>For the role of Perception Team Lead we are seeking an experienced developer and leader to drive the development of state-of-the-art localization and mapping solutions for real world applications.

>Monitor, analyze, and report on test results, identifying and documenting defects and anomalies using appropriate data, analysis and summary documentation

column3: >At Avidbots, we believe in solving real world problems with autonomous cleaning robotic solutions to unlock humanity’s potential. Neo is our current groundbreaking autonomous floor scrubbing robot that enhances facility cleanliness around the world empowering reallocation of human capital to higher priority focuses… and we’re just getting started!

>Headquartered in Kitchener, ON, Canada, we are an employee-focused organization that has been certified a Great Place to Work® consecutively for the last 4 years and one of Deloitte\'s Fast 500 (2021).
>Now is your opportunity to join a fast-growing technology company built on teamwork, innovation, and boundless ambition!
>***Applicants must be currently authorized to work in Canada for any employer

>CAD: Avidbots is an equal opportunity employer committed to building a diverse workforce. As a multicultural organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. We are a diverse Canadian company founded by international students, and we are proud of the strengths our diversity brings. We hold our executives to the same standards as all of our employees, and we believe work should be a safe space for all. Avidbots has an absolutely zero tolerance policy for discrimination or hate against members of any race, religion or sexual orientation. We also offer a professional working environment and culture and believe that work / life balance is critical to ensure the happiness/well-being of our people.

>
Upon request, Avidbots will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

column1: ea04a21c-abd7-4548-a9e9-9e7c3baccb77,257589081,RBC,Securities Data Analyst,on_site,"Toronto, ON, Canada",2023-08-10T01:51:01.893Z,"<div class=""jd-info au-target"">

Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

The Securities Data Services (SDS) group within RBC\'s Reference Data Service’s is responsible for the management of RBC Capital Markets’ central repositories of securities data. As a Data Analyst you will assist with providing reusable, authoritative, timely, comprehensive, and consistent securities reference data across the organization.

You will play a key role in the management of the organizations securities reference data repository. Success will be accomplished by providing reference data expertise throughout Capital Markets and the operational support of the Securities Reference Data Repository (SRDR) as well as other internal and external repositories.
• Provide front-line operational support for securities reference data
• Setup and maintain securities reference data for fixed income, equity, and equity derivative securities, including corporate actions, ensuring that data is accurate and timely
• Review/investigate data exceptions through the use of data query tools and remediate exceptions as necessary
• Assist in the implementation of process improvement and system enhancement initiatives by identifying opportunities for automation and by researching the root cause of data quality issues.
• Contribute to the department knowledge base by creating and updating documentation of supported processes
• Good knowledge of different financial product types (fixed income, equity, derivatives, currency, commodities)
• Advanced problem solving, analytical and decision-making skills
• Experience in developing successful and responsive relationships with a wide number of groups at various levels
<li>Good experience using MS Excel, MS Access, and Business Intelligence tools
column2: intermediate to advanced MS Excel skills.

column1: • Expected daily start time: 11AM Atlantic (10AM Eastern) but subject to change

• Relevant work experience in the use of reference data across different product types (fixed income, equity, derivatives, currency, commodities) within an established financial institution, investment bank or fund management organization
• Experience with the use of Bloomberg and Reuters Data (Corporate Actions, Reference Data)
• Experience with GoldenSource or any another enterprise data management system

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
• A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
• Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
• Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

column3: >

>Requisition ID: 182600

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

column1: Leads and oversees GBM Data Office, Global Banking and Markets, ensuring business strategies, plans and initiatives are executed / delivered in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies, and procedures.

Contributes to the overall success of the Data Office in ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the Bank’s Data Strategy. Works with Data Producers and Consumers to onboard new reusable datasets and implement, and monitor compliance against industry leading data governance practices and data management capabilities, in alignment with enterprise strategic priorities, business line priorities and regulatory requirements
.

• Collaborates with internal business and technology partners to on-board new datasets and to consume datasets from the GBM Data Platform.
  • Serves as an Onboarding Subject Matter Expert, directly contributing to the success of our partner’s priority business projects.
  • Champions a customer-focused culture to deepen client relationships and to ensure a seamless customer experience.
  • Support and ensure that our partners adhere to the Data Policy and Data Standards as it relates to the onboarding of new datasets for consumption.
  • Manages the end-to-end GBM Data Platform (Streaming and Batch Channels) Intake process on all new initiatives initiated by data producers and data consumers.
  • Ensure that required metadata is captured for each intake including the use case definitions for each consumer.
  • Work on audit and regulatory requests as required.
  • Collaborates with the data modelling team, IT development team and Enterprise Data Governance teams for successful capture and implementation of various data governance activities including metadata management, Source to Target Mapping, Asset Class Mapping, Scotia Sensitivity Data Element, Privacy Impact Assessment, etc.
  • Responsible for the continuous improvement of the existing intake process on the streaming channel of the data platform, identifies gaps to solve complex data issues.
  • Manages the documentation and maintenance of the Service Level Agreements and Data Sharing Agreement for the producers and consumers of the GBM Data Platform.
  • Responsible for establishing and monitoring the Data Access Controls.
  • Responsible for reporting data platform metrics to senior management
  • Responsible for monitoring the status of data intake project from the JIRA system, improving and automating the status report for senior management
  • Engages and consults with stakeholders across the entire life cycle of data publishing (IST->
column4:
Monitoring).
  • Arrange and conduct meetings and review on-boarding requirements with front, middle and back-office source system subject matter experts to ensure data management and lineage is recorded in the Data Governance Repository. An understanding of the Data Governance Repository will be required to support this work.
  • Planning skills to contribute and shape the required project plan to meet the needs of the consumers and project timelines based on the consumer’s requirements and anticipated steps to acquire data.

column1:
• Knowledge of data management processes and best practices
  • Proven delivery experience, Agile experience an asset
  • Knowledge of Scotiabank’s operations to understand and lead the implementation of strategic initiatives across a number of disciplines preferred
  • University Degree in Finance / Computer Science / Business / Mathematics
  • Proven data analytic skills using tools like Power BI / SQL / Python / Postman / ElasticSearch
  • Demonstrated ability to be flexible/ adaptable in exercising judgment in a changing environment and to manage competing priorities
  • Proven ability to learn business products and processes quickly and to work well with business partners at different levels within the organization
  • Three to five years of similar experience in a financial banking environment within the data governance discipline.
  • Experience with different data structures e.g. AVRO, JSON, and querying tools and techniques
  • Project Management experience is an asset
  • Must be results-oriented, and self-driven.
  • Nice to have a general understanding of Capital Market products
  • Nice to have experience with Atlassian tools, such as JIRA and Confluence
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to write clearly and concisely to convey a message
  • Strong interpersonal, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills

Description

column5:
>Perception Team Lead - Localization and Mapping
Location: Kitchener, Ontario
Job Type: Full-Time Permanent
Experience: 5-10 Years Relevant Work Experience
Education: Graduate Degree in a related field
Division: OTTO Motors

column3:
>
About OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics

>At OTTO Motors, we believe material handling is one of the most dangerous and unproductive parts of modern industrial operations. Our mission is to create safer, more productive and fulfilling workplaces with autonomous material handling technology. Most recently, OTTO Motors was recognized among the top 1% of Canada’s highest-performing global private companies by Communitech. Our loyal customers are also the most recognizable brands in the world and trust OTTO Motors to fulfill their mission-critical material handling needs: General Electric, Toyota, Hershey, Caterpillar, Berry Global, and more. For more information about us, visit www.ottomotors.com.

column10: > a driven, resourceful, motivated ca
column13: >ndidate for the Perception Team Lead position. This person will lead a team of developers to create and maintain the next generation of perception algorithms to tackle the toughest challenges in
column16: >localization and mapping, state estimation, computer vision and more.

column7: >The localization and mapping team’s primary responsibility is the development of the core robotics software responsible for environmental perception, mapping and localization on all our vehicles. You will be responsible for evaluating state-of-the-art ideas from academia and industry, and taking these ideas out of the lab and into the real world, identifying opportunities to improve, and developing high-performance software to run in real time on the robots. As part of the perception team you will continue to advance the cutting edge of robotics research through collaboration with our academic partners and contributions to research publications and open source initiatives.
>For the role of Perception Team Lead we are seeking an experienced developer and leader to drive the development of state-of-the-art localization and mapping solutions for real world applications.

column11: >Lead a team of exceptional perception developers to create robust innovative solutions to the problems of robotic perception
>Development of custom SLAM, localization, computer vision, and perception algorithms
>Evaluation of new algorithms and sensing technology
>Assisting with concept development for new products and projects
>Supporting deployment and testing of robotic systems
>Collaboration with internal teams including controls and navigation, as well as academic and industrial partners
>Stay up to the date with the latest developments from academia and industry
>Graduate degree in engineering/CS or a related field
>Practical and theoretical knowledge in at least one or more areas of: state estimation, computer vision, SLAM, localization, mapping, or sensor modeling.
>Strong software development skills in modern C++
>Understanding of software development workflows, life cycles and development methodologies and tools.
>Ability to independently develop software development plans, including scope, timelines, resource estimates, and test procedures.
>Hands-on experience with real world autonomous systems
>Familiarity with graph optimization techniques and libraries
>Understanding of sensor error modeling, particularly laser rangefinders and vision systems

column9: > kickstart your career than to do a co-op or internship with Scotiabank! During your work term, you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a winning team, build your network, and discover what you love – all while getting paid to do it! There’s a place for every type of student at Scotiabank and all that we ask for is that you have passion and strong AOO (Attitude, Ownership and Opportunity).

column6: >As part of the Global Capital Markets group, Global Analytics and Financial Engineering works closely with the trading and marketing groups to provide analytics, to help develop new product capability and are also involved with developing new business lines. The work is often structured as projects, and usually the projects are analytic, technological, or process-related in nature. The Co-op Analyst is required to focus on one or two specific product areas but can also be required to work on other business line initiatives as the priority changes in our dynamic trading environment.

>Financial Engineering is a friendly and supportive group working within an exciting environment. You will gain valuable knowledge of financial markets and instruments, while making substantial contributions to a large-scale trading operation. Previous co-op students have moved on to various positions within the organization following graduation There are opportunities within GAFE for students to work with the Interest Rate Derivatives, Credit Derivatives, Equity Derivatives and Commodity Derivatives business lines.

>Students hired for the semester will have access to numerous learning opportunities: a lecture series on the different business lines and how they work, access to the Global Banking and Markets Wiki where all models are documented, opportunities to talk to traders, marketers, and analysts to learn from their experiences.
>Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

column1: fdd49b96-86af-45b4-88e8-d502ced18177,266969885,Scotiabank,Global Banking and Markets - Global Equity Trading Developer - Fall 2024 - 12 month co-op/intern,on_site,Canada : Ontario : Toronto,2023-09-04T16:22:04.065Z,"<div class=""joblayouttoken rtltextaligneligible displayDTM""> <div class=""inner fontcolorb6a533a1"" style=""font-family:Arial , Helvetica , sans-serif
column3: >

>Requisition ID: 184247

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

column6: >There's no better way to find your dream job than to do a co-op or internship with Scotiabank! During your work term, you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a winning team, build your network, and discover what you love – all while getting paid to do it! There’s a place for every type of student at Scotiabank and all that we ask for is that you have passion and strong AOO (Attitude, Ownership and Opportunity).

>Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. We are powered by our 97,000 high-performing teammates who make a real difference across the globe as a leading provider of advice, products, digital experiences, and financial services.

>This is a place where you’ll get to learn and develop your skills, while being recognized for your hard work. At Scotiabank, we’re passionate about bringing our whole selves to work, allowing us to create inclusive work environments for everyone to enjoy.

>Global Banking & Markets provides a full range of investment banking, credit and risk management products and services relevant to the financing and strategic development needs of our clients. Our products include debt and equity financing, mergers & acquisitions, corporate banking, institutional equity sales, trading and research, fixed income products, derivatives, energy, foreign exchange and precious & metals. We also cross-sell the full range of wholesale products and services offered by the Scotiabank Group.

>Modern stock trading is increasingly a technology problem, as firms compete to build the fastest and smartest trading algorithms and systems. Scotiabank's Electronic Execution Services group develops customized algorithmic trading and smart order routing strategies with execute billions of dollars of equity trades each month. We work directly with the equity trading groups to give them the tools needed to compete in an evolving marketplace.

>Students are key members of our team. During your term, you will develop, manage, and run systems which are integral to our business, while also gaining a unique view into the workings of trading at one of Canada's largest investment banks. This internship is a great opportunity for anyone looking to launch their career in the FinTech space! Many of the full-time team members started in this position.

column1: 85e064a5-ed73-459c-b2a2-e936d6ceac0b,264447142,BenchSci,Sr ML Engineer - Research & NLP (Remote),full,"Toronto, Ontario   Remote",2023-08-28T16:27:01.920Z,"<div class=""section page-centered"">

column4: >to join our growing Core Machine Learning (CoreML) team. You will work on complex and challenging NLP problems that will have an impact on the 41,000+ scientists across the world who rely on BenchSci for their research.

column2: >Reporting to the Engineering Manager, ML, you’ll apply your domain expertise to build advanced machine learning algorithms, collaborate with data engineers to build benchmarking and data preparation pipelines, and core infrastructure engineers to deploy and monitor your models in our production system. In this role, you will have the opportunity to apply state-of-the-art solutions that will shape the future of scientific discovery.
>BenchSci is a remote first organization. At this moment, we are welcoming applicants from Canada, the US and the UK for this position.

column1: • Design, build, evaluate and deploy robust, scalable and production-ready ML models that enhance the speed and quality of life-saving research
• Run research-focused projects to invent new NLP/ML solutions
• Collaborate with data and core infrastructure engineers to solve the complex problems of extracting insights from biomedical text data
• Continuously improve our ML workflow by keeping up to date with the latest optimizations in libraries such as PyTorch, and expand our usage of modern tools such as DVC
• Drive design discussions, apply best practices, diagnose problems and lead the resolution
• Participate and contribute to sprint planning, estimation, and design/code reviews, advocating for innovative solutions and long-term technical investments that will drive innovation at BenchSci
• Work cross-functionally with different stakeholders including BenchSci's R&D scientists to learn, model, and capture the nuances of biology
• Provide guidance to engineers and help to foster a culture of continuous growth
• 4+ years of experience working as a professional developer applying ML techniques, with 2+ years in ML research
• Expertise in fundamentals of ML model training and designing, building and evaluating robust & scalable production-ready ML models
• Strong experience working with LLMs, Python and programming fundamentals, and NLP & PyTorch
• Experience with data manipulation and processing, such as SQL or pandas
• Demonstrated ability to solve complex problems with an eye for detail, such as scalability and performance of a potential solution

column1: BenchSci's mission is to exponentially increase the speed and quality of life-saving research and development. We empower scientists to run more successful experiments with the world's most advanced, biomedical artificial intelligence software platform.

Backed by Generation Investment Management, TCV, Inovia, F-Prime, Golden Ventures, and Google's AI fund, Gradient Ventures, we provide an indispensable tool for scientists that accelerates research at 16 top 20 pharmaceutical companies and over 4,300 leading academic centers. We're a certified Great Place to Work®, and top-ranked company on Glassdoor.

BenchSci relentlessly builds on its strong foundation of culture. We put team members first, knowing that they're the organization's beating heart. We invest as much in our people as our products. Our culture fosters transparency, collaboration, and continuous learning.

We value each other's differences and always look for opportunities to embed equity into the fabric of our work. We foster diversity, autonomy, and personal growth, and provide resources to support motivated self-leaders in continuous improvement.

You will work with high-impact, highly skilled, and intelligent experts motivated to drive impact and fulfill a meaningful mission. We empower you to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and thrive. Here you will be challenged to stretch yourself to achieve the seemingly impossible. Learn more about our culture.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: We're committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. We believe that improving diversity, equity and inclusion is our collective responsibility, and this belief guides our DEI journey. Learn more about our DEI initiatives.
Accessibility Accommodations: Should you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs. Please reach out to talent@benchsci.com.

Reporting to the Manager, Compliance Analytics, the Data Analyst is responsible for supporting Compliance with a variety of analytics initiatives. These responsibilities include reviewing large quantities of data for a variety of compliance functions, developing enhanced reporting, automation of various processes and performing various investigative and analytical functions.
• Work with Compliance PMO to develop compliance metrics and dashboards to support effective oversight of business operations’ compliance with regulatory requirements and improved risk management.
• Undertake projects that relate to Compliance, Analytics and Technology
• Design, develop and implement business requests and analytical solutions using technologies such as Excel, SQL and Tableau.
• Build automations in Excel and/or other tools to support business needs.
• Performing exploratory data analysis using statistical models over platforms like Tableau Prep, Python, AWS.
• Produces specialized reports and data extracts for assigned business areas while demonstrating solid understanding of business objectives.
• Maintain and generate the reports and ensures the accuracy of the information.
• Produce technical and user documentation to support create tools and dashboards
• Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent experience.
• At least 2 years of experience in data analytics.
• At least 2 years experience with software packages like VBA, SQL, Python, Tableau Prep
• Experienced in developing visualizations over tools like Tableau.
• Experience with ETL processes, data management, and process improvement.
• Excellent programming skills with a keen aptitude for learning new programming languages and analytics tools.
• Ability to work independently as well as in a team.
• Excellent oral, written and interpersonal communication skills
• Working knowledge over cloud platforms like AWS
• Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
• Entitlement to flexible benefits, pension and 3 weeks vacation.
• Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets

column5: >The TDBG Global AML Compliance Department is accountable for establishing TDBG’s Global Anti-Money Laundering and Anti-Terrorist Financing Program (AML/ATF) to ensure that all TDBG businesses remain compliant with AML/ATF regulatory expectations in all jurisdictions where TDBG operates. This includes setting consistent standards across business segments that maybe further tailored to specific business or jurisdictional requirements
column6: conducting annual enterprise-wide AML risk assessments
column7: maintaining the Global AML Policy (including Know Your Customer and Enhanced Due Diligence, record keeping & retention requirements)
column8: currency transaction and suspicious transaction monitoring and reporting
column9: screening TDBG customers against regulatory watch lists (i.e., Name Matching)
column10: a hierarchy of designated AML officer functions
column11: enterprise-wide and specialized AML training of employees

column5: >Reporting to the Senior Advanced Analytics Manager, the Data Scientist II will be conducting all analytical activities related to AML transaction monitoring systems.

column6: >Work independently as a senior lead and may manage and direct activities related to analysis, design and support of technical data management solutions on various projects ranging in complexity and size
>Provide maintenance of transaction monitoring scenarios, and analytical queries in support of the bank’s strategic efforts to mitigate money laundering and terrorist financing risk
>Conduct activities related to AML/ATF scenario performance tuning, machine learning execution and model performance monitoring
>Help maintain a structured documentation process to demonstrate an effective scenario review program to satisfy audit, compliance, and regulatory requirements
>With assistance from management, assist with transaction monitoring related issues/questions from Global AML members, audit, and other partners
>Analytical thought leadership and staying ahead of developments in data mining and the application of data science
>Partner with GAML teams to implement changes to existing solutions and/or the implementation of alternative solutions and serve as an ambassador for data science
>Use statistical and machine learning techniques to build and maintain effective and efficient transaction monitoring, customer behavior, and risk scoring models

column5: >• Provide insight into leading analytic practices, designs and leads iterative learning and development cycles, and ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions that will become core work you’re doing

column6: >Enterprise or functional expert, requiring broad managerial and deep specialized knowledge at the enterprise, business, regulatory and industry levels
>Work with various business teams to help identify areas for improvement and provide insights using supporting data and models to support business strategies.
>Master’s degree or higher in Statistics, Computer Science/Software Engineering, PHD Preferred
>Expert knowledge of Python, SAS, SQL, and R are essential. Others such as Java, Scala, tableau etc would be plus.
>Expert data explorations and analysis skills.
>Extensive work experience building predictive models with machine learning methods.
>Ability to apply statistical techniques and data mining tools to solve business problem.
>3- 5 years of experience in analytics environments.
>Experience in query optimization, debugging and automation.
>Excellent written and oral communication, analytical and presentation skills, including ability to communicate with individuals from various backgrounds.
>Excellent multi-tasking skills: ability to adapt to and manage changing priorities
>Experience with working with direct and indirect reports and ability to collaborate with various teams to provide business insights and to inform business strategies.
>AML knowledge and experience on data-driven or data-centered projects would be an asset.

column1:
Our Values
At TD we’re guided by our purpose is to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues, and share a set of values that shape our culture and guide our behavior. In exchange for how our colleagues show up to help TD succeed, we are committed to delivering a colleague experience grounded in Impact, Growth and a Culture of Care. No matter where you work across TD, we empower you to make an impact at work and in your community, explore and grow your career and be part of our caring and inclusive culture.

Making Your Well-being a Priority
A caring and supportive culture that promotes colleague well-being is core to who we are. At TD, we focus on total well-being with extensive programs to help colleagues assess, manage, and improve their well-being across four core pillars — physical, financial, social and mental/emotional. In addition, we champion a safe, inclusive and supportive work environment to help colleagues feel a sense of belonging, and supported in their personal and professional growth. Through our focus on total well-being, we know that we can help our colleagues thrive, contribute to our culture of care, and support better business outcomes … because when colleagues feel their best, they’re more likely to do their best.

Our Total Rewards Package
Our Total Rewards package reflects the investment we make in our colleagues to help them, and their families achieve their well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes a base salary, variable compensation, and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits including medical, dental, vision & mental health coverage, savings and retirement programs, paid time off, banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition programs.

How We Work
At TD, we believe in-person connections fuel collaboration and collective creativity. Our workplace experience empowers colleagues to do great work side-by-side at TD locations, while offering flexibility to work remotely where it makes sense for the work and team. Our teams work in one of three workplace models: hybrid, onsite and primarily remote. Wherever our colleagues are working, they’ll always have access to the TD community and experience our culture of care.

Who We Are
TD is one of the world’s leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues. TD is a customer obsessed organization, and we are deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you’ve got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we’re here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing – and so will you.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
At TD, we’re committed to fostering an environment where all colleagues are encouraged to bring their authentic selves to work, experience equitable opportunities, and feel respected and supported. We’re dedicated to building an inclusive workforce that reflects the diversity of the customers and the communities in which we live and serve.

How We’re Helping Make an Impact in Communities
TD has a long-standing commitment to help drive progress towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. That’s why we launched the TD Ready Commitment in 2018, now a multi-year North American initiative. Under the TD Ready Commitment, we are targeting a total of $1 billion by 2030 in community giving four key, interconnected drivers of change: Financial Security, Vibrant Planet, Connected Communities, and Better Health. It’s our goal to help support change, nurture progress, and contribute to making the world a better, more inclusive place for our customers, colleagues, and communities.

Accommodation
Your accessibility is important to us. Please let us know if you’d like accommodations (including accessible meeting rooms, captioning for virtual interviews, etc.) to help us remove barriers so that you can participate throughout the interview process.
We look forward to hearing from you!

The Enterprise Protect is an enterprise-level body that strives to protect TD Bank Group customers, shareholders and employees from financial crimes and fraud. Aligned with TD strategy and risk appetite, Enterprise Protect develops and evolves enterprise policies, advanced analytics capabilities and operational processes to improve governance, oversight, and collaboration between fraud management and other control functions within the Bank.
• Accountable for creating, running and ensuring accuracy/quality of reports for CFO
• Are a subject matter expert on the end-to-end operational process
• Recommend team’s workload and ad-hoc requests to address internal and external requests
• Produce timely diagnostics to identify system and operational issues
• Think forward and provide early gap recommendation
• Help support change socialization and process adherence for new reporting
• Act as SME to provide project team support to deliver on reporting requirements
• Support the continuous improvement agenda for our operational partners
• Maintain strong relationships with internal stakeholders such as Fraud Operations, Internal Business Partners, Vendor Managers etc.
• Act as a subject matter expert and represents the team or bank at project meetings or industry forums
• Undergraduate degree from a technical domain preferably from a STEM program
• 2+ years’ experience in an analytical/reporting capacity
• Working knowledge of Python, SQL, relational databasing and data warehousing
• Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (Power Query, Power Pivot, DAX) required to support data models and analytics
• Automation experience to replace complicated processes with end-to-end solutions
• Ability to quickly and independently structure and deliver on new problems not previous tackled by the bank
• Creative, Critical, Conceptual thinker, ability to wade through data and arrive at conclusions
• Ability to communicate strategy analysis to both technical and non-technical team members, either verbally or via documentation
• Ability to take initiative and work independently under tight timelines
• Ability to work collaboratively and build relationships
• Ability to effectively manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously
• Motivated to constantly strive to find innovative ways to enhance capabilities
• Knowledge of machine learning is an asset
• Experience with platforms like TSYS, PRM, Cardinal Commerce is an asset
• Hands-on proficient experience with visualization tools (particularly Tableau) is considered a major asset

Reporting to the Principal Architect, Sunlife International, the Engineering Lead is responsible for strategic delivery for IT initiatives for key Sun Life International projects. In doing this, the Engineering Lead will help bring Sun Life International and Sun Life Singapore’s IT strategy to life. The focus will be primarily on necessary data migration efforts already underway and realizing a target state architecture.

In accomplishing these objectives, this role will encompass all aspects of IT architecture, migration management which will include troubleshooting with technical team assistance, technical solution designing and accurate breakdowns of highly complex projects. The role requires a strategic thinker who has a diligent work ethic, who can make clear and concise presentations that explain technical terms in an easy to understand manner, who will ensure business partner relationships are excellent while collaborating across teams to organize this function and engage others in the journey.

distributors, and offer efficient platform for customer interaction and transactions

and application strategy and align High Net worth technology architecture.

• Full stack knowledge with ability to communicate well, translate business logic to technical requirements

Data and analytics are central to SunLife’s strategic priorities and purpose – critical enablers in our push to transform our business and drive market differentiating client experience and growth. The Chief Data & Analytics Office is an entrepreneurial team leading Sun Life Canada’s utilization of data as a strategic asset. We are fixated on delivering value to our clients & business, transforming our business, and evolving the capabilities & impact of our data & analytics programs.

Reporting to the Chief Data & Analytics Officer, the Assistant Vice President (AVP) Data Science CoE will lead a team responsible for delivering AI/ML solutions to create client and business value in support of Sun Life’s strategic purpose. This leader will champion AI/ML across our business, engaging our exec team and business community, leading the realization of AI/ML as a transformational force. In the role, the AVP will drive identification and prioritization of opportunities
column2: oversee strategy, drive execution and measurement of impact, and manage the lifecycle of existing assets.

column1: The team focuses on the application of AI/ML in 3 key areas:
• Generative AI Program – building upon several experiments in the GenAI space, standing up a program to focus our efforts leveraging Generative AI across the Canadian business.

• ‘One Sun’ initiatives – delivering solutions to support cross-business priorities, with a primary emphasis on understanding client behaviour and leveraging insights to support a unified client experience and client engagement.

• Enabling specific business unit priorities – partner with business units to deliver solutions in support of their key priorities such as lead assignment, sales enablement & optimization, pricing and underwriting
• You are a strong people leader with deep experience attracting, engaging, and retaining data science talent.
• Passionate about building a world class, high performing data science team that is obsessed with driving client & business outcomes.
• You bring a combination of savvy, strategic mindset & delivery excellence. You are a thought leader that empowers others, encourages creativity and continuous improvement.

• Great communicator & relationship builder – you connect the dots and identify opportunities to collaborate and leverage AI & ML to support our purpose, drive client outcomes and deliver business value.
• Business Partner – you bring strong business acumen, understanding & empathy necessary to uncover the art of the possible & pragmatic to build and implement solutions in partnership.

• Executive savvy & change champion - You have experience navigating complex, matrixed organizations, leading with influence and driving change. Your gravitas inspires confidence in your ability to drive change
• Technology collaborator – you build close partnership with technology teams and deliver in a CI/CD manner
Demonstrated execution excellence delivering applied Machine Learning
• Drive execution excellence in AI/ML projects, ensuring they are completed on time and within budget.
• Implement best practices and agile methodologies to optimize project execution and delivery.

• New Build – You pragmatically take a problem to outcome, coordinating the build and design of AI & ML solutions at scale. You ensure model are robust, accurate, and scalable for real-world applications You have experience navigating regulatory and risk management practices common in financial institutions.

• Solution Sherpa – you coach and guide your team & our partners through the development of innovative solutions, empowering the team, while being willing and capable to get into the weeds if necessary. Your hands on experience commands respect from your team
• Innovator – you foster a culture of innovation and experimentation to identify new opportunities for AI/ML applications. You stay at the forefront of AI/ML trends and research to drive innovation

• Model Management – you manage a complex roster of models & address the complexities of model lifecycle management across legacy analytical platforms. You Implement rigorous quality assurance processes to ensure the reliability and safety of AI/ML systems. You establish measurement and monitoring systems to track the performance of AI/ML solutions. You Implement continuous improvement processes based on data-driven insights.

• Outcome obsession – you are fixated on driving impact, have demonstrated the enormous power and potential brought by AI & ML, and have implemented value driven prioritization & post facto measurement
• Vendor and Partner Management - Evaluate and manage third-party vendors and partnerships for AI/ML solutions.
• You have 10+ years of hands on data science/advanced analytics experience, 5+ years in people leadership.
• Proven track record delivering in large organizations, insurance & financial services experience will be an asset but not required.
• Experience in leading high performing teams and professional knowledge workers.
• Advanced degree in quantitative field or business (MBA) is an asset.
Reasons why should you join us under the sun
• We’re honoured to be recognized as a 2023 Best Workplaces in Ontario by Great Place to Work® Canada
• We’re proud to be recognized as a company with a 2023 Most Trusted Executive team by Great Place to Work® Canada
• Sun Life ranked one of the 2023 Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations in the World on the
• Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets
• Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family.
• Wellness programs that support the three pillars of your health – mental, physical, and financial

In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

column1: 628d98c0-3a2c-4ff6-a2fb-6aaad214efa5,291845873,Sun Life Financial,Capacity Planning Analyst,on_site,"Ontario, Canada",2023-11-30T12:29:02.509Z,"<div class=""css-1irs9pi"">

You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

At Sun Life, we work together, share common values and encourage growth and achievement. We offer many career paths that attract a wide variety of talent and skills. Follow a path that lets your talents shine.
Are you someone who is passionate about data, with superior analytical skills?

We are looking for someone to work with operational partners to plan optimal resourcing. In this role, you will use projected work volumes and staffing data to create a future-looking plan to address the staffing needs of different business units. You will be in frequent contact with those business units, working with them to update the plan, optimize based on several business constraints, analyze the impact of internal and external factors, and provide recommendations on potential solutions. Your work will drive operational decision-making about staffing levels. The role requires creative problem-solving, teamwork, excellent communication and presentation skills, a willingness to try new techniques, and the ability to handle several diverse and concurrent projects.
• Create, maintain, and update capacity plans including timing of hiring and analysis on attrition, shrinkage and other factors impacting capacity
• Support operations in planning of vacations, training, and other events
• Support the creation of an annual staffing budget forecast
• Collect, manipulate, and analyze data related to capacity, supply, and demand
• Gather information from operations on project impacts and other factors that could impact planning or work volumes
• Calculate optimal staffing levels based on forecasts, capacity models, and business constraints
• Measure, assess and communicate variations from plan, including analysis of the cause and impact to KPIs of those differences
• Support the balance of staffing needs across different business units
• Work within a team to provide analysis, insights and recommendations to senior business leaders to help them recognize areas of opportunity and drive evidence-based operational decisions
• Work with forecasters, schedulers, and intraday analysts to refine plans and ensure continuity of resourcing
• Provide project teams with process recommendations, workload/staffing forecasts and costs as required to support changes
• Look for ways to innovate and improve processes in a Continuous Improvement environment
• Bachelor degree (minimum) in Statistics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Mathematics, Econometrics, or equivalent experience
• Experience analyzing and modeling business process data
• Demonstrated experience working with data, including transformation, manipulation, forecasting, and statistical modeling
• Demonstrated success working collaboratively within a team to produce results
• Ability to effectively visualize and present complex data adapted to a variety of audiences to support decision-making
• Demonstrated ability to produce and communicate meaningful results from data
• Ability to build partnerships, work collaboratively, and develop relationships with a variety of stakeholders
• Demonstrated ability to turn forecast volumes into capacity models
• Utilizing large databases with complex relationships between tables
• Supporting Call Centres, Back-end Support teams along with relevant data
• The candidate selected for this role is required to attain Canadian Reliability Security Clearance (administered by submitting fingerprints to the RCMP, who then conduct min. 5 year history checks)
To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the section 201 on the Federal Government site (

column1: 2ade5a05-e69a-4ba2-a5a6-4b18d0e748cd,290389857,BMO Financial Group,"Manager, Business Analytics",on_site,"Ontario, Canada",2023-11-23T12:19:02.044Z,"<div class=""css-156jxiv"">

To provide analytics and information to senior management to enhance their ability to make fully informed business decisions. Through a deep understanding of the business and its environment, provide integrated measurement and analysis of performance across all TPS products. Link product and client analytics to financial results, develop and track key metrics, prepare monthly performance review decks and coordinate board-level reports and initiative tracking. Provide oversight and guidance to the planning process across lines of business, Product, Sales and Finance partners. Participate in cross-product projects and represent the group in inter-LOB initiatives. Act as a subject matter expert on accounting-related issues and drive annual TSA update activities.

Understands and articulates the business case of business questions and the estimated value being delivered. Designs dashboards and analyses to be performed, and appropriate visualization and analytics tools to use. Identifies trends and patterns to address identified business questions and provide insights through reporting and data visualization techniques. Works with other data and analytics professionals to optimize, refine, automate and scale analysis into repeatable analytics solutions and decision support tools.
• Builds various reporting dashboards using the most appropriate data extraction, data cleaning and data visualization techniques.
• Provides value through insights, reporting and data visualization techniques. Selects, configures and implements analytics solutions for consistency and repeatability.
• Researches and applies continuous improvement in data visualization by identifying trends and patterns to transform raw data into actionable business insights.
• Works with different teams, management and stakeholders to enhance the usability and aesthetic appeal of data analytics solutions deployed in the organization.
• Translates business needs to technical specifications and evaluates existing data visualization systems in order to improve them.
• Develops data visualizations of ""large"" amounts of data that facilitate the intuitive presentation of data to decision makers.
• Documents data flow, systems and processes to improve the design, implementation and management of business/group processes.
<li>Develops tools and delivers training programs for use of reporting tools and self-serve analytics by non-analytical end users
column2: may include delivery of training to audiences.

column1: <li>Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO
• Provides specialized consulting, analytical and technical support.
• Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
• Works independently and regularly handles non-routine situations.
• Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
• Typically between 5 - 7 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
• 3-5 years finance related experience, with thorough understanding of financial concepts and terminology
• Deep knowledge and technical proficiency gained through extensive education and business experience.

column2: >At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

>As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
>To find out more visit us at <a rel=""noopener noreferrer nofollow"" target=""_blank"" href=""https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en""><span class=""WAP2""><span style=""display:inline

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

>Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

column1: 39b775c6-a0b5-4a24-9e7a-e9e9e48196b0,291845869,Accenture,"Manager, Customer Analytics and Personalization",on_site,"Toronto, ON, Canada",2023-11-30T12:27:01.905Z,"<div id=""joblistingdetail-63d2c3433a"" class=""cmp-job-listing-details__container"">  <div class=""cmp-job-listing-details__desc-block"">    <div class=""cmp-job-listing-details__title"">      <div class=""title cmp-title--subsection"">

WHO WE ARE:

Accenture Song accelerates growth and value for our clients through sustained customer relevance. Our capabilities span ideation to execution: growth, product and experience design
column4: and campaign, content and channel orchestration. With strong client relationships and deep industry expertise, we help our clients operate at the speed of life through the unlimited potential of imagination, technology and intelligence. Visit us at: www.accenture.com/song

column1: There will never be a typical day at Accenture Song, but that’s why people love it here. The opportunities to make a difference while working on exciting client initiatives are limitless in this ever-changing space. Here’s a snapshot of your responsibilities:

• Lead teams that will perform assessments, develop strategies, and deliver roadmaps to help clients understand their current customer analytics capabilities and opportunities.

  • Lead teams and manage clients through the deployment of customer analytics platforms (i.e. Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Tealium, Braze, etc.) across digital properties including mobile web and apps.

  • Develop measurement strategies that tie organizational objectives to digital measurement solutions and communicate the value of solutions to a senior client audience.

  • Manage the strategic deployment tagging for digital analytics, paid media, and 3rd party applications.

  • Support business development and solutioning (i.e. proposal writing, RFP responses, etc.)

  • Help businesses evolve organizational processes to better leverage data and insights.
show more show less
5+ years of experience in digital marketing and customer analytics.
5+ years of experience using, implementating, and managing the collection and activation of data across systems.
Proven ability to bring a strategic mindset and deep thinking across sales and delivery.
Experience with digital analytics, CDP, and tag management solutions and the differences between providers (ex: Adobe, SFMC, Google, Tealium, Segment, etc.)
Experience performing advanced analytics on digital data sources (e.g., digital analytics data, digital advertising data, audience data, social data, search data, etc.)
Experience with test and learn strategies, configuring optimization tools and deploying testing programs for campaigns and brand experiences.

English is required for this position as this role will regularly interact with stakeholders across Canada, US and other countries across our Global footprint where English is the common language. Due to the significant high volume of interactions with these English-speaking stakeholders, which is inherent to this position, it is not possible to reorganize the company\'s activities to avoid this requirement.
Ability to communicate measurement and data-oriented business objectives to a senior audience.
Technical understanding of how digital analytics and tag management solutions are deployed.
Ability to manage deployments and strategically advise on future data collection and measurement solutions.
Passionate about data, analytics and technology (ex: avid consumer of TED talks and Wired Magazine).
Experience with client-facing projects ideally in consulting, agency or other business-related services.
Experience helping organizations with data strategy and architecture for marketing activation.
Experience with media mix and attribution programs.
Experience developing reporting and advancing data visualization capabilities with new or existing tools (e.g. Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, etc.)
Experience with data and analytic tools such as such as SQL, Excel-pivot tables, SAS, UNIX.
Solid Knowledge of data integration techniques and processes (Data matching & key vendors, data fusion & key partners, etc.)
Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment.
Desire to work in an information systems environment.
Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills.
Ability to take complex solutions and make them simple to explain and digest.

Compensation at Accenture varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by local law, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation, based on full-time employment, for roles that may be hired in British Columbia as set forth below.
Information on benefits is here.
Alberta - Calgary, British Columbia - Vancouver, Ontario - Ottawa, Ontario - Toronto, Quebec - Montreal

At Accenture, inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and embedded in our core values. We are committed to creating a workforce where our people can feel comfortable, be themselves and contribute. Like Canada itself, Accenture employees represent a tremendous variety of cultures, ethnicities, beliefs, backgrounds and languages. We offer an inclusive environment regardless of personal characteristics such as ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age or disability.

Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired.

If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email or speak with your recruiter.

It is currently our objective to assign our people to work near where they live. However, given the nature of our business and our need to serve clients, our employees must be available to travel when needed.
Job candidates are not required to disclose any offence for which a pardon has been granted.

4e9dd1aa-5962-41fe-a4ba-7d88e2db1bf7,303712458,TD Bank Group,Manager BI & Reporting II,on_site,"Toronto, ON",2024-02-01T16:28:01.905Z,"<div class=""jobdetail-desc"" id=""gtm-jobdetail-desc"">

We’re committed to providing fair and equitable compensation to all our colleagues. As a candidate, we encourage you to have an open dialogue with your recruiter and ask compensation related questions, including pay details for this role.

What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and this includes our vast data.

The Business Intelligence group delves into our data, past and present, to develop crucial metrics and reporting functionality that better informs and optimizes key businesses decisions across the organization.
This is the team building the tools, reports, dashboards, cubes and scorecards that deliver and process vital data to business partners across the enterprise.
Joining us in Business Intelligence & Reporting is an opportunity to advance and deepen your career and to help TD serve its customers in a way we never have before.

Data is something you’re passionate about. So much so that you’re able to seamlessly transform your technical understanding into easy-to-digest reports and communications that your team shares with business owners across the organization. Most importantly, your coaching and leadership inspires leadership in others, driving them to execute with speed, and collaborate with one goal in mind: make TD the better bank.

Sound good so far? Fantastic! We are looking for an experienced people manager and authority to lead a large, diverse and inclusive team who work with various areas of business throughout the organization. Together, you’ll help build complex reporting and business intelligence reports and solutions to help better inform key business decisions and instill industry gold standard methodologies.
As Manager II, Business Intelligence & Reporting, you will:
• Lead and execute data/business analysis using various internal data sources to support the understanding of customers, business drivers and financial results
• Support all relevant projects and initiatives to ensure project data and reporting requirements are met
• Work in a consultative role to provide valuable insights in the form of analysis, interpretation and, advice
• Liaise with business partners to conduct effective discussions on project requirements, data specifications, priority and timeline to ensure timely and accurate deliveries
• Create and maintain detailed documentation on all projects/requests
• Ensure all projects are delivered according to department standards and guidelines
• Manage and resource pipelines to ensure projects and initiatives are completed on time/within budget within priority order (as set by regulatory deadlines, business strategy, etc.)
• Manage relationships with key partners to ensure advance notification of upcoming projects, data requests and more
• Manage resource capacity and maintain a pool of technical specialists to work on data and reporting projects
• Lead and manage a sizeable team of Analyst professionals and overall operation of a diverse group in an area of moderate risk, complexity or scope
• Ensure an integrated approach with other business management areas, broader organization, and enterprise as appropriate
• Deep knowledge and understanding of businesses / technology, and organizational practices/ disciplines
• Sound to advanced knowledge of external competition, industry and/or market trends in relation to own function / business
What can you bring to TD? Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:
• People Management experience will be considered as an asset.

Our Values
At TD we’re guided by our purpose is to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues, and share a set of values that shape our culture and guide our behavior. In exchange for how our colleagues show up to help TD succeed, we are committed to delivering a colleague experience grounded in Impact, Growth and a Culture of Care. No matter where you work across TD, we empower you to make an impact at work and in your community, explore and grow your career and be part of our caring and inclusive culture.

Making Your Well-being a Priority
A caring and supportive culture that promotes colleague well-being is core to who we are. At TD, we focus on total well-being with extensive programs to help colleagues assess, manage, and improve their well-being across four core pillars — physical, financial, social and mental/emotional. In addition, we champion a safe, inclusive and supportive work environment to help colleagues feel a sense of belonging, and supported in their personal and professional growth. Through our focus on total well-being, we know that we can help our colleagues thrive, contribute to our culture of care, and support better business outcomes … because when colleagues feel their best, they’re more likely to do their best.

Our Total Rewards Package
Our Total Rewards package reflects the investment we make in our colleagues to help them, and their families achieve their well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes a base salary, variable compensation, and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits including medical, dental, vision & mental health coverage, savings and retirement programs, paid time off, banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition programs.

How We Work
At TD, we believe in-person connections fuel collaboration and collective creativity. Our workplace experience empowers colleagues to do great work side-by-side at TD locations, while offering flexibility to work remotely where it makes sense for the work and team. Our teams work in one of three workplace models: hybrid, onsite and primarily remote. Wherever our colleagues are working, they’ll always have access to the TD community and experience our culture of care.

Who We Are
TD is one of the world’s leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues. TD is a customer obsessed organization, and we are deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you’ve got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we’re here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing – and so will you.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
At TD, we’re committed to fostering an environment where all colleagues are encouraged to bring their authentic selves to work, experience equitable opportunities, and feel respected and supported. We’re dedicated to building an inclusive workforce that reflects the diversity of the customers and the communities in which we live and serve.

How We’re Helping Make an Impact in Communities
TD has a long-standing commitment to help drive progress towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. That’s why we launched the TD Ready Commitment in 2018, now a multi-year North American initiative. Under the TD Ready Commitment, we are targeting a total of $1 billion by 2030 in community giving four key, interconnected drivers of change: Financial Security, Vibrant Planet, Connected Communities, and Better Health. It’s our goal to help support change, nurture progress, and contribute to making the world a better, more inclusive place for our customers, colleagues, and communities.

Accommodation
Your accessibility is important to us. Please let us know if you’d like accommodations (including accessible meeting rooms, captioning for virtual interviews, etc.) to help us remove barriers so that you can participate throughout the interview process.
We look forward to hearing from you!
c423fa42-52a5-40e6-b661-ef7b4d88f572,303083873,Sun Life Financial,Senior Data Analyst,on_site,"Ontario, Canada",2024-01-29T06:44:01.983Z,"<div class=""css-1irs9pi"">

You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.
Do you have a passion for data and solving complex business problems? Do you like making an impact on the business around you? If so, our Senior Data Analyst role is the right fit for you!

The Growth and Performance Marketing team within Sun Life’s Client Experience Office (CXO) has embarked on a major transformation. As part of this transformation, we are continuously launching and testing new ideas, platforms, and solutions to generate new leads and identify opportunities for existing clients and group members.

As a senior data analyst on the Client Acquisition Analytics team, you will be part of a large analytics community and will be focused within the Growth and Performance Marketing business helping the team by, but not limited to, mining data for business insights, analyzing and interpreting trends using statistical tools and techniques, reporting on business performance, and triaging code and data-related issues.

You will be supporting several key initiatives that are tied to our vision of growing our client base, improving advisor lead conversion, supporting the Head Office lead Evolution program, monitoring of our key performance indicators and championing the Retail Leads Data Modernization.

To achieve this, we will be leveraging many systems across Sun Life, gathering requirements, engaging with subject matter experts, and creating reporting. All of this is to be able to tell the story of our clients’ journeys and gather insights to improve their experience.
• Work closely with business partners to identify complex business problems to solve and provide data driven solutions.
• Analytic work from requirements specification, data gathering, analysis of presentations to solve business problems.
• Work with stakeholders across Sun Life as a subject matter expert in the prospect, client, and advisor data
• Ongoing support to uncover opportunities that will drive incremental sales.
• Develop metrics and KPIs to measure the performance of analytical and data products in the overall portfolio.
• Provide support for annual business plan, monthly sales forecast, and insight analysis.
<li>Operationalize reporting processes and synthesize key metrics into impactful and insightful dashboards to monitor and assess the success of the business <span style=""display:inline
• Perform reporting automation, self-serve analytics enablement, and promote the culture of analytics-driven decision making.
• 5 + years experience working with data (i.e., quantitative analysis experience, including handling, manipulating, and analyzing data, hypothesis testing, data modelling and data visualization)
• 5 + years experience with SQL. Comfortable writing accurate, efficient, but complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sources.
• Experience of working with AWS data toolsets (eg: Glue, Redshift, SageMaker etc.) and knowledge of using Python/Pyspark
• Experience using oral and written storytelling to share data driven insights in a clear, succinct manner.
• Strong partnering approach with a commitment to meeting business partners\' unique needs and expectations.
• In-depth prioritization, planning, and change management skills to stay within time/scope of a task in a fast-paced environment.
• Comfortable learning new applications and processes quickly with minimal direction
• 2 years+ experience in Data visualization / dashboarding with Tableau or equivalent
• Understanding of predictive and prescriptive techniques (i.e., regression, decision trees, forecasting etc.)
• MSc preferably in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field (i.e., computer science)
• Advanced user of MS Excel and MS Access
• The candidate selected for this role is required to attain Canadian Reliability Security Clearance (administered by submitting fingerprints to the RCMP, who then conduct min. 5 year history checks)

<li>To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the section 201 on the Federal Government site (<a rel=""noopener noreferrer nofollow"" target=""_blank"" href=""https://www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/esc-src/personnel/pdcf-rsrp-eng.html""><span style=""display:inline
• Great Place to Work® Certified in Canada and the US - 2022
• Great Place to Work® award for Best Workplaces for #HybridWork
• 2022 Named “Best Places to Work” by Glassdoor - 2021
• Canada Award for Excellence for Mental Health at Work
• 2021 Flexible hybrid work model including in-country work-from-home if you prefer.

In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.
