column1: c2ad0a2c-909e-4622-beda-300ec01a17b1,301109156,BMO Financial Group,"Risk Analyst, Summer 2024 (Co-op/Internship) – 4 Months",on_site,"Ontario, Canada",2024-01-18T06:25:01.536Z,"<div class=""css-156jxiv"">

As a co-op/intern student at BMO, you will have the opportunity to be heard, keep growing and make a difference. You will be part of our campus program to gain the skills and knowledge needed to take on roles similar to the description listed below.

Our student experience programming is designed to integrate you into Team BMO from day one by adding value in the work you do. You will have the opportunity to participate in programs such as the Women in Technology Mentorship Program, BMO Social Squad student-led activities, BMO U corporate learning platform, and access to various Employee Resource Groups to further develop your network within BMO.
Interested in learning more about our campus program? Stay up-to-date with BMO Campus Recruitment by following us on Twitter @BMOonCampus & Instagram @BMO_on_Campus.

Note: Only students currently enrolled in an academic program and returning to their studies will be considered for Co-op/Internship opportunities. Students who recently graduated are invited to apply to our New Grad opportunities which are available at

By applying for this general posting, you will be considered for a number of different student opportunities across multiple locations. If you are selected to move forward, you will be provided additional information.

Supports the execution of accurate and efficient reporting solutions for risk, regulatory and management information to internal and external stakeholders including regulatory bodies. Supports an efficient and effective risk management function which uses common information sources and practices, reduces ongoing costs, increases service level performance and minimizes risk.
• Designs, develops, and implements reporting solutions to meet management and regulatory reporting requirements.
• Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of analytical and reporting solutions.
• Executes work to deliver timely, accurate, and efficient service for scheduled reporting production processes.
• Supports the maintenance, monitoring, and measurement of key risk indicators to internal & external stakeholders.
• Analyses data and information to provide risk-related insights and recommendations for the assigned portfolio e.g. capital at risk modeling, risk/return assessments, etc.
• Supports the interpretation of internal and external policies and regulatory requirements relevant to the analytics and reporting mandate e.g. regulatory reporting.

• Works with various data owners to discover and select available data sources from internal sources and external vendors (e.g. lending system, payment system, external credit rating system) to fulfill analytical needs.
• Ensures strong governance and effective controls across risk reporting activities and information in accordance with enterprise standards.
<li>Analyzes data and highlights significant information including variances, trends, opportunities and exposures
• Provides information and supports the process for internal and external audits.
• Gathers and formats data into regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.
• Supports development and execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
• Supports the maintenance of operational procedures and processes related to analytical and reporting processes.
• Supports the development of tools and delivery of training focused on awareness and understanding of key data elements used in risk reporting.
• Participates in the design, implementation and management of core business processes to ensure the accuracy of risk data used in reporting.
• Organizes work information to ensure accuracy and completeness.
• Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.

• Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.


    Qualifications:
• As a full-time employee, we would require 3-5 years of experience, however as part of the BMO campus program, we are looking for motivated individuals with a strong desire to learn.
• Knowledge of risk management metrics, KPIs and KRIs.
• Knowledge of industry trends and regulatory requirements for risk reporting.
• Knowledge of risk management theory, processes and portfolio management reporting techniques.
• Knowledge of reporting & analytics concepts and applications.
• Specialized knowledge from education and/or business experience.

column2: >At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

>As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

5d68f1d1-62f2-43f0-b83d-4b9c765f75f7,217086529,Invision AI,Machine Learning Engineer,on_site,"Toronto, ON, Canada",2023-04-20T21:01:40.454Z,"

Please note: Invision AI is one of our participating employers in the upcoming Talent Meetup with Startups and Scaleups event hosted in a hybrid capacity on May 17, 2023, from 12.00-2.00 PM. Attending employers looking to meet and interview a captive audience of AI professionals who are actively seeking new opportunities now or by Fall 2023. For event registration, click here

About Us
Our mission is to see and understand the world. Invision AI offers deep expertise with respect to Artificial Intelligence (AI) systems in the intelligent infrastructure and transportation space.

We go beyond simple 2D detection by capturing details about the space in 3D, including volume, direction, position and speed. That enables us to provide high integrity 3D digital twins for real-time actionable insights across a variety of applications and use cases in both mobile (moving sensor suites on vehicles) and fixed (wayside) scenarios. We are the only company in the world that we know of that is able to track objects that move between different cameras to provide a full end-to-end view of a space.

We are looking for a motivated and skilled Machine Learning Engineer to join our team in Toronto.
• Deep knowledge and experience with Machine Learning algorithms, especially for object detection and classification. Experience in object tracking is a plus.

column1: Invision AI offers deep expertise with respect to Artificial Intelligence (AI) systems in the intelligent infrastructure and transportation space. We have developed a number of unique technical innovations incorporated into a central AI platform. We go beyond simple 2D detection by capturing details about the space in 3D, including volume, direction, position and speed. That enables us to provide high integrity 3D digital twins for real-time actionable insights across a variety of applications and use cases in both mobile (moving sensor suites on vehicles) and fixed (wayside) scenarios. We are the only company in the world that we know of that is able to track objects that move between different cameras to provide a full end-to-end view of a space.

As a company, we distinguish ourselves by taking an integrated hardware-software approach throughout all our products as we constantly iterate between sensors (cameras, LiDAR, radar), their geometries and the associated vision and artificial intelligence algorithms. This has consistently allowed us to achieve industry-leading accuracy and reliability. We build lightweight, cost-effective, edge solutions: we locate compute nodes close to the sensors (as opposed to in the cloud) and leverage distributed compute and wireless transmission where needed.

We enjoy finding principled and practical solutions that mix computer vision, machine learning and software engineering.

column3: >The TD Securities Chief Data Office (TDS-CDO) aims to operate, organize, govern and monetize TDS data assets. This is achieved through four strategic pillars:

column3: >Reporting to the AVP, Data Governance in the Chief Data Office, the Data Steward I will be responsible to support the implementation of data governance and related data management activities for TD Securities.

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

We are searching for a talented candidate to become our team’s Manager, MDM & Business Operations Insights. Reporting to the Director – Enterprise Data Engineering, the successful candidate will be responsible for leading a team of accomplished data analysts, engineers and architects supporting our data and analytics platform transformation. This role will be an agent of change and support the evolving strategy, data and analytics roadmaps of the enterprise data engineering team. The portfolio will focus specifically on the Master Data Management (MDM) workstream while also driving continuous improvement to our GCP engineering practices (common ingestion framework), CI/CD pipelines, DevOps, SRE, batch and real-time data ingestion, and addressing technical debt. Our team is a cloud first team and leverages the latest technologies to fuel our mission of driving value for TELUS via data enablement.
At TELUS, we put ‘Customers First’. With a broad set of responsibilities and a high degree of visibility across the TELUS organization, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to:
• Lead a team of talented data Analysts, Engineers and Architects to drive the modernization of our data platforms
• Foster internal and external stakeholder relationships, including managing senior executive participants
• Provide guidance to establish standards and best practices for building enterprise grade data pipelines
• Work with our preferred Cloud service providers to align our roadmap based on their release schedule for services and product offerings
• Construct comprehensive business cases and financial models leveraging various methods to support strategic projects and decisions with data driven insights
• Utilize internal and external data points coupled with market research on marketplace dynamics impacting TELUS and the Data Strategy team to inform opportunities and risks for the team
• Create technology roadmaps for business partners, executive management, and external audiences to enhance strategic decision making and support technology investment recommendations
• Collaborate with key stakeholders to create, track and evolve the team scorecards and strategic imperatives
• Support the annual strategic and financial planning process
• Flex your communication, negotiation, and influencing skills, working with a broad set of internal stakeholders, executives and external partners
• Mentor, lead, and support a diverse and very talented team of data professionals
• You have experience in technical leadership, managing data platforms, business intelligence tools and setting architectural direction
• You can communicate clearly and effectively in both technical and business matters able to translate technical considerations into business implications
• You are analytical and outcome-oriented with a proven ability to translate business requirements into high-level design models
• You have hands on knowledge of foundational cloud data architecture of lakes, warehouses, data modeling, and life cycle management
• You have demonstrated experience with the governance and oversight of data privacy, security and the ethical use of data in previous roles
• You have experience with cloud migration projects, agile methodologies, and DevOps practices
• You have impressive people leadership track record with proven ability to recruit, coach, mentor and lead high performing teams in a fast-paced environment
• You are a skilled relationship builder and skilled at prioritization, negotiation and influencing
• You can pivot between supporting the urgent needs of the business and the long-term roadmap
• You are flexible, adaptable and embrace ongoing change
• You have experience working on and supporting large, complex technical projects that involve multiple stakeholders and business units

• You have exposure to tools, technologies and programming languages including, but not limited to, Python, Airflow (composer), SQL, Apache Nifi, Hive, Spark, Dataflow (Apache Beam), Kafka, MDM, IICS & PowerCentre ETL
• You have experience creating a vision for and implementing a culture of change to drive CI/CD, DevOps and other opportunities for operational effectiveness
• 5+ years of progressive and relevant work experience with enterprise data
• Experience with the data offerings in the Google Cloud Platform
• Excellent communication skills and ability to lead a large team

>Contributes to the overall success of the Omni Channel Development team, taking effective ownership of developing data integration strategies, and creating various reporting streams that generate value-added actionable insights informing Retail Banking business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.

>The Sr. Analyst, Reporting & Insights, will play a key role in supporting the expansion of our reporting framework, improving our analytical processes, and sharing insights to multiple stakeholders and will be responsible for delivering value-added analytics aimed at creating sustainable business growth focusing on reporting, Insights and data visualization.
>Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:
>• Champion a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge
>• Design and create reports, using data to analyze and improve our understanding of branch staff and customer behaviours, and monitoring the impact of strategic decisions and initiatives
>Design and develop new reports to support management including but not limited to - visualization tools such as Tableau & PowerBI, complex data and logic tools, SAS, SQL, and self-service dashboards

column1: 4c4bf665-6cf8-42f1-8e9b-f60cffe1c920,222290762,TD Bank Group,Analytics and Insights Co-op,on_site,"Toronto, ON",2023-05-04T17:24:04.388Z,"<div class=""jobdetail-desc"" id=""gtm-jobdetail-desc"">
All companies are not the same. What makes TD special as a business is also, what makes us special as an employer.
TD’s Colleague Promise: A better you. A better us.
A more confident you means a stronger us. We empower you to grow your skills, gain new perspectives, and create impact at work and in your community. That’s our unique and inclusive culture.

TD Direct Investing is Canada’s largest direct investing brokerage, empowering 2 million self-directed investors and traders with its full spectrum of powerful solutions and innovative tools to manage their investments with ease and confidence. As a member of the TD Direct Investing Product, Strategy & National Office team, you have the opportunity to work with results-oriented, curious, innovative, and adaptable people who share your passion to help our clients, and one another, to succeed.

Reporting to Senior Manager, Strategic Insights & Analysis, and working alongside a team of analysts, this role will help drive and support TD Direct Investing’s strategic client engagement and acquisition initiatives in analytical, process development, and execution capacities. This role will primarily focus on providing data-driven insights and decision support to various business initiatives, acquiring data in support of such work, as well as helping to develop robust processes and procedures, and executing thereon.
• Perform and leverage DI’s client segmentation to create and support targeted organic growth initiatives, client engagement tactics, and business value proposition enhancements
• Prepare structured data analyses, often in time-sensitive circumstances, and be able to summarize key insights into a coherent, concise communication suitable for executive consumption.
• Collaborate with partners in Data & Analytics teams across Wealth, Marketing, and Phone Channel to understand complex business issues and develop innovative data-driven insights and solutions.
• Support the Senior Manager, Strategic Insights & Analysis in the execution and control of regular reporting, campaign fulfillment, and non-standard pricing processes, ensuring proper documentation.
• Contribute to a culture of continuous improvement (through process improvements, automation, improved documentation, etc.)
• Knowledge of and familiarity or hands-on experience with self-directed investing platforms
• Experience with data extraction, manipulation, and visualization tools (e.g. SQL, Python, Alteryx, Tableau) preferred
• Familiarity with Excel and PowerPoint, including experience developing business documents and leadership presentations with clear, compelling communications
• Applications must include a transcript, cover letter (one letter-sized page or less) and a resume (maximum of 2 pages).

column2: however, we will only contact qualified candidates chosen for an interview. Thank you for your interest.

column1: • TD requires employees to reside in the country where the role is located, irrespective of remote working arrangements.

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

OMERS overall vision is to play a leadership role in the pension industry and be first of class, deliver superior services and to grow and attract investment partners. The core values are to be fair, have high integrity, respect for each other, provide superior service and work as a team.
The Corporate Objectives for OMERS is to provide secure pensions for all their constituents by:
• Investing to earn outstanding returns with due regard for risk
• Providing high quality service to our members and employers
• Building a culture of excellence and pride in OMERS
OMERS Operating Principles are: Financial Strength, Accountability, Member Focus, Talent and Reporting.

We’d be thrilled to have you join our team as we set up our Capital Markets Finance Data team for new and continued success! We’ll focus equally on expertise and excellence, paired with culture and community. We will serve OMERS teams primarily in Capital Markets, Total Portfolio Management, and the Corporate function through understanding their needs, delivering against their expectations, and contributing our proficiencies – to achieve collective wins. This role joins a team on a journey, with much future potential in a global, sophisticated, complex enterprise.

Scope: The Data Engineer is responsible for supporting the investment teams by enabling robust and reliable investment data, analytics, and reporting through investment technology and change management at one of Canada’s largest pension funds having assets exceeding $120 Billion.

• Design, develop, and help maintain data assets to extract, transform, and load data from various data files, APIs, and databases, and to make them accessible to various client-facing applications as well as investment data warehouse and internal tools

• Implement data strategies that prepare, transform, combine and manage structured and unstructured data (e.g. internal investment accounting systems as well as external third-party investment feeds) to integrate the data into an investment data warehouse and BI solutions
• Develop and operate highly scalable data pipelines and infrastructure that enable investment analytics, and investment reporting use cases
• Automate manual processes and optimize data delivery
• Utilize modern technologies for designing and building data solutions to meet business needs
• Partner with business analysts and reporting analysts to develop reports and PowerBI dashboards
• Support and troubleshoot existing investment data applications and BI reporting solutions as needed
• Work as part of a cross-functional agile team responsible for end-to-end delivery of business needs
• Collaborate and work effectively with business analysts and reporting analysts team members, and other investment professionals and leaders in solutioning and support

• Track of record working in a fast-paced environment and multi-faceted role that intersects with business and technical analysts to support existing solutions, solution delivery, and contributions as a project resource for investment system implementations and upgrades
• Strong experience with data management, investment systems, business intelligence, and other reporting technologies
• Experience with Microsoft based BI/ETL tools (e.g. SQL Server, SSRS, SSIS, data factory) or similar
• Experience with Cloud based data and analytics platforms (e.g. Snowflake, DataBricks, Azure Synapse)
• Deep proficiency in SQL, Python, and similar languages
• Demonstrated ability to handle multiple projects and tasks at the same time to support daily production issues
• Critical thinking skills with the ability to independently solve problems with data and/or reference documents
• Investment data modeling experience using the Kimball method is an asset
• Experience with BNY Eagle PACE, Calypso, and Charles River is an asset
• Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, or a related field
• A people-first focus with a desire to develop meaningful, positive relationships across all levels of the organization
• A teammate mentality coupled with servant leadership
• A sense of urgency, optimism, and a desire to deliver excellence
• A desire to drive debate, to speak candidly, and to listen empathetically
• Strong orientation towards strategy, change, and results

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $124 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2022. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with more than 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.
96fefcdf-7d65-454a-b4c5-0eff972e25ac,222290804,TD Bank Group,Risk Management Intern/Co-op,on_site,"Toronto, ON",2023-05-04T17:24:07.388Z,"<div class=""jobdetail-desc"" id=""gtm-jobdetail-desc"">
All companies are not the same. What makes TD special as a business is also, what makes us special as an employer.
TD’s Colleague Promise: A better you. A better us.
A more confident you means a stronger us. We empower you to grow your skills, gain new perspectives, and create impact at work and in your community. That’s our unique and inclusive culture.

Co-op and Internship opportunities allow you to gain valuable work experience across a number of the businesses at TD. You will work with experienced colleagues, receive world class training, and be part of a community of students across TD, where you will have an impact, grow as individual and experience our culture of care.

Our Co-op/Intern Programming is offered with select Co-op and Internship roles and is designed to help you better understand the TD business, build on critical career capabilities, and broaden your professional network. This program is designed to complement your on-the job experience and features:
• Leadership talks with key Leaders from across the organization
• Lunch and Learns on topics such as Innovation
• Diversity and Inclusion and Personal Branding and so much more
For TD Bank Group to grow profitably, it must selectively take and manage risks. TD recognizes that a strong risk culture and approach to risk management is fundamental to our success.

TD’s risk management approach is comprehensive and proactive and combines experience and specialized knowledge of individual business segments, risk professionals, and the corporate oversight functions. It is based on enabling TD’s business to understand their risks and developing the policies, processes and controls required to manage these risks appropriately in line with the Bank’s strategy and risk appetite.

Risk Management is a key Corporate Function supporting the front-line businesses within TD with over 1,800 employees in offices in Canada, United States, UK and Singapore. We partner internally with many different areas of TD as well as our business partners to ensure we exceed our client’s expectations, and employees to focus on a positive employee experience. We work externally with regulators to align with industry standards and benchmark ourselves against best practices.

As a student part of the TD Risk Management Co-op program you will have the opportunity to join different development workshops, seminars and lunch and learns. We will provide you the necessary tools, resources and guidance to achieve both business and personal goals.
• Currently enrolled in an undergraduate degree majoring in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Financial Analysis, Risk Management, Computer Science or equivalent
• Must be enrolled in an undergraduate degree with the intent of going back to school at of the start of your work term
• Relational database SQL skills for data mining, extraction and statistical analysis.
• Strong excel Advanced MS Excel and MS Access for data analysis (Pivot, Filter, Formulas, Vlookup, VBA)
• Dedicated, detail oriented, and an ability to propose creative solutions
Skills that are not required, but considered an asset
• Knowledge of Financial Industry/Risk Management/Retail Credit products
• Experience using Business Intelligence Reporting tools such as SAP Business Objects, Cognos or Tableau
• Knowledge of Basel Capital Frameworks Quality Center (HP ALM) Testing tool
Please note that this is a general posting. If you are selected for an interview, more information regarding which business group and the specific job duties will be provided.
• This position is an 4-month work term and will commence Sept 5th – Dec 22nd, 2023
• Applications must include a transcript, cover letter (one letter-sized page or less) and a resume (maximum of 2 pages).

74c08a73-2913-4225-8605-4af69bc7f0a4,226183733,Scotiabank,"Senior Associate, Research Analytics & Institutional Client Strategy",on_site,Canada : Ontario : Toronto,2023-05-16T15:52:05.118Z,"<div class=""joblayouttoken rtltextaligneligible displayDTM""> <div class=""inner fontcolorb6a533a1"" style=""font-family:Arial , Helvetica , sans-serif
column3: >

>Requisition ID: 174805

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

column1:
About the Team:
At Scotiabank, research is a key driver of our Global Equity platform. We specialize in the Canadian market, and we also supply targeted international research covering the United States and Latin America. Our top-ranked teams generate value-added equity ideas and themed publications. As well, we are constantly looking for ways to bring new products to market and provide clients with valuable research ideas and insights. Our products include daily company-specific investment views, monthly and quarterly sector updates, in-depth fundamental research reports, portfolio analysis and recommendations, and equity strategy commentary.

Position Highlights:
The Research Client Services Team (RCST) is responsible for supporting the Equity Research department by providing valuable internal analytical insights to management and research analysts for strategic decision-making and ensuring adherence to compliance requirements of the MiFID II regulation. As a member of the RCST, this position will assist in maintaining and developing the internal analytics capabilities of the team. This position will also assist with the administration of client research agreements and work closely with research analysts, senior management, and compliance teams as part of the overall MiFID II compliance framework.

• Produce periodical analytical summary reports for the Research Management team
  • Create analysis and reporting tools on an ad hoc basis to support internal data and analytical requests
  • Create and maintain dashboards and reports that can be leveraged by users to find insights
  • Analyze client accounts to identify outreach opportunities and gauge account profitability
  • Work with Research Analysts to improve the format and delivery of their product
  • Understand business processes to analyze, interpret, and advise staff on analytical findings
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure effective use of reporting and analysis, and provide support, if needed
  • Understand and incorporate technology best practices with a primary focus on .NET and SQL
  • Liaise with other internal analytics teams to ensure data accuracy and consistency across the firm
  • Diligently perform quality assurance and assess operational and reputation risk
  • Monitor and analyze buyside client consumption of the research product
  • Respond to internal and external inquiries on the research product and agreements
  • Issue invoices for research clients and track payments with internal Finance teams
Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We'd love to work with you if you have:

• Technical mindset with an undergraduate degree in Computer Science or Engineering is required
  • Excellent command of Microsoft Office, with an emphasis on Excel is required
  • Proven experience in SQL and .NET is required
  • Working knowledge of Angular and Python would be an asset
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Attention to detail and time management skills
  • Ability to produce meaningful results from data
  • Proven experience consolidating and analyzing different data sources
  • Ability to work collaboratively within a cross functional team environment
  • Ability to succeed in a dynamic and fast-paced environment

column1: e5a233fb-63e2-4ca8-a3fa-c80877c24997,231447031,BMO Financial Group,"Manager Analytics, Business Intelligence - Wealth",on_site,"Ontario, Canada",2023-06-01T15:39:02.561Z,"<div class=""css-uh44xl"">

We are looking for a talented individual to join our team in the position of Manager Analytics, Business Intelligence. The primary responsibility is to manage data analytics and deliver recommendations that drive data driven insights for the GAM (Global Asset Management) Business.

The role will sit on the Wealth Data Analytics and Strategy team and support the Global Asset Management Retail Sales and Distribution team with proactive, actionable insights across all Mutual Fund products. The successful candidate will be able to go beyond analytics/reporting to provide actionable insights to senior leadership.
• Take the lead supporting GAM business. Think strategically and work independently with minimal supervision
• Work with internal clients and diverse stakeholders to understand, track and improve their business objectives, scope and KPIs
• Produce dashboards, reports, analysis, insights that drive decisions and help us build better products and experiences
• Manage and enhance daily/weekly/monthly channel reporting to provide results and context to deliver actionable insights to senior management, not just reporting data
• Improve and automate process using a variety of tools to drive operational efficiency
• Manage, prioritize, and respond to ad-hoc requests

• Uncover and identify opportunities to improve the customer experience by leveraging statistical approaches against multiple sources of data including internal sales/transactions and external party data/benchmarks
• Assist the retail bank branch channel in campaign performance measurement and increasing productivity of all strategic initiatives
• Research, design and implement reporting infrastructure that leads to automated and flexible reporting
• 5-7 years of work experience in Business, Financial industry
• 3+ Proven experience working with SQL language and large datasets
• Demonstrated proficiency in working with large datasets, both structured and unstructured data, using programming language such as SAS, SQL or related

column2: able to effectively present analytics data to business users

column1: • Good knowledge of Asset Management and understanding of current market trends. Experience in Mutual Funds, ETF and Institutional distribution process
• Post-Secondary education in Math, Computer Science, Statistics, Actuarial Science, Business
• One or More Master\'s Degree in Data Analytics, MBA, CFA, CPA preferred but not required

column3: >relationship-building skills. Ability to thrive on a high-degree of independence and ownership

column1: • Proficient in visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI
• Experience in running campaigns through design, execution, and performance tracking

column2: >At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

>As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
>To find out more visit us at <a rel=""noopener noreferrer nofollow"" target=""_blank"" href=""https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en""><span class=""WAP2""><span style=""display:inline

>BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

>Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

This is a critical role n supporting our business partners with reporting, analytical and production activity support. This role supports our primary partners within TORIC (Technology and Operations Risk and Internal Controls) division as well as Technology and Operations (T&O) and BMO Nesbitt Burns branch network. It also provides critical support with Power BI reporting, Authority Process Support, GEMS BAU as well as the opportunity to lead on training reporting and other initiatives. You will be supporting the development of BMO\'s CO-OP students and BMO Interns and provides the candidate the opportunity to gain leadership skills, strong organizational skills and building of partner relationships.
• Governance, Risk and Compliance Dashboard support using Power BI
• Support of various Authorization Lists for T&O & BMO Nesbitt Burns branch network using Power Apps, PDF Forms and SharePoint or other like programs
This is a HYBRID role based in the Greater Toronto area.

Consults on analytical solutions to understand, analyze, and synthesize requirements, goals and objectives relative to data and business intelligence needs and to enable high-quality, fact-based business decisions to drive better business outcomes. Provides advice on the configuration, functionality, applicability, and usability of data management, data analytics, and data visualization technology solutions. Supports the development of the strategy and roadmap for data quality and data analytics, data modeling, reporting, business intelligence, and the design and development of sophisticated decision support tools.
• Leads/participates in the design, implementation and management of new analytics & reporting solutions.
• Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions.
• Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.

• Monitors and tracks tool performance, user acceptance testing, and addresses any issues.
• Integrates information from multiple sources to enable more efficient processes, enhanced analysis and/or streamlined reporting.
• Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions.
• Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.

• Builds reports and visualizations to effectively communicate data driven insights to users for a variety of audiences e.g. visualization solutions of data into reports, graphics, dashboards to illustrate facts, trends, and insights.
• Develops solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.
• Supports development and execution of strategic analytics & reporting initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
• Analyzes data and information to provide subject-matter insights and recommendations.

The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI solutions, high-quality data, and a data-product-oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing.

We are entrepreneurial and live by our AI Manifesto of failing fast and being outcome vs technology-driven, creating value for our customers, team members, communities, and the environment. The team takes pride in our Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning capabilities and takes ownership of each step of the process. From hypothesis generation, initial exploring of datasets, developing novel AI techniques to discover insights, to developing automation pipelines and web visualizations, we do it all!
Always wanted to work with a team of innovators touching all business units within TELUS, and be part of a culture that embraces creativity and collaboration? If so, we’d love to talk with you!
Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

You’ll be a part of the team and journey that will transform the way we do business across various domains. You’ll collaborate with teams across the company, seeking out various data sources to help identify new business opportunities while championing data-driven decision-making and the accelerated adoption of AI.

As a Data Scientist on the team, you will combine your expert knowledge of data science with your strong software development skills to automate and facilitate data exploration, analytics, machine learning model development, training and deployment and will leverage your experience in building reusable algorithms, functions and libraries.
• Lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models
• Collaborate on end-to-end automation efforts required to bring models to production
• Work with structured and unstructured raw data to design and develop innovative predictive models, metrics, and dashboards to uncover actionable insights
• Visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that provide insights to the organization
• Influence how we approach business challenges and opportunities by driving the adoption of a data-driven mindset
• Develop re-usable code aimed at delivering on future goals faster and more reliably
• Support and evolve the Advanced Analytics and Data Science roadmap by leveraging industry research, best practices and emerging tools/technology
• Build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities
You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

• You are recognized for addressing business needs via your application of data mining and analysis, predictive modeling, statistics and other advanced analytical techniques in which you have previous hands-on work experience

• You are sought out for your skills in Machine Learning and AI, including regression, classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP, and optimization and bring 2-4 years of hands-on work and practical business experience in the above areas
• You are a master communicator capable of breaking down technical and complex concepts in a way that is understood by non-technical audiences

• You have solid development experience with Python and you are comfortable using various data science libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy as well as frameworks like TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras and have applied these skills towards solving actual business matters
• You are comfortable in and with a Jupyter environment and infrastructure, and familiar with GitHub
• You possess advanced knowledge in SQL and distributed computing
• You are familiar with at least one of the cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure
• You are well versed in software and AI development lifecycles, including ML Ops
• You are agile and have a bias for action, removing roadblocks to get results fast
• Masters or PhD degree in a quantitative field such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, or Data Science
• Experience with agile methodology and work in a start-up environment

column8: >As an Applied ML Scientist - Health, you will provide technical leadership and contribute to focused research breakthroughs and applications to solve real-world health problems with machine learning and AI. You will provide guidance and work with some of the best and brightest data scientists and machine learning (ML) engineering staff from leading industry and health organizations. You will collaborate with some of the leading machine learning researchers, data scientists and AI engineering teams. Publishing research papers on applied research is a part of this role, but the greatest focus is on the impact of applications, not on the quantity or quality of publications. We are seeking a scientist with research experience in Responsible AI in a deep learning context. Experience in Fairness, Explainability, Privacy, AI Safety, Recommender Systems, and Natural Language Processing are all valuable areas of knowledge for this role. This position is an individual contribution position and focused on providing technical leadership in implementation focused applied ML in health settings.

column9: >Lead research and implementation of varied machine learning and deep learning techniques in the health domain

>Work in collaboration with Vector’s Health team, and health sector partners to identify challenges in the health domain that can be solved using advanced ML techniques such as NLP, Computer Vision, Generative Models etc.
>Provide technical guidance to AI Engineering team members and lead delivery of applied ML projects in health
>Provide scientific advice regarding overall machine learning application strategies and roadmaps for the health domain
>Work in collaboration with Researchers, Machine learning specialists, and Vector affiliates to build demos, minimum viable products (MVP), reference implementations, and prototypes

column10: >Provide scientific oversight for Vector-led or co-led efforts to prepare and present machine learning research in the health domain
>Serve as the lead Vector scientific contributor for health, including contributing to or leading the authoring of peer-reviewed research papers

>Contribute to training sessions and other initiatives for Vector’s professional staff and stakeholders that help increase AI knowledge and capacity of the health system to recognize and act on opportunities to apply machine learning
>Serve as an expert and facilitate identification of experts among Vector’s research community for external stakeholders to advise on machine learning research trends and applications
>Perform other functions as required e.g., providing scientific advice and technical support to other members of Vector’s leadership team and corporate projects led by Vector.

column9: >PhD degree in computer science or computer engineering with a research focus on machine learning required
>Demonstrated expertise in one or more of: ML for health, Explainable AI, AI Safety, privacy for AI/ML, AI governance, Nature Language Processing (NLP), Natural Language Understanding and generation
>Demonstrated experience applying machine learning research to novel problems and data sets
>Experience with software engineering and/or data engineering is considered an asset
>Experience with parameter and architecture tuning of deep learning algorithms
>Experience using open source deep learning software frameworks (e.g, PyTorch, Tensorflow, JAX)
>Experience with recommendation systems is considered an asset.

column6: >OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.
>We\'re looking for a driven, resourceful and motivated candidate for the Senior Perception Developer - Calibration and Sensors positio
column9: >n. This person will take a leading role in the development of calibration and sensor algorithms for autonomous mobile robots.

column6: >The Perception Team’s primary responsibility is the development of the core robotics software responsible for environmental sensing and understanding on all of our vehicles. As a Senior Perception Developer - Calibration and Sensors, you will develop and maintain algorithms and processes for the complete continuous calibration and monitoring of robotic systems. You will be creating solutions to the challenging problems of high accuracy intrinsic and extrinsic calibration of heterogeneous sensor configurations and actuators, as well as online calibration and sensor processing and monitoring for a wide range of possible robotic platforms. You will be responsible for evaluating state-of-the-art ideas from academia and industry, and taking these ideas out of the lab and into the real world, identifying opportunities to improve, and developing high-performance software to run in real time on robots. As part of the Perception Team you will continue to advance the cutting edge of robotics research through collaboration with our academic partners and contributions to research publications and open source initiatives.

>For the role of Senior Perception Developer - Calibration and Sensors, we are seeking an experienced developer to develop, support, maintain, and extend robotic calibration solutions for real world applications.

column10: >Creating robust innovative solutions to the problems of robotic calibration and perception
>Developing custom calibration, sensor monitoring, sensor filtering, and perception algorithms
>Evaluating new sensing technology and robotic platforms
>Working with production and hardware teams to develop processes for sensor calibration methods
>Supporting the deployment and testing of robotic systems
>Collaborating with various internal teams, as well as academic and industrial partners
>Staying up to the date with the latest developments from academia and industry
>Graduate degree in engineering/CS or a related field, with applicable background.
>Strong theoretical and practical understanding of the challenges and solutions to the problems of robotic system calibration.
>Practical knowledge of sensing technologies including LIDAR, Cameras, IMU, and their error models.
>Familiarity with robotic platforms and their motion models such as differential, ackerman, bicycle, etc.
>Strong software development skills in modern C++.
>Understanding of software development workflows, life cycles and development methodologies and tools.
>Hands-on experience with real world autonomous systems.
>Experience with ROS, Gazebo, OpenCV and PCL.
>Familiarity with linear algebra and nonlinear optimization techniques and libraries such as
>Understanding of sensor error modeling, particularly laser rangefinders and vision systems.
>Experience with manufacturing tolerances of robotic systems

column1: Join our team & what we’ll accomplish together

The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions. We are doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling and high-quality data. We have a data-product and data platform-oriented culture and we are always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing.

We are entrepreneurial and passionate, believers that so much more is possible and can be achieved by creating value and great outcomes for our customers, team members, communities, and environment and that through meaningful transformation we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives.Our team members appreciate diversity of thinking, ideas and experiences, and are always learning, experimenting and applying tuition value into everything we do.

As a Trusted advisor for Data Quality Management, you’ll contribute to the adoption and advancement of TELUS’ Data Management and Data Quality Program, you will also contribute to the advancement of TELUS’ Data Quality platform maturity and adoption.

As a Subject Matter Expert in Data Management, you collaborate with various business units and demonstrate thought leadership when sitting at the intersection between business value, technology and data to ensure TELUS’ data quality platform provides a high usability platform for all data quality needs at TELUS. Growth mindset is the must for this role as we are lean and extremely adaptable team that supports all aspects of Center of Excellence practice.
• Establish product strategic goals and short, mid and long-term roadmap
• Define and document what to solve first, articulate the valuable market/user problem to be addressed along with priorities and justification for each part of the solution
• Acts as the user advocate articulating the end user’s needs
• Work closely with engineers, architects, program managers and platform support to ensure business case, yearly targets and user satisfaction goals are met
• Ensure that the product supports the company’s overall strategy and goals
• Empower rapidly growing TELUS Enterprise Data Quality Management Practice user community
• Enrich user experience for all types of users

• In alignment with the program goals and objectives, define and drive user adoption processes by meaningful interactions and consistent application of advanced branding, marketing and communication techniques and skills to drive user engagement
• Support and be attentive to users needs and concerns in a timely manner, alleviate user concerns in a positive manner in alignment with program vision and approach
• Actively monitor data quality maturity trending and initiate appropriate corrective actions with responsible users and stakeholders
<li>Nurture and grow user community by preparing, facilitating, coordinating and running community of practice forums

The Quantitative Analysis and Strategy (QAS) team works closely with Corporate Treasury internal Structured Market Risk, Liquidity & Funding, and Portfolio Management partners and Lines of Business partners across the bank in identifying and quantifying risks and opportunities through analytical support and statistical model development. The analysis and modeling work cover areas of mortgage, home equity, C&I and CRE loans, consumer & commercial deposits, various securities including MBS, ABS, Muni bonds, etc.

The Manager of QAS team in Corporate Treasury will be responsible for developing, enhancing, implementing and maintaining quantitative models and analytics suites using conventional econometric and machine learning techniques for the purposes of asset liability and interest rate risk management, customer analytics and profitability, and stress testing under various macro-economic scenarios. We are looking for a bright, energetic, and ambitious individual to join our Data Engineering Team.
This is a fantastic opportunity to work with amazing teams and help them achieve their vision to deliver actionable information from data to enable business outcomes.

You will work with business stakeholders, IT, data science, and data engineering teams to develop a vision of what they want to achieve and the strategy and plans to get there, while at the same time working with cutting edge data technologies.

Your experience as a Product Owner means translating and prioritizing business needs to user stories and roadmaps. Your ultimate job is to ensure value comes out of your data product. You will take responsibility for the business success in terms of their dealings with your data product(s).

You are a passionate advocate for your stakeholders and will drive the deliverables to completion. Once completed, you will be responsible for data governance practices within your products, including metadata documentation and data quality, as well as facilitating resolution of those data issues. Your balance between technical and business knowledge and soft skills will be Key.
• Develop a deep understanding of stakeholders’ business needs and outcomes
• Work in collaboration with Business, IT, Data Engineering, and Data Science teams to design and deliver products that provide business value and drive downstream efficiencies
• Gather requirements and document them as user stories, epics, and themes
• Provide ongoing support to stakeholders and users of the data products
• Accountable for end-to-end delivery of the product, in partnership with IT
• Work in collaboration with the Director to develop and execute on long term roadmaps
• Monitor ongoing use of the data products to help direct future investment decisions
• Ensure data quality and facilitate issue resolutions
• Assist in developing business case justification for product development, creating budget requests and managing funding allocations for the data product(s)
• Partner with ES and Architecture to evaluate solution and design options

• Acts as the go-to Subject Matter Expert for the data product(s), partnering with other SMEs in the business stakeholders, IT and Data Engineering teams to ensure coverage of expertise across the domain(s).
<li>Proven experience with product leadership, ownership, and development in data and technology
column2: including planning, execution and coordination of delivery activities across multiple teams and stakeholders

column1: • 3+ years as a Product Owner in Agile environment
<li>Excellent communication and influence skills while working with diverse stakeholders
column2: ability to interact with multiple levels of management across business, IT, and Data Engineering

column1: • Ability to translate business needs and processes to requirements and technology direction

• Demonstrated ability to assess business needs and conceptualize a vision for the product with the added ability to develop a product strategy and roadmap. Ability to communicate a shared vision and establish buy-in.
• Experience with preparing cost estimates, presenting budget requests and managing to a budget.
• Outstanding problem-solving skills and ability to facilitate problem identification, resolution and escalation across multiple business and technology disciplines.
• BS in Computer Science, Computer Programming, Informatics or equivalent
• Insurance and/or Wealth Data Domain Product Experience
• Familiarity with Data Engineering concepts such as ETL
• Experience with managing multi-year roadmaps and business cases
• Great Place to Work® Certified in Canada and the US - 2022
• Great Place to Work® award for Best Workplaces for #HybridWork
• 2022 Named “Best Places to Work” by Glassdoor - 2021
• Canada Award for Excellence for Mental Health at Work
• 2021 Flexible hybrid work model including in-country work-from-home if you prefer.

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.
Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.
We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

column3: >

>Requisition ID: 189135

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

column4: >The mandate of this role is to develop and monitor credit risk acquisition strategies, policies, and processes to optimize risk/return for credit cards, unsecured lines of credit, and over drafts for the Canadian retail portfolio.

>The manager will use in-depth portfolio analytics to optimize approval/decline decision criteria, automation decision, and limit assignment strategies for New and Existing customers, leveraging champion/challenger capabilities to confirm assumptions, learn about shifts in consumer credit behavior, and identify risks/opportunities that will impact the Risk Appetite Framework. These tasks will be accomplished leveraging extensive consumer data, credit risk and lending business expertise and advanced analytics techniques including machine learning. The person must have strong communication skills to propose changes to senior management and collaborate with risk partners including Product, Operations, and Regulators.

>This position requires technical expertise including experience with risk technologies origination and various testing methods to lead strategy and policy implementation with minimal defect, as well as a deep understanding of credit bureau information.
>Develop credit risk strategies and policies for the Canadian unsecured lending, with goal of using observational decision models to approve credit and set customer credit exposure
column6: >Promote best practices and leverage appropriate analytical tools for all strategy development and policy enhancements as well as leveraging information from credit bureau and other third-party data.
column8: >Ensure all new approved credit is aligned with risk appetite and regulatory requirements and will optimize risk/return over the long term.
column10: >Leverage champion/challenger capabilities and incorporate non-traditional data and innovation for continuous improvements to existing strategies.
column12: >Lead successful implementation of strategy changes across different technology platforms and channels. Promote lean adjudication decision design.

column4: >Monitor, assess and evaluate existing risk strategies to identify opportunities and recommend changes to pre-approval strategies to ensure the Bank remains within risk appetite.
column6: >Conduct in-depth analysis to identify change in credit quality, exceptions, customer behavior and origination trends. Develop and track early-warning indicators to identify population shifts.

column3: >Demonstrate initiative to automate and simplify tasks to set risk thresholds to measure and control risks using technical or analytical skills and Tools such as PowerBI.

column6: >Ensure all business line judicious priorities (i.e. growth, new product launches, new channels, new processes, new business line acquisitions) are consistent with Risk Appetite Framework.
column8: >Represent Risk’s point of view and liaise with stakeholders throughout the organization to socialize, and explain risk measures clearly and as appropriate.
column10: >Identify areas where new/enhanced policies or procedures need to be implemented to improve productivity and performance within risk appetite and recommend/implement appropriate changes.

column4: >Canadian Regulator, Internal Audit and Fraud Management
>Support investigations and solutioning for OSFI findings and/or Internal Audit items in an appropriate and acceptable timeframe.
column6: >Liaise with the Fraud Department and Security and Investigations as required.

column4: >Desired: Bachelor’s degree or higher in business, statistics, economics, mathematics, computer science, data science or analytics.

>A minimum of 2-5 years in the risk/portfolio management field, with a successful track record of success in using analytical tools to conduct data analysis, ideally related to credit risk management.
column6: >Strong knowledge of SAS/SQL and Enterprise Miner or similar statistical software including the ability to apply advanced statistical techniques.
column8: >Able to translate data into digestible dashboards and business insights (Tableau, PowerBI, PowerApp)
column10: >Strong communication and relationship management skills complemented with solid analytical and problem-solving skills.
column12: >Project management and leadership skills to prioritize, manage and implement a variety of contesting initiatives is preferred.
column14: >Strong knowledge creating strategies that impact organization’s P&L
column16: >Prior experience in a retail lending environment or credit risk management is preferred.

column1: Reporting to the Manager - Credit, Enterprise Risk Management, the Senior Analyst will be responsible for supporting the execution of key reporting, validations, and other high-visibility risk related deliverables across our portfolio. The company is looking for a curious and self-driven individual possessing the right critical thinking, analytics, data visualization, and interpersonal skills to proactively tap into existing processes for the second line of defense and seek new opportunities to improve the existing systems.
• Analyze data and prepare dashboards showcasing portfolio and industry trends.
• Perform quality assurance to ensure adherence with the Bank’s credit risk policy and directives.
• Provide support on strategic initiatives such as credit risk appetite and limit setting process, credit loss allowance assessment (i.e., IFRS9 model), and scorecard validation etc.
• Ensure strong governance and effective controls through independent calculation and reconciliation of key risk metrics.
• Use quantitative analysis to evaluate and monitor risk performance of credit risk strategy proposals, including but not limited to account acquisition and management.
• Utilize reporting BI tools to support process automations and to improve efficiency.
<li>Foster relationships with internal and external partners
column2: collaborate with other business units to ensure that enterprise risk interests are addressed in business initiatives.

column1: • Ensure proper documentation is maintained for compliance and audit purposes.
• University degree in a quantitative field, Economics, Business Administration, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or equivalent.
• 3+ years working in the retail financial industry, credit risk management, data analysis / financial modeling / data mining role.
• Fluent in Python and SQL. Familiarity with Cloud environment is a plus.
• Intermediate understanding of credit risk management concepts and knowledge of credit scoring & risk assessment.
• Self-starter with ability to work under pressure and tight timelines.
• Strong interpersonal skills to work with multiple stakeholders and garner consensus.
• Proficient in statistical analysis with knowledge of tools such as SAS.
• Knowledge of life cycle risk systems such as TRIAD and TSYS is a plus.
• High degree of proficiency in MS Office Applications including Excel, PowerBI, PowerPoint and VBA.

column1: 421fb795-52a1-4ce0-9ca8-51fec2c70963,316217245,BMO Financial Group,"Manager, Customer Insights & Reporting",on_site,"Ontario, Canada",2024-04-04T06:25:01.528Z,"<div class=""css-156jxiv"">
The Manager, Customer Insights and Reporting is responsible for the development, production, and ownership of customer metrics and reporting across Personal banking.

The individual will have an end-to-end project accountability. Beginning with understanding the business KPIs, they will leverage expertise in process design to determine an efficient and optimal process for delivering reporting results. Development will include structuring the data flow and setting up automation. Ownership will continue post-implementation and include investigations, improvements, and partner relations.
• Understand business KPIs, and relevant drivers and factors that can help reach business objectives.
• Internalize and understand the larger context of customer data elements and leverage a strong awareness of how customer and account attributes intersect.
• Analyze large, complex datasets (from multiple sources both structured and unstructured) to drive insights and recommendations.
• Be a practitioner of data best practices including QA, stable design, code optimization, and automation techniques.
• Design and improve production and ad-hoc reporting processes with the goal of optimizing consumption and performance.
Design and Delivery of Performance Reporting and Dashboards
• Responsible for performance measurement reporting and visualization that monitors overall and incremental impact of customer growth in quantity and quality.
• Lead the definition, creation and maintenance of standardized dashboards and performance reporting for Customer Insights and business partners.
• Refine design proposals in collaboration with various stakeholders in Personal banking.
• Apply thoughtful consideration to the best way to present complex materials in a consumable way.
• Create new analyses and/or tools that deliver customer insights that enable business users to further their objectives.
• Work collaboratively with other analytics teams and business subject matter experts to refine personal understanding and ensure consistency in reporting and design.
• Establish and communicate standards for accurate business requirement, technical specification and work process documentation associated with our metrics and reporting.
• Engage with business partners to ensure needs are met, update on delivery status, and provide transparency and clarity to results.

• Leverage consultative skills and knowledge of best-practices to provide guidance and consultative sessions with partners to share insights and recommendations rooted in data. Use these sessions to flag potential areas for deeper investigation, growth, or prioritization.
• Consult with and deliver results to partners within tight time constraints that consistently meet or exceed their expectations.
• Ensure measurement reports meet governance and risk policies and identifying opportunities and solutions for continuous improvements
This job requires the incumbent to interact with the following groups and/or processes in BMO FG and relevant external stakeholders:
<ul><li>Managers and Senior Managers of Line of Business including:<ul>
• Analytics Centre of Excellence and all associated teams within
• P&C Distribution - Sales & Service Divisions and North American Contact Centres
• BS/BA in Commerce, Finance, Statistics, Quantitative methods, Math, Computer Science, Marketing, or similar.
• Ability to pull data from multiple sources and formulate comprehensive and actionable reports
• Strong analytic and pattern recognition to connect causal factors and form hypotheses.

column2: ability to provide concise, clear reporting, actionable analysis and presentations.

column1: • Ability to interact with all levels of end users and technical resources.
• Experience in data visualization preferred, including visualization software such as Power BI, Microsoft Reporting Services, Spotfire or Tableau.
• A ‘can-do’ attitude and passion for analytics including the insight and value it can provide.
• Self-motivation and the capacity to work under pressure and tight deadlines.
• Proven ability to self-check work to ensure results are error-free
• Ability to plan, organize and work on multiple tasks simultaneously
• Technical experience working in analytical software, and business software (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
The above represents BMO Financial Group’s pay range and type.

Salaries will vary based on factors such as location, skills, experience, education, and qualifications for the role, and may include a commission structure. Salaries for part-time roles will be pro-rated based on number of hours regularly worked. For commission roles, the salary listed above represents BMO Financial Group’s expected target for the first year in this position.

BMO Financial Group’s total compensation package will vary based on the pay type of the position and may include performance-based incentives, discretionary bonuses, as well as other perks and rewards. column3: >

>Requisition ID: 195942

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

>Global Banking and Markets (GBM) is a leading Canadian Capital Markets and Investment Banking business with a growing platform in the US and Latin America, operating globally for over 100 years. Scotiabank’s strong U.S. presence provides our clients an important bridge to this key global market for trade and investment flows across the Americas and the world.

>Global Banking & Markets provides a full range of investment banking, credit and risk management products and services relevant to the financing and strategic development needs of our clients. Our products include debt and equity financing, mergers & acquisitions, corporate banking, institutional equity sales, trading and research, fixed income products, derivatives, energy, foreign exchange and precious & metals. We also cross-sell the full range of wholesale products and services offered by the Scotiabank Group.

>Be part of an innovative, Global Capital Markets and Investment Banking business with a unique geographic footprint that puts capital to work for our clients across industries! We work together to drive ambition for every future!

>Establish a team which is responsible for the systems ownership of Fenergo, GBM’s client onboarding system, from a business perspective. Includes the development of a long-term vision for Fenergo and associated tools, vendor relationship management and product development, “business as usual” maintenance and 1st line support functions after system upgrades, audit support, regular reviews of user access controls.
column5: >Responsible for proactively ensuring onboarding systems (Fenergo and others as required) remain in line with regulatory expectations, in particular adequate recordkeeping, and data quality. In the long term, the team will also look to develop Fenergo and other technology solutions to promote efficiency of onboarding processing times and client experience.
column7: >Assess the need for and progressive establishment of core data governance controls within GBM Onboarding
column9: >Lead the GBM Onboarding Reporting & Analytics function, in particular working closely with the GBM Onboarding team and other stakeholders to understand key business, AML/KYC and regulatory objectives and identify analytics that will provide insight/transparency, enable decision making, and support key regulatory initiatives.
column11: >Codify best practices and identify opportunity to enhance reporting processes to drive effective and efficient reporting implementation. Develops appropriate tools, engages with technology to champion onboarding metrics and reporting related automation.
column13: >Champion a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems, and knowledge.
column15: >Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
column17: >Actively pursue effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.

column3: >Champion a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment.

>At least ten years of financial services experience. Preference will be given to direct experience dealing with systems that have regulatory compliance implications and prior experience managing large technology vendor relationships.
column5: >An in depth understanding of capital market operations and trade lifecycle expertise and working familiarity with the corporate and investment banking business.
column7: >A working understanding of AML/KYC regulatory standards and processes in GBM jurisdictions
column9: >Sound judgment in identifying risks to proactively escalate with relevant senior management.

column3: >Professionalism, sensitivity, and discretion required, including stringent confidentiality requirements.
>Work Arrangement: This position is currently a Hybrid role. Please note that this is subject to change based on the needs of the business.

>Scotiabank wants you to be able to bring your best self to work – and life, every day. With a focus on holistic well-being, our many flexible benefit programs are designed to help support your unique family, financial, physical, mental, and social health needs.
